original: saṃvatsaro vai yajñaḥ prajāpatiḥ tasyaitaddvāraṃ yadamāvāsyā candramā eva🔽dvārapidhānaḥ / / /
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ vai yajñaḥ prajāpatiḥ tasya etat dvāram yat amāvāsyā candramāḥ eva  dvāra pidhānaḥ
translated: The sacrifice is the year, Prajapati. The new moon is its gate, the moon is the bolt of the gate.

original: sa yo'māvāsyāyāmagnī ādhatte yathā vivṛtāyāṃ dvāri dvārā puram prapadyeta sa tata
analyzed: sa yaḥ umāvāsyāyām agnī ādhatte yathā vivṛtāyām dvāri dvārā puram prapadyeta sa tata
translated: He who establishes the sacred fires on the new moon day, just as one would enter a city through an open gate, he goes to heaven from there.

original: eva svargaṃ lokamiyādevaṃ tadyo'māvāsyāyāmādhatte / / /
analyzed: eva svargam lokam iyāt evam tat yat amāvāsyāyām ādhatte
translated: So it is for one who establishes the fires on the new moon day.

original: atha yo nakṣatra ādhatte yathāpihitāyāṃ dvāryadvārā puram prapitsetsa jihmaḥ
analyzed: atha yaḥ nakṣatre ādhatte yathā apihitāyām dvāri a dvārā puram prapitset sa jihmaḥ
translated: Now he who establishes the fires under a lunar mansion, just as one would try to enter a city through a closed gate, he would be crooked.

original: puraḥ syādevaṃ tadyo nakṣatra ādhatte tasmānna nakṣatra ādadhīta / / /🔽yadaharevaiṣaḥ na purastānna paścāddṛśyeta tadaharupavasettarhi hyeṣa imaṃ
analyzed: puras syāt evam tat yaḥ nakṣatre ādhatte tasmāt na nakṣatre ādadhīta  yat ahar eva eṣaḥ na purastāt na paścāt dṛśyeta tat ahar upavaset tarhi hi eṣaḥ imam
translated: So it is for one who establishes the fires under a lunar mansion. Therefore one should not establish the fires under a lunar mansion.

original: lokamāgacati tasminniha vasati / / /
analyzed: lokam āgacati tasmin iha vasati
translated: On the very day when this (moon) is not seen either in front or behind, then one should fast, for then he comes to this world, and then he dwells here.

original: sarve devā vasanti sarvāṇi bhūtāni sarvā devatāḥ sarva ṛtavaḥ sarve stomāḥ sarvāṇi
analyzed: sarve devāḥ vasanti sarvāṇi bhūtāni sarvāḥ devatāḥ sarve ṛtavaḥ sarve stomāḥ sarvāṇi
translated: All the gods dwell, all beings, all deities, all seasons, all hymns, all

original: pṛṣṭhāni sarvāṇi candāṃsi / / /
analyzed: pṛṣṭhāni sarvāṇi candāṃsi
translated: Prsthas, all metres.

original: sarveṣu ha vā asya deveṣu sarveṣu bhūteṣu sarvāsu devatāsu sarveṣvṛtuṣu
analyzed: sarveṣu ha vai asya deveṣu sarveṣu bhūteṣu sarvāsu devatāsu sarveṣu ṛtuṣu
translated: In all his gods, in all beings, in all deities, in all seasons,

original: sarveṣu stomeṣu sarveṣu pṛṣṭheṣu sarveṣu candaḥsvagnī āhitau bhavato
analyzed: sarveṣu stomeṣu sarveṣu pṛṣṭheṣu sarveṣu candaḥsu agnī āhitau bhavataḥ
translated: In all Stomas, in all Prsthas, in all metres, the fires are set up.

original: yo'māvāsyāyāmādhatte tasmādamāvāsyāyāmevāgnī ādadhīta / / /🔽yo'sau vaiśākhasyāmāvāsyā tasyāmādadhīta sā rohiṇyā sampadyata ātmā vai prajā
analyzed: yaḥ umāvāsyāyām ādhatte tasmāt amāvāsyāyām eva agnī ādadhīta  yā asau vaiśākhasya amāvāsyā tasyām ādadhīta sā rohiṇyā sampadyate ātmā vai prajā
translated: He who sets them up on the new moon day, therefore one should set up the fires on the new moon day.

original: paśavo rohiṇyātmanyevaitatprajāyām paśuṣu pratitiṣṭhatyamāvāsyā vā
analyzed: paśavaḥ rohiṇī ātmani eva etat prajāyām paśuṣu pratitiṣṭhati amāvāsyā vā
translated: That new moon of Vaisakha, on that one should set them up. It coincides with Rohini. The people are the self, the cattle are Rohini. In the self, in the people, in the cattle, he thus establishes himself. The new moon

original: agnyādheyarūpaṃ tasmādamāvāsyāyāmevāgnī ādadhīta
analyzed: agnyādheya rūpam tasmāt amāvāsyāyām eva agnī ādadhīta
translated: is the form of the setting up of the fires. Therefore one should set up the fires on the new moon day.

original: paurṇamāsyāmanvārabhetāmāvāsyāyāṃ dīkṣeta / / /
analyzed: paurṇamāsyām anvārabheta amāvāsyāyām dīkṣeta
translated: He should attend to the full moon, he should consecrate himself on the new moon day.

original: ghnanti vā etadyajñam yadenaṃ tanvate yannveva rājānamabhiṣuṇvani tattaṃ
analyzed: ghnanti vai etat yajñam yat enam tanvate yat nu eva rājānam abhiṣuṇvani tat tam
translated: They slay the sacrifice, in that they spread it out. When they press the king, they slay him.

original: ghnanti yatpaśuṃ saṃjñapayanti viśāsati tattaṃ ghnantyulūkhalamusalābhyāṃ
analyzed: ghnanti yat paśum saṃjñapayanti viśāsati tat tam ghnanti ulūkhala musalābhyām
translated: When they kill the animal, they slay him. When they cut him up, they slay him with the mortar and pestle.

original: dṛṣadupalābhyāṃ haviryajñaṃ ghnanti / / /
analyzed: dṛṣad upalābhyām haviryajñam ghnanti
translated: With the stone and the lower millstone they slay the sacrifice of the oblation.

original: taṃ hatvā yajñam agnāveva yonau reto bhūtaṃ siñcatyagnirvai yoniryajñasya sa tataḥ
analyzed: tam hatvā yajñam agnau eva yonau retaḥ bhūtam siñcati agniḥ vai yoniḥ yajñasya sa tatas
translated: Having slain him, he pours the sacrifice, as seed, into Agni, the womb. The womb of the sacrifice is Agni. From that

original: prajāyate taddaśa tā āhutīḥ sampādayedyābhyo vaṣaṭkriyate / / /
analyzed: prajāyate tat daśa tāḥ āhutīḥ sampādayet yābhyaḥ vaṣaṭkriyate
translated: he is born. He should complete those ten oblations, for which the Vasat call is performed.

original: ayaṃ vai yajño yo'yam pavate so'yameka ivaiva pavate so'yam puruṣe'ntaḥ praviṣṭo
analyzed: ayam vai yajñaḥ yaḥ yam pavate saḥ ayam ekaḥ iva eva pavate saḥ ayam puruṣa intar praviṣṭaḥ
translated: This sacrifice which blows here, it blows as one only; it has entered into man

original: daśadhāvihitaḥ sa evam kLptaiḥ prāṇairagneryoneradhijāyate saiṣā daśākṣarā virāṭ
analyzed: daśadhā vihitaḥ saḥ evam klptaiḥ prāṇaiḥ agneḥ yoneḥ adhijāyate sā eṣā daśa akṣarā virāj
translated: and is divided into ten parts. It is born from the womb of Agni with the vital airs thus arranged. This is the Virâg of ten syllables,

original: saiṣā sampatsa yajñaḥ / / /🔽atho api nava syuḥ tannyūnāṃ virājaṃ karoti prajananāya nyūnādvā imāḥ prajāḥ
analyzed: sā eṣā sampad sa yajñaḥ  atha u api nava syuḥ tat nyūnām virājam karoti prajananāya nyūnāt vai imāḥ prajāḥ
translated: this is the perfection, this is the sacrifice.

original: prajāyante saiṣā sampatsa yajñaḥ / / /
analyzed: prajāyante sā eṣā sampad sa yajñaḥ
translated: Or there may be nine; then she makes Virâg deficient, for the sake of production; from the deficient are these creatures produced. This is the perfection, this is the sacrifice.

original: atho apyekātiriktā syāt sā prajāpatimabhyatiricyate saiṣā sampatsa yajñaḥ / / /
analyzed: atha u api ekā atiriktā syāt sā prajāpatim abhyatiricyate sā eṣā sampad sa yajñaḥ
translated: Or there may be one in excess; then she exceeds Pragâpati. This is the perfection, this is the sacrifice.

original: atho api dve atirikte syātām dvandvaṃ vai mithunam prajananam
analyzed: atha u api dve atirikte syātām dvandvam vai mithunam prajananam
translated: Or there may be two in excess; a pair is a productive union;

original: mithunamevaitatprajananaṃ kriyate saiṣā sampatsa yajñaḥ / / /
analyzed: mithunam eva etat prajananam kriyate sā eṣā sampad sa yajñaḥ
translated: a productive union is thus effected. This is the perfection, this is the sacrifice.

original: atho api tisro'tiriktā syuḥ dvandvamaha mithunam prajananamatha yajjāyate
analyzed: atha u api tisraḥ utiriktā syuḥ dvandvam aha mithunam prajananam atha yat jāyate
translated: Or there may be three in excess; a pair is a productive union, and what is born is

original: tattṛtīyaṃ saiṣā sampatsa yajñaḥ / / /
analyzed: tat tṛtīyam sā eṣā sampad sa yajñaḥ
translated: the third. This is the perfection, this is the sacrifice.

original: atho api catasro'tiriktāḥ syuḥ tadyathaikaivaṃ catasrastrayo vā ime lokāstadimāneva
analyzed: atha u api catasraḥ utiriktāḥ syuḥ tat yathā ekā evam catasraḥ trayaḥ vai ime lokāḥ tat imān eva
translated: Or there may be four in excess; as one, so four; or these worlds are three; this is these (worlds),

original: lokāṃstisṛbhirāpnoti prajāpatirvā atīmāṃlokāṃścaturthastatprajāpatimeva
analyzed: lokān tisṛbhiḥ āpnoti prajāpatiḥ vai ati imān lokān caturthaḥ tat prajāpatim eva
translated: By the three (verses) he obtains the three worlds; the fourth (verse) is Prajapati; by the fourth he obtains Prajapati.

original: caturthyāpnoti saiṣā sampatsa yajñaḥ / / /
analyzed: caturthyā āpnoti sā eṣā sampad sa yajñaḥ
translated: This is the perfection, namely, the sacrifice.

original: sa yaddvābhyāmūnaṃ tadūnaṃ so'yajño yatpañcabhiratiriktaṃ tadatiriktaṃ so'yajñaḥ
analyzed: sa yat dvābhyām ūnam tat ūnam saḥ yajñaḥ yat pañcabhiḥ atiriktam tat atiriktam saḥ yajñaḥ
translated: If it is deficient by two (verses), then it is deficient, that is not a sacrifice; if it is redundant by five (verses), then it is redundant, that is not a sacrifice.

original: saiṣaiva daśatyadhi sampadeṣā viṃśatyāmeṣā sahasrāt / / /
analyzed: sā eṣā eva daśati adhi sampad eṣā viṃśatyām eṣā sahasrāt
translated: This (sacrifice) is indeed the perfection of ten, of twenty, of a thousand.

original: ājiṃ vā ete dhāvanti ye darśapūrṇamāsābhyāṃ yajante sa vai pañcadaśa varṣāṇi yajeta
analyzed: ājim vai ete dhāvanti ye darśa pūrṇamāsābhyām yajante sa vai pañcadaśa varṣāṇi yajeta
translated: Those who sacrifice with the new and full moon sacrifices run a race. He should sacrifice for fifteen years.

original: teṣām pañcadaśānāṃ varṣāṇāṃ trīṇi ca śatāni ṣaṣṭiśca paurṇamāsyaścāmāvāsyāśca
analyzed: teṣām pañcadaśānām varṣāṇām trīṇi ca śatāni ṣaṣṭiḥ ca paurṇamāsyaḥ ca amāvāsyāḥ ca
translated: Of those fifteen years, there are three hundred and sixty full moons and new moons.

original: trīṇi ca vai śatāni ṣaṣṭiśca saṃvatsarasya rātrayastadrātrīrāpnoti / / /🔽athāparāṇi pañcadaśaiva varṣāṇi yajeta teṣām pañcadaśānāṃ varṣāṇāṃ trīṇi caiva
analyzed: trīṇi ca vai śatāni ṣaṣṭiḥ ca saṃvatsarasya rātrayaḥ tat rātrīḥ āpnoti  atha aparāṇi pañcadaśa eva varṣāṇi yajeta teṣām pañcadaśānām varṣāṇām trīṇi ca eva
translated: There are three hundred and sixty nights in a year; he obtains those nights.

original: śatāni ṣaṣṭiśca paurṇamāsyaścāmāvāsyāśca trīṇi ca vai śatāni ṣaṣṭiśca🔽saṃvatsarasyāhāni tadahānyāpnoti tadveva saṃvatsaramāpnoti / / /
analyzed: śatāni ṣaṣṭiḥ ca paurṇamāsyaḥ ca amāvāsyāḥ ca trīṇi ca vai śatāni ṣaṣṭiḥ ca 🔽saṃvatsarasya ahāni tat ahāni āpnoti tat u eva saṃvatsaram āpnoti
translated: Then he should sacrifice for another fifteen years. Of those fifteen years, there are three hundred and sixty full moons and new moons. There are three hundred and sixty days in a year; he obtains those days. He obtains that very year.

original: martyā ha vā agre devā āsuḥ sa yadaiva te saṃvatsaramāpurathāmṛtā āsuḥ sarvaṃ vai
analyzed: martyāḥ ha vai agre devāḥ āsuḥ sa yadā eva te saṃvatsaram āpuḥ atha amṛtāḥ āsuḥ sarvam vai
translated: In the beginning, indeed, men were the gods. When they obtained the year, then they became immortal. The year is everything;

original: saṃvatsaraḥ sarvaṃ vā akṣayyameteno hāsyākṣayyaṃ sukṛtam bhavatyakṣayyo lokaḥ / / /🔽sa ājisṛtāmekaḥ ya evaṃ vidvāṃstriṃśataṃ varṣāṇi yajate tasmādu triṃśatameva🔽varṣāṇi yajeta yadyu dākṣāyaṇayajñī syādatho api pañcadaśaiva varṣāṇi yajetātra
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ sarvam vai akṣayyam etena u ha asya akṣayyam sukṛtam bhavati akṣayyaḥ lokaḥ  saḥ āji sṛtām ekaḥ yaḥ evam vidvān triṃśatam varṣāṇi yajate tasmāt u triṃśatam eva  varṣāṇi yajeta yadi u dākṣāyaṇayajñī syāt atha u api pañcadaśa eva varṣāṇi yajeta atra
translated: For in the beginning men were the gods. When they obtained the year, then they became immortal. The year is everything; everything is imperishable. By this (sacrifice) his well-done becomes imperishable, his world imperishable.

original: hyeva sā sampatsampadyate dve hi paurṇamāsyau yajate dve amāvāsye atro eva khalu🔽sā sampadbhavati / / /
analyzed: hi eva sā sampad sampadyate dve hi paurṇamāsyau yajate dve amāvāsye atra u eva khalu  sā sampad bhavati
translated: Of those who go to the end of the year, he who, knowing thus, sacrifices for thirty years, is the one. Therefore one should sacrifice for thirty years. But if one is to perform the Daksha sacrifice, then one may sacrifice for fifteen years. For in this (sacrifice) that perfection is attained, for one performs two full moon sacrifices and two new moon sacrifices. In this (sacrifice) that perfection is attained.

original: paurṇamāseneṣṭvā indrāya vimṛdhe'nunirvapati tena yatheṣṭyaivaṃ yajata
analyzed: paurṇamāsena iṣṭvā indrāya tena yathā iṣṭyā evam yajata
translated: Having performed the full moon sacrifice, he offers a subsequent oblation to Indra, the destroyer. With that he sacrifices as at an Ishti.

original: āmāvāsyeneṣṭvādityai carumanunirvapati tena yatheṣṭyaivaṃ yajate / / /
analyzed: āmāvāsyena iṣṭvā adityai carum anunirvapati tena yathā iṣṭyā evam yajate
translated: Having performed the new moon sacrifice, he offers a subsequent oblation of cooked rice to the sun. With that he sacrifices as at an Ishti.

original: sa yatpaurṇamāseneṣṭvā indrāya vimṛdhe'nunirvapatīndro vai yajñasya
analyzed: sa yat paurṇamāsena iṣṭvā indrāya vimṛdhenu nirvapati indraḥ vai yajñasya
translated: When, having performed the full moon sacrifice, he offers a subsequent oblation to Indra, the destroyer, Indra is the beginning of the sacrifice,

original: devatāthaidagnīṣomīyam paurṇamāsaṃ havirbhavati tatra nendrāya tveti kiṃ cana
analyzed: devatā atha aidagnīṣomīyam paurṇamāsam haviḥ bhavati tatra na indrāya tvā iti kim cana
translated: Now, in the Full Moon sacrifice, the offering is to Agni-Soma. There is nothing like 'For Indra thee'.🔽

original: kriyata eteno hāsyaitatsendraṃ havirbhavatyetena sendro yajño'tha yadvimṛdhe tveti
analyzed: kriyate etena u ha asya etat sa indram haviḥ bhavati etena sa indraḥ yajñaḥ utha yat vimṛdhe tvā iti
translated: Now, the new and full moon offerings to Agni and Soma are the deities. There, nothing is done with the words For Indra or For Vritra. By this, his offering becomes accompanied by Indra, his sacrifice becomes accompanied by Indra. Then, when he offers with the words For Vritra,

original: sarvā u hi mṛdho nāṣṭrāḥ paurṇamāsena hanti / / /
analyzed: sarvāḥ u hi mṛdhaḥ nāṣṭrāḥ paurṇamāsena hanti
translated: for the full moon sacrifice destroys all enemies and dangers.

analyzed: atha yadā āmāvāsyena iṣṭvā adityai carum anunirvapati eṣa vai somaḥ rājā
translated: Now, when after performing the new moon sacrifice he offers the oblation to Aditi, that is King Soma,

analyzed: devānām annam yat candramāḥ sa yatra eṣaḥ etām rātrim na purastāt na paścāt dadṛśe
translated: the food of the gods, which is the moon. When it is not seen either in front or behind on that night,

analyzed: tena etat anaddhā iva haviḥ bhavati tena a pratiṣṭhitam iyam vai pṛthivī aditiḥ sā iyam addhā
translated: by that his offering becomes as if not covered, as if not established. This earth is Aditi. It is covered,

original: seyam pratiṣṭhitaiteno hāsyaitadaddheva havirbhavatyetena pratiṣṭhitametannu
analyzed: sā iyam pratiṣṭhitā etena u ha asya etat addhā iva haviḥ bhavati etena pratiṣṭhitam etat nu

analyzed: tat yasmāt anunirvapati atha yasmāt na anunirvapet
translated: Now, why he offers subsequently, and why he should not offer subsequently.

analyzed: sa yat paurṇamāsena iṣṭvā indrāya sa indraḥ me yajñaḥ sat iti
translated: When he has performed the full moon sacrifice and offers subsequently to Indra Vritrahan, thinking May my sacrifice be accompanied by Indra, the whole

analyzed: vai yajñaḥ indrasya eva sa yat sarvaḥ yajñaḥ indrasya eva etena u ha asya etat sa indram
translated: The whole sacrifice belongs to Indra. By this (offering) he makes this (sacrifice) of his to be accompanied by Indra.

original: havirbhavatyetena sendro yajñaḥ / / /
analyzed: haviḥ bhavati etena sa indraḥ yajñaḥ
translated: The whole sacrifice belongs to Indra. By this (offering) his oblation becomes connected with Indra, his sacrifice becomes connected with Indra.

original: atha yadāmāvāsyeneṣṭvā adityai carumanunirvapatyāmāvāsyaṃ vā anunirvāpyam
analyzed: atha yadā āmāvāsyena iṣṭvā adityai carum anunirvapati āmāvāsyam vai anunirvāpyam
translated: Now when, after performing the new-moon sacrifice, he prepares the rice-pap for Aditi, the new-moon sacrifice is to be performed after (the full-moon sacrifice).

analyzed: paurṇamāsena vai indraḥ vṛtram ahan tasmai etat vṛtram jaghnuṣe devā
translated: For by the full-moon sacrifice Indra slew Vrtra. For him, the gods who had slain Vrtra,

analyzed: etat haviḥ anuniravapan yadā āmāvāsyam kim anunirvāpya inunirvapet iti
translated: prepared this oblation after (the full-moon sacrifice), namely the new-moon sacrifice. What should one offer after the new-moon sacrifice?

original: tasam /nnānunirvapet / / /
analyzed: tasamn na anunirvapet
translated: He should not offer anything after it.

original: sa yatpaurṇamāseneṣṭvā
analyzed: sa yat paurṇamāsena iṣṭvā
translated: For when, after performing the full-moon sacrifice,

translated: he prepares another oblation after it, and when, after performing the new-moon sacrifice, he prepares another oblation after it,

analyzed: ha sa bhrātṛvyam yaḥ paurṇamāsīm yajata

translated: on the new-moon day, and with the new-moon sacrifice on the full-moon day, his glory is free from rivals, unobstructed.

analyzed: paurṇamāsena vai devāḥ paurṇamāsīm yajamānāḥ āmāvāsyena amāvāsyām kṣipre eva
translated: For by the full-moon sacrifice the gods, sacrificing on the full-moon day, and by the new-moon sacrifice on the new-moon day, quickly🔽destroyed evil and were quickly born again. He who, knowing thus, with the full-moon sacrifice

original: pāpmānamapāghnata kṣipre prājāyanta sa yo haivaṃ vidvānpaurṇamāsenaiva

translated: Now, of the after-sacrifice and of the one after sunrise.🔽There, some, having seen it, observe the fast, thinking It will rise for us tomorrow, either because of a cloud or without knowing.

analyzed: puroḍāśam śrapayati

analyzed: śipiviṣṭāya etān taṇḍulān cūte carum śrapayati caruḥ u hi eva sa yatra kva ca
translated: the all-pervading. He cooks those rice grains and the curd together to make a gruel, for a gruel indeed is that

translated: As to why it is so, this king Soma is indeed the food of the gods,🔽which is the moon. He approached that, he obtained it, and Agni, the giver, gives it to him, Indra, the bestower,

translated: he performs the sacrifice. Then as to why (he offers) to Vishnu, the all-pervading, Vishnu is indeed the sacrifice, and as to why (he offers) to the all-pervading,🔽he approached that, he obtained it, and the sacrifice becomes as if cut off, therefore (he offers) to the all-pervading. There he should give

translated: or a cow or a mare gives birth, for in the year Prajapati was born. He broke open that golden egg.

original: vyarujannāha tarhi kā cana pratiṣṭhāsa tadenamidameva hiraṇmayamāṇḍaṃ
analyzed: vyarujan āha tarhi kā cana pratiṣṭhā āsa tat enam idam eva hiraṇmayam āṇḍam
translated: There was no support then. He floated on this very golden egg,

translated: In the year he desired to come forth. He uttered 'Bhūr'. This earth was produced. 'Bhuvaḥ'

analyzed: tat itam antarikṣam abhavat svar iti sā asau dyauḥ abhavat tasmāt u saṃvatsaraḥ eva kumāraḥ
translated: This atmosphere was produced. 'Svaḥ' This heaven was produced. Therefore, in the year, a boy

analyzed: vyājihīrṣati saṃvatsare hi prajāpatiḥ vyāharat  sa vai eka akṣara dvi akṣarāṇi eva prathamam
translated: for in the year Prajapati desired to speak.🔽He, Prajapati, first spoke syllables of one and two letters.

original: vadanprajāpatiravadattasmādekākṣaradvyakṣarāṇyeva prathamaṃ vadankumāro🔽vadati / / /
analyzed: vadan prajāpatiḥ avadat tasmāt eka akṣara dvi akṣarāṇi eva prathamam vadan kumāraḥ  vadati
translated: Therefore, a child first speaks syllables of one and two letters.

original: tāni vā /etāni pañcākṣarāṇi tānpañcartūnakuruta ta ime pañcartavaḥ sa🔽evamimāṃlokānjātāntsaṃvatsare prajāpatirabhyudatiṣṭhattasmādu saṃvatsara eva
analyzed: tāni vai etāni pañca akṣarāṇi tān pañca ṛtūn akuruta te ime pañca ṛtavaḥ sa  evam imān lokān jātān saṃvatsare prajāpatiḥ abhyudatiṣṭhat tasmāt u saṃvatsaraḥ eva

analyzed: tasmāt etasmāt prāṇāt sarve prāṇāḥ bībhatsantetha yat sviṣṭakṛte sarveṣām
translated: Therefore all these vital airs are disgusted with this vital air. Then when he cuts off (portions) of all the

original: haviṣāmavadyati tasmādyatkiṃ cemānprāṇānāpadyata etameva tatsarvaṃ samavaiti / / /
analyzed: haviṣām avadyati tasmāt yat kim ca imān prāṇān āpadyate etam eva tat sarvam samavaiti
translated: sacrificial viands for the Svistakṛt offering, whatever befalls these vital airs, all that he makes whole again.

original: trīṇi śiśnāni ta eva trayo'nuyājāḥ sa yo'yaṃ varṣiṣṭho'nuyājastadidaṃ
analyzed: trīṇi śiśnāni te eva trayaḥ anuyājāḥ sa yaḥ yam varṣiṣṭhaḥ anuyājaḥ tat idam
translated: There are three male organs, they are the same as the three Anuyājas. That which is this highest Anuyāja, that is this

original: varṣiṣṭhamiva śiśnaṃ taṃ vā anavānanyajedityāhustatho hāsyaitadamṛdhram
analyzed: varṣiṣṭham iva śiśnam tam vai an avānan yajet iti āhuḥ tathā u ha asya etat amṛdhram
translated: highest, as it were, male organ. He should offer it without interruption, they say. Thus it becomes irreproachable for him,

original: bhavatīti / / /
analyzed: bhavati iti
translated: they say.

original: sa vai sakṛdavānyāt ekaṃ hyetasya parvātha yadaparvakaṃ syātpratṛṇaṃ vaiva
analyzed: sa vai sakṛt avānyāt ekam hi etasya parva atha yat aparvakam syāt pratṛṇam vā eva
translated: He should offer it once, for this (male organ) has only one joint. If it were without a joint, it would either be like a straw

original: tiṣṭhellambeta vā tasmādetaducca tiṣṭati padyate ca tasmātsakṛdavānyāt / / /🔽dvau bāhū dvā ūrū ta eva catvāraḥ patnīsaṃyājāḥ pratiṣṭhāyameva prāṇa iḍā yattāṃ
analyzed: tiṣṭhet lambeta vā tasmāt etat ucca tiṣṭati padyate ca tasmāt sakṛt avānyāt  dvau bāhū dvau ūrū te eva catvāraḥ patnīsaṃyājāḥ pratiṣṭhā ayam eva prāṇaḥ iḍā yattām
translated: or hang down. Therefore it stands high and moves. Therefore he should offer it once.

original: nāgnau juhoti yatsāpradagdheva tasmādayamanavatṛṇaḥ prāṇaḥ / / /
analyzed: na agnau juhoti yat sā a pradagdhā iva tasmāt ayam an avatṛṇaḥ prāṇaḥ
translated: There are two arms and two thighs, they are the same as the four Patnīsaṃyājas. This earth is the Prāṇa, the Iḍā. Because he does not offer it in the fire, it is as if it were not burned. Therefore this Prāṇa is without grass.

original: asthyeva yājyānuvākyāḥ māṃsaṃ havistanmitaṃ cando yadyājyānuvākyāstasmādu
analyzed: asthi eva yājyā anuvākyāḥ māṃsam haviḥ tad mitam candaḥ yat yājyā anuvākyāḥ tasmāt u
translated: The Yājyā and Anuvākyās are the bones, the oblation is the flesh. The Yājyā and Anuvākyās are the same as the measured Chandas. Therefore the Yājyā and Anuvākyās are the bones, the oblation is the flesh.

original: samāvantyevāsthīni medyataśca kṛśyataśca bhavantyatha yadbhūya iva ca havirgṛhṇāti
analyzed: samāvanti eva asthīni medyataḥ ca kṛśyataḥ ca bhavanti atha yat bhūyaḥ iva ca haviḥ gṛhṇāti
translated: The bones of him who is fattened and of him who is emaciated become equally strong. And because he takes more material for the oblation,

original: kanīya iva ca tasmādu māṃsānyeva medyato medyanti māṃsāni kṛśyataḥ kṛśyanti
analyzed: kanīyaḥ iva ca tasmāt u māṃsāni eva medyataḥ medyanti māṃsāni kṛśyataḥ kṛśyanti
translated: therefore the flesh of him who is fattened becomes fat, and the flesh of him who is emaciated becomes emaciated.

original: tenaitena yajñena yāṃ kāmayate devatāṃ tāṃ yajati yasyai havirbhavati / / /
analyzed: tena etena yajñena yām kāmayate devatām tām yajati yasyai haviḥ bhavati
translated: By that sacrifice he worships whichever deity he desires, for whomsoever the oblation is.

original: tā vā etāḥ anapoddhāryā āhutayo bhavanti sa
analyzed: tāḥ vai etāḥ an apoddhāryāḥ āhutayaḥ bhavanti sa
translated: These oblations are not to be omitted.

original: yaddhaitāsāmapoddharedyathaikamaṅgaṃ śṛṇīyātprāṇaṃ vā nirhaṇyādevaṃ
analyzed: yat ha etāsām apoddharet yathā ekam aṅgam śṛṇīyāt prāṇam vā nirhaṇyāt evam
translated: If he were to omit any of them, it would be as if he were to cut off a limb or to take out the life.

original: tadanyānyeva havīṃṣyupa cāhriyante'pa ca hriyante / / /🔽tā vā etāḥ ṣoḍaśāhutayo bhavanti ṣoḍaśakalo vai puruṣaḥ puruṣo
analyzed: tat anyāni eva havīṃṣi upa ca āhriyanta ipa ca hriyante  tāḥ vai etāḥ ṣoḍaśa āhutayaḥ bhavanti ṣoḍaśa kalaḥ vai puruṣaḥ puruṣaḥ
translated: Other oblations are brought up and taken away.🔽These are sixteen oblations. Man has sixteen parts, man is the sacrifice.

original: yajñastasmātṣoḍaśāhutayo bhavanti / / /
analyzed: yajñaḥ tasmāt ṣoḍaśa āhutayaḥ bhavanti
translated: Therefore there are sixteen oblations.

original: tadvā ado vratopāyana udyate yadi nāśnāti pitṛdevatyo bhavati yadyu aśnāti
analyzed: tat vai adaḥ vrata upāyane udyate yadi na aśnāti pitṛ devatyaḥ bhavati yadi u aśnāti
translated: Now, the observance is undertaken. If he does not eat, he becomes connected with the fathers. If he eats,

original: devānatyaśnātīti tadāraṇyamaśnīyāditi tatra sthāpayanti / / /
analyzed: devān atyaśnāti iti tadā āraṇyam aśnīyāt iti tatra sthāpayanti
translated: he eats before the gods. Therefore he should eat forest produce. They keep it there.

original: sa yadi grāmyā oṣadhīraśnāti puroḍāśasya medhamaśnāti yadyāraṇyā oṣadhīraśnāti🔽barhiṣo medhamaśnāti yadi vānaspatyamaśnātīdhmasya medhamaśnāti yadi payaḥ
analyzed: sa yadi grāmyāḥ oṣadhīḥ aśnāti puroḍāśasya medham aśnāti yadi āraṇyāḥ oṣadhīḥ aśnāti  barhiṣaḥ medham aśnāti yadi vānaspatyam aśnāti idhmasya medham aśnāti yadi payaḥ
translated: If he eats cultivated plants, he eats the essence of the sacrificial cake. If he eats wild plants,🔽he eats the essence of the sacrificial grass. If he eats anything from a tree, he eats the essence of the fuel. If he drinks milk,

original: pibati sāṃnāyyasya cājyasya ca medhamaśnāti yadyapaḥ pibati praṇītānām
analyzed: pibati sāṃnāyyasya ca ājyasya ca medham aśnāti yadi apaḥ pibati praṇītānām
translated: he eats the essence of the Sāṁnāyya and the ghee. If he drinks water, he eats the essence of the water offered to the gods.

original: medhamaśnāti yadi nāśnāti pitṛdevatyo bhavati / / /
analyzed: medham aśnāti yadi na aśnāti pitṛ devatyaḥ bhavati
translated: If he does not eat, he becomes connected with the Pitrs.

original: tadāhuḥ kimayanamiti svayaṃ haivaite rātrī agnihotraṃ juhuyātsa yaddhutvā prāśnāti
analyzed: tat āhuḥ kim ayanam iti svayam ha eva ete rātrī agnihotram juhuyāt sa yat hutvā prāśnāti
translated: Regarding this, they say: What is the procedure? He should himself offer the Agnihotra on those nights. Having offered, he should eat.

original: tenāpitṛdevatyo bhavatyāhutirvā eṣā sa yadevaitāmātmannāhutiṃ juhoti teno eteṣām
analyzed: tena a pitṛ devatyaḥ bhavati āhutiḥ vai eṣā sa yat eva etām ātman āhutim juhoti tena u eteṣām
translated: By that he does not become connected with the Pitrs. This is indeed an oblation. In that he offers this oblation into himself, by that

original: medhānāṃ nāśnāti / / /
analyzed: medhānām na aśnāti
translated: he does not eat of those essences.

original: ete ha vai rātrī sarvā rātrayaḥ samavayanti yā āpūryamāṇapakṣasya rātrayastāḥ sarvāḥ🔽paurṇamāsīṃ samavayanti yā apakṣīyamāṇapakṣasya rātrayastāḥ sarvā amāvāsyāṃ
analyzed: ete ha vai rātrī sarvāḥ rātrayaḥ samavayanti yāḥ āpūryamāṇapakṣasya rātrayaḥ tāḥ sarvāḥ  paurṇamāsīm samavayanti yāḥ apakṣīyamāṇapakṣasya rātrayaḥ tāḥ sarvāḥ amāvāsyām
translated: These two nights include all the nights. The nights of the waxing half-month all come together in the full moon.

original: samavayanti sa yo haivaṃ vidvāntsvayamupavasathe juhoti sarvadā haivāsya svayaṃ
analyzed: samavayanti sa yaḥ ha evam vidvān svayam upavasathe juhoti sarvadā ha eva asya svayam
translated: The nights of the waning half-month all come together in the new moon. He who, knowing thus, offers himself on the Upavasatha, for him it is always himself.

original: hutam bhavati / / /🔽devāśca vā asurāśca ubhaye prājāpatyāḥ paspṛdhire tato'surā atimānenaiva kasminnu
analyzed: hutam bhavati  devāḥ ca vai asurāḥ ca ubhaye prājāpatyāḥ paspṛdhire tatas usurāḥ atimānena eva kasmin nu
translated: is offered.

original: vayaṃ juhuyāmeti sveṣvevāsyeṣu juhvataśceruste'timānenaiva
analyzed: vayam juhuyāma iti sveṣu eva āsyeṣu juhvataḥ ceruḥ tetimānena eva
translated: The gods and the Asuras, both of them sprung from Prajapati, contended. Then the Asuras, through mere haughtiness, (said), 'In whom shall we offer?' They went on offering in their own fires. Through mere haughtiness

original: parābabhūvustasmānnātimanyeta parābhavasya haitanmukhaṃ yadatimānaḥ / / /
analyzed: parābabhūvuḥ tasmāt na atimanyeta parābhavasya ha etat mukham yat atimānaḥ
translated: they were overcome. Therefore one should not be haughty, for this is the door of defeat, haughtiness.

original: atha devāḥ anyo'nyasminneva juhvataścerustebhyaḥ prajāpatirātmānam pradadau
analyzed: atha devāḥ anyonyasmin eva juhvataḥ ceruḥ tebhyaḥ prajāpatiḥ ātmānam pradadau
translated: Then the gods went on offering in one another's (fires). To them Prajapati gave himself.

original: yajño haiṣāmāsa yajño hi devānāmannaṃ / / /
analyzed: yajñaḥ ha eṣām āsa yajñaḥ hi devānām annam
translated: The sacrifice was theirs, for the sacrifice is the food of the gods.

original: sa devebhya ātmānam pradāya athaitamātmanaḥ pratimāmasṛjata yadyajñaṃ
analyzed: sa devebhyaḥ ātmānam pradāya atha etam ātmanaḥ pratimām asṛjata yat yajñam
translated: Having given himself to the gods, he then created this image of himself, the sacrifice.

original: tasmādāhuḥ prajāpatiryajña ityātmano hyetam pratimāmasṛjata / / /🔽sa etena yajñena devebhya ātmānaṃ nirakrīṇīta sa yadvratamupaiti yathaiva
analyzed: tasmāt āhuḥ prajāpatiḥ yajñaḥ iti ātmanaḥ hi etam pratimām asṛjata  saḥ etena yajñena devebhyaḥ ātmānam nirakrīṇīta sa yat vratam upaiti yathā eva
translated: Therefore they say, 'The sacrifice is Prajapati,' for he created this image of himself.🔽He redeemed himself by this sacrifice from the gods. When he undertakes the vow,

original: tatprajāpatirdevebhya ātmānam prāyacadevamevaiṣa etaddevebhya ātmānam
analyzed: tat prajāpatiḥ devebhyaḥ ātmānam prāyacat evam eva eṣa etat devebhyaḥ ātmānam
translated: just as Prajapati then gave himself to the gods, so does he thereby give himself to the gods.

original: prayacati tasmādu saṃyata evaitāṃ rātriṃ cicariṣedyathā haviṣā caredevaṃ havirhyeṣa
analyzed: prayacati tasmāt u saṃyataḥ eva etām rātrim cicariṣet yathā haviṣā caret evam haviḥ hi eṣa
translated: He gives it away; therefore one should pass this night as if bound, as if one were to pass it with an oblation, for it is an oblation.

original: devānām bhavati / / /
analyzed: devānām bhavati
translated: He gives it away; therefore one should pass this night as if bound, as if he were passing it with an oblation, for it is an oblation to the gods.

original: atha yadyajñaṃ tanute yajñenaivaitaddevebhya ātmānaṃ niṣkrīṇīte yathaiva
analyzed: atha yat yajñam tanute yajñena eva etat devebhyaḥ ātmānam niṣkrīṇīte yathā eva
translated: Now when he performs the sacrifice, he ransoms himself from the gods by the sacrifice, just as🔽he did.

original: tatprajāpatirnirakrīṇītaivamatha yaddhavirnirvapati haviṣaivaitadyajñaṃ niṣkrīṇāti
analyzed: tat prajāpatiḥ nirakrīṇīta evam atha yat haviḥ nirvapati haviṣā eva etat yajñam niṣkrīṇāti
translated: Now when he pours out the oblation, he ransoms the sacrifice by the oblation.

original: haviranuvākyayānuvākyāmavadānenāvadānaṃ yājyayā yājyāṃ vaṣaṭkāreṇa
analyzed: haviḥ anuvākyayā anuvākyām avadānena avadānam yājyayā yājyām vaṣaṭkāreṇa
translated: The oblation by the invitatory prayer, the invitatory prayer by the portion (of the cake), the portion by the offering prayer, the offering prayer by the Vasat call,

original: vaṣaṭkāramāhutyā tasyāhutirevāniṣkrītā bhavati / / /🔽sa yathāgrapraśīrṇo vṛkṣaḥ evamasyaiṣa yajño bhavatyāhutimevānvāhāryeṇa
analyzed: vaṣaṭkāram āhutyā tasya āhutiḥ eva a niṣkrītā bhavati  sa yathā agra praśīrṇaḥ vṛkṣaḥ evam asya eṣa yajñaḥ bhavati āhutim eva anvāhāryeṇa
translated: the Vasat call by the oblation. But the oblation remains unredeemed.

original: niṣkrīṇāti tadyadetaddhīnaṃ yajñasyānvāharati tasmādanvāhāryo nāmaivamu🔽hāsyaiṣa sarva eva yajño niṣkrīto bhavatyeṣa ha vai yajamānasyāmuṣmiṃloka ātmā
analyzed: niṣkrīṇāti tat yat etat hīnam yajñasya anvāharati tasmāt anvāhāryaḥ nāma evam u  ha asya eṣa sarvaḥ eva yajñaḥ niṣkrītaḥ bhavati eṣa ha vai yajamānasya amuṣmin loke ātmā
translated: As a tree whose top has been cut off, so is his sacrifice. By the Anvâhârya (after-oblation) he ransoms the oblation. Because he brings to it what is deficient in the sacrifice, therefore it is called Anvâhârya (to be brought to it). Thus🔽his whole sacrifice is ransomed. For this sacrifice becomes the sacrificer's self in yonder world. He who thus

original: bhavati yadyajña sa ha sarvatanūreva yajamāno'muṣmiṃloke sambhavati ya evaṃ
analyzed: bhavati yat yajña sa ha sarva tanūḥ eva yajamānaḥ amuṣmin loke sambhavati yaḥ evam
translated: becomes in yonder world with his whole body the sacrificer, who thus

original: vidvānniṣkrītyā yajate / / /
analyzed: vidvān niṣkrītyā yajate
translated: The learned one sacrifices by redeeming himself.

original: trirha vai puruṣo jāyate etannveva mātuścādhi pituścāgre jāyate'tha yaṃ yajña
analyzed: tris ha vai puruṣaḥ jāyate etat nu eva mātuḥ ca adhi pituḥ ca agre yam yajña
translated: A man is born three times, they say. First, he is born from his mother and father. Then,

original: upanamati sa yadyajate taddvitīyaṃ jāyate'tha yatra mriyate
analyzed: upanamati sa yat yajate tat dvitīyam jāyate itha yatra mriyate
translated: when he is initiated into the sacrifice and sacrifices, that is his second birth. Then, where he dies

original: yatrainamagnāvabhyādadhati sa yattataḥ sambhavati tattṛtīyaṃ jāyate tasmāttriḥ
analyzed: yatra enam agnau abhyādadhati sa yat tatas sambhavati tat tṛtīyam jāyate tasmāt tris
translated: and they place him in the fire, when he is born from that, that is his third birth. Therefore,

original: puruṣo jāyata ityāhuḥ / / /
analyzed: puruṣaḥ jāyate iti āhuḥ
translated: they say a man is born three times.

original: tā vā etāḥ ekādaśa sāmidhenīranvāha daśa vā ime puruṣe prāṇā ātmaikādaśo
analyzed: tāḥ vai etāḥ ekādaśa sāmidhenīḥ anvāha daśa vai ime puruṣe prāṇāḥ ātmā ekādaśaḥ
translated: He recites these eleven kindling verses. There are ten vital breaths in a man, the self is the eleventh,

original: yasminnete prāṇāḥ pratiṣṭhitā etāvānvai puruṣastadenaṃ kṛtsnaṃ janayatyatha
analyzed: yasmin ete prāṇāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ etāvān vai puruṣaḥ tat enam kṛtsnam janayati atha
translated: in which these vital breaths are established. So much is a man. He generates him completely. Then,

original: yadūrdhvaṃ sāmidhenībhyaḥ sā pratiṣṭhā tadenaṃ janayitvā pratiṣṭhāpayati / / /🔽nava prasavasya vyāhṛtayaḥ navame puruṣe prāṇāstadenaṃ dvitīyaṃ
analyzed: yat ūrdhvam sāmidhenībhyaḥ sā pratiṣṭhā tat enam janayitvā pratiṣṭhāpayati  nava prasavasya vyāhṛtayaḥ navame puruṣe prāṇāḥ tat enam dvitīyam
translated: what is above the kindling verses, that is the foundation. Having generated him, he establishes him.

original: janayatyāśrāvaṇam pratyāśrāvaṇaṃ sā pratiṣṭhātha yadevādaḥ sṛṣṭau janmodyate
analyzed: janayati āśrāvaṇam pratyāśrāvaṇam sā pratiṣṭhā atha yat eva adaḥ sṛṣṭau janma udyate
translated: There are nine utterances of the creation, nine vital breaths in a man. He generates him a second time. The calling out and the response, that is the foundation. Then, what is born in the creation here,

original: tadenaṃ tṛtīyaṃ janayati patnīsaṃyājā eva tatra pratiṣṭhā / / /
analyzed: tat enam tṛtīyam janayati patnīsaṃyājāḥ eva tatra pratiṣṭhā
translated: He begets him a third time. The Patnīsaṃyājas are the support there.

original: trirhi vai puruṣo jāyate evamevainametadyajñāttrirjanayati tāsāmekādaśānāṃ triḥ
analyzed: tris hi vai puruṣaḥ jāyate evam eva enam etat yajñāt tris janayati tāsām ekādaśānām tris
translated: For a man is born three times. In the same way he begets him three times from the sacrifice. Of those eleven,

original: prathamāmanvāha triruttamām / / /
analyzed: prathamām anvāha tris uttamām
translated: he recites the first three times, the last three times.

original: tāḥ pañcadaśa sāmidhenyaḥ dvāvāghārau pañca prayājā iḍā trayo'nuyājāḥ
analyzed: tāḥ pañcadaśa sāmidhenyaḥ dvau āghārau pañca prayājāḥ iḍā trayaḥ anuyājāḥ
translated: There are fifteen Sāmidhenīs, two Āghāras, five Prayājas, the Iḍā, three Anuyājas,

original: sūktavākaśca śamyorvākaśca tāstrayodaśāhutayo'tha yadevādaḥ patnīsaṃyājeṣu
analyzed: sūktavākaḥ ca śamyorvākaḥ ca tāḥ trayodaśa āhutayaḥ utha yat eva adaḥ patnīsaṃyājeṣu
translated: the Sūktavāka and the Samyorvāka. Those are thirteen oblations. Then what he takes up in the Patnīsaṃyājas

original: sampragṛhṇāti samiṣṭayajuśca / / /
analyzed: sampragṛhṇāti samiṣṭa yajuḥ ca
translated: and the Samiṣṭayajus.

original: tāḥ pañcadaśāhutayaḥ tāsām pañcadaśānāmāhutīnāmetā anuvākyā etāḥ pañcadaśa
analyzed: tāḥ pañcadaśa āhutayaḥ tāsām pañcadaśānām āhutīnām etāḥ anuvākyāḥ etāḥ pañcadaśa
translated: Those are fifteen oblations. Of those fifteen oblations, these are the Anuvākyās, these fifteen

original: sāmidhenya etāsāmanuvākyānāmetā yājyā ya evātra mantro yo
analyzed: sāmidhenyaḥ etāsām anuvākyānām etāḥ yājyāḥ yaḥ eva atra mantraḥ yaḥ
translated: Sāmidhenīs. Of those Anuvākyās, these are the Yājyās, whatever mantra

original: nigadastadyājyārūpameteno hāsyaitā āhutayo'nuvākyavatyo bhavantyetābhiḥ
analyzed: nigadaḥ tat yājyā rūpam etena u ha asya etāḥ āhutayaḥ unuvākyavatyaḥ bhavanti etābhiḥ
translated: there is, whatever Nigada, that is the form of the Yājyā. By that these oblations of his become endowed with Anuvākyā.

original: sāmidhenībhiretābhirāhutibhiretā anuvākyā yājyavatyaścāhutivatyaśca bhavanti / / /
analyzed: sāmidhenībhiḥ etābhiḥ āhutibhiḥ etāḥ anuvākyāḥ yājyavatyaḥ ca āhutivatyaḥ ca bhavanti
translated: By these Sāmidhenīs, by these oblations, these Anuvākyās become endowed with Yājyās and oblations.

original: gāyatrīmanuvākyāmanvāha tripadā vai gāyatrī traya ime lokā imānevaitallokāndevāḥ🔽pratyaṣṭhāpayan / / /🔽atha triṣṭubhā yajati catuṣpadā vai triṣṭupcatuṣpādāḥ paśavastatpaśūnevaitadeṣu
analyzed: gāyatrīm anuvākyām anvāha tri padā vai gāyatrī trayaḥ ime lokāḥ imān eva etat lokān devāḥ  pratyaṣṭhāpayan  atha triṣṭubhā yajati catuṣpadā vai triṣṭubh catuṣpādāḥ paśavaḥ tat paśūn eva etat eṣu
translated: He recites the Gâyatrî Anuvâkyâ (invitatory prayer),--the Gâyatrî consists of three feet, and these worlds are three: the gods thereby established these worlds.

original: lokeṣu pratiṣṭhiteṣu devāḥ pratyaṣṭhāpayan / / /
analyzed: lokeṣu pratiṣṭhiteṣu devāḥ pratyaṣṭhāpayan
translated: Then he offers with a Trishtubh verse,--the Trishtubh consists of four feet, and cattle are four-footed: the gods thereby established the cattle in these worlds which had been established.

original: dvyakṣaro vaṣaṭkāraḥ dvipādvai puruṣastatpuruṣamevaitaddvipādameṣu paśuṣu🔽pratiṣṭhiteṣu pratyaṣṭhāpayan / / /
analyzed: dvi akṣaraḥ vaṣaṭkāraḥ dvipād vai puruṣaḥ tat puruṣam eva etat dvipādam eṣu paśuṣu  pratiṣṭhiteṣu pratyaṣṭhāpayan
translated: The Vashat-call consists of two syllables, and man is two-footed: the gods thereby established man, who is two-footed, among the cattle which had been established.

original: so'yaṃ dvipātpuruṣaḥ paśuṣu pratiṣṭhita evamevaiṣa etallokānpratiṣṭhāpayati🔽lokeṣu pratiṣṭhiteṣu paśūnpratiṣṭhāpayati paśuṣu pratiṣṭhiteṣvātmānam
analyzed: saḥ ayam dvipād puruṣaḥ paśuṣu pratiṣṭhitaḥ evam eva eṣa etat lokān pratiṣṭhāpayati  lokeṣu pratiṣṭhiteṣu paśūn pratiṣṭhāpayati paśuṣu pratiṣṭhiteṣu ātmānam
translated: And thus this two-footed man is established among the cattle. In like manner does he now establish the worlds;

original: pratiṣṭhāpayatyevameṣa puruṣaḥ paśuṣu pratiṣṭhito ya evaṃ vidvānyajate / / /🔽atha yadvaṣaṭkṛte juhoti eṣa vai vaṣaṭkāro ya eṣa tapati sa eṣa
analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpayati evam eṣa puruṣaḥ paśuṣu pratiṣṭhitaḥ yaḥ evam vidvān yajate  atha yat vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti eṣa vai vaṣaṭkāraḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati saḥ eṣa
translated: and in the established worlds he establishes the cattle; and in the established cattle he establishes himself. Thus established among the cattle is that man who, knowing this, performs the sacrifice.

original: mṛtyustadenamupariṣṭānmṛtyoḥ saṃskaroti tadenamato janayati sa etam
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ tat enam upariṣṭāt mṛtyoḥ saṃskaroti tat enam atas janayati saḥ etam
translated: And as to why he offers when the Vashat has been uttered,--that Vashat-call, doubtless, is he (the sun) who shines yonder, and he is Death: he thus makes him (the sacrificer) to be composed above death; he thus causes him to be born from out of this (earth).🔽And, again, as to why he offers when the Vashat has been uttered;--

original: mṛtyumatimucyate yajño vā asyātmā bhavati tadyajña eva
analyzed: mṛtyum atimucyate yajñaḥ vai asya ātmā bhavati tat yajñaḥ eva
translated: Death is indeed the sacrifice. It becomes the self of this (sacrificer). In that (sacrifice),

original: bhūtvaitanmṛtyumatimucyata eteno hāsya sarve yajñakratava etam mṛtyumatimuktāḥ / / /
analyzed: bhūtvā etat mṛtyum atimucyate etena u ha asya sarve yajñakratavaḥ etam mṛtyum atimuktāḥ
translated: Death is overcome by the sacrifice. The sacrifice becomes his self. Having become the sacrifice, he overcomes death by it. By it all the sacrificial rites are freed from death.

original: atha yāmetāmāhutiṃ juhoti eṣā ha vā asyāhutiramuṣmiṃloka ātmā bhavati sa🔽yadaivaṃvidasmāllokātpraityathainameṣāhutiretasya pṛṣṭhe satyāhvayatyehyahaṃ vai
analyzed: atha yām etām āhutim juhoti eṣā ha vai asya āhutiḥ amuṣmin loke ātmā bhavati sa  yadā evaṃvid asmāt lokāt praiti atha enam eṣā āhutiḥ etasya pṛṣṭhe satyā āhvayati ehi aham vai
translated: Then when he offers this oblation, this oblation becomes his self in yonder world.🔽When he who knows thus departs from this world, then this oblation, being on his back, calls him, 'Come, I am

original: ta ihātmāsmīti tadyadāhvayati tasmādāhutirnāma / / /🔽brahma vā idamagra āsīt taddevānasṛjata taddevāntsṛṣṭvaiṣu lokeṣu
analyzed: te iha ātmā asmi iti tat yat āhvayati tasmāt āhutiḥ nāma  brahma vai idam agre āsīt tat devān asṛjata tat devān sṛṣṭvā eṣu lokeṣu
translated: your self here.' In that it calls, therefore it is called an oblation.

original: vyārohayadasminneva loke'gniṃ vāyumantarikṣe divyeva sūryam / / /🔽atha ye'tha ūrdhvā lokāḥ tadyā ata ūrdhvā devatāsteṣu tā devatā vyārohayatsa yathā🔽haivema āvirlokā imāśca devatā evamu haiva ta āvirlokāstāśca devatā yeṣu tā devatā
analyzed: vyārohayat asmin eva loke ignim vāyum antarikṣe divi eva sūryam  atha ūrdhvāḥ lokāḥ tat yāḥ atas ūrdhvāḥ devatāḥ teṣu tāḥ devatāḥ vyārohayat sa yathā  ha eva ime āvis lokāḥ imāḥ ca devatāḥ evam u ha eva te āvis lokāḥ tāḥ ca devatāḥ yeṣu tāḥ devatā
translated: Brahman indeed was this in the beginning. It created the gods. Having created the gods, it made them ascend these worlds. It made Agni ascend this world, Vayu the atmosphere, and Surya the heaven.🔽Then those worlds that are above, and those deities that are above them, it made them ascend those deities. Just as these worlds and these deities are manifest,

original: vyārohayat / / /
analyzed: vyārohayat
translated: so indeed are those worlds and those deities manifest in which it made those deities ascend.

original: atha brahmaiva parārdhamagacat tatparārdhaṃ gatvaikṣata kathaṃ
analyzed: atha brahmā eva parārdham agacat tat parārdham gatvā aikṣata katham
translated: Then Brahman itself went to the end of the Parardha. Having gone to the end of the Parardha, it saw how

original: nvimāṃlokānpratyaveyāmiti taddvābhyāmeva pratyavaidrūpeṇa caiva nāmnā ca sa
analyzed: nu imān lokān pratyaveyām iti tat dvābhyām eva pratyavait rūpeṇa ca eva nāmnā ca sa
translated: Then Brahman went to the other end of the Parardha. Having gone to the other end of the Parardha, he thought: 'How shall I return to these worlds?' He returned by means of two things, by form and by name.

original: yasya kasya ca nāmāsti tannāma yasyo api nāma nāsti yadveda rūpeṇedaṃ rūpamiti
analyzed: yasya kasya ca nāma asti tat nāma yasya u api nāma na asti yat veda rūpeṇa idam rūpam iti
translated: Whatever has a name, that is its name. Whatever does not have a name, when one knows it by form, 'This is of such and such a form,'

original: tadrūpametāvadvā idaṃ yāvadrūpaṃ caiva nāma ca / / /
analyzed: tat rūpam etāvat vai idam yāvat rūpam ca eva nāma ca
translated: that is the extent of this, as far as form and name extend.

original: te haite brahmaṇo mahatī abhve sa yo haite brahmaṇo mahatī abhve veda
analyzed: te ha ete brahmaṇaḥ mahatī abhve sa yaḥ ha ete brahmaṇaḥ mahatī abhve veda
translated: These two are Brahman's great terrors. He who knows these two great terrors of Brahman

original: mahaddhaivābhvam bhavati / / /
analyzed: mahat ha eva ābhvam bhavati
translated: becomes indeed a great terror.

original: te haite brahmaṇo mahatī yakṣe sa yo haite brahmaṇo mahatī yakṣe veda🔽mahaddhaiva yakṣam bhavati tayoranyatarajjyāyo rūpameva yaddhyapi nāma
analyzed: te ha ete brahmaṇaḥ mahatī yakṣe sa yaḥ ha ete brahmaṇaḥ mahatī yakṣe veda  mahat ha eva yakṣam bhavati tayoḥ anyatarat jyāyaḥ rūpam eva yat hi api nāma
translated: These two are Brahman's great Yakshas. He who knows these two great Yakshas of Brahman

original: rūpameva tatsa yo haitayorjyāyo veda jyāyānha tasmādbhavati yasmājjyāyānbubhūṣati / / /🔽martyā ha vā agre devā āsuḥ sa yadaiva te brahmaṇāpurathāmṛtā āsuḥ sa yam manasa
analyzed: rūpam eva tat sa yaḥ ha etayoḥ jyāyaḥ veda jyāyān ha tasmāt bhavati yasmāt jyāyān bubhūṣati 🔽martyāḥ ha vai agre devāḥ āsuḥ sa yadā eva te brahmaṇā āpuḥ atha amṛtāḥ āsuḥ sa yam
translated: becomes indeed a great Yaksha. Of these two, the other is greater, namely form, for whatever is name is indeed form. That is form. He who knows the greater of these two becomes greater than he whom he wishes to be greater.

original: āghārayati mano vai rūpam manasā hi vededaṃ rūpamiti tena rūpamāpnotyatha yaṃ🔽vāca āghārayati vāgvai nāma vācā hi nāma gṛhṇāti teno nāmāpnotyetāvadvā idaṃ🔽sarvaṃ yāvadrūpaṃ caiva nāma ca tatsarvamāpnoti sarvaṃ vā akṣayyameteno
analyzed: āghārayati manaḥ vai rūpam manasā hi veda idam rūpam iti tena rūpam āpnoti atha yam  vācaḥ āghārayati vāc vai nāma vācā hi nāma gṛhṇāti tena u nāma āpnoti etāvat vai idam  sarvam yāvat rūpam ca eva nāma ca tat sarvam āpnoti sarvam vai akṣayyam etena u
translated: He offers to the mind; the mind is form, for by the mind one knows this form; by that he obtains form. Then he who offers to speech, speech is name, for by speech one grasps the name; by that he obtains the name. So far extends this all, as far as form and name; he obtains all that. All is imperishable, by this

original: hāsyākṣayyaṃ sukṛtam bhavatyakṣayyo lokaḥ / / /
analyzed: ha asya akṣayyam sukṛtam bhavati akṣayyaḥ lokaḥ
translated: He offers to the mind; for the mind is the form; for by the mind one knows this form; by it he obtains the form. Then he who offers to speech, for speech is the name; for by speech one seizes the name; by it he obtains the name. So far extends this all, as far as form and name; all that he obtains. All is imperishable; by it his well-doing becomes imperishable, his world imperishable.

original: tadvā ada āgneyyāmiṣṭā udyate yathā tadṛṣibhyo yajñaḥ prārocata taṃ yathātanvata🔽tadyajñaṃ tanvānānṛṣīngandharvā upaniṣeduste ha sma saṃnidadhatīdaṃ vā
analyzed: tat vai adaḥ āgneyyām iṣṭau udyate yathā tat ṛṣibhyaḥ yajñaḥ prārocata tam yathā atanvata  tat yajñam tanvānān ṛṣīn gandharvāḥ upaniṣeduḥ te ha sma saṃnidadhati idam vā
translated: Now, after the performance of the Âgrayana sacrifice, the sacrifice was revealed to the Rishis in the same way as it was performed by them.

original: atyarīricannidamūnamakranniti sa yadaiṣāṃ yajñaḥ saṃtasthe'thaināṃstaddarśayāṃ🔽cakruridaṃ vā atyarīricatedamūnamakarteti / / /
analyzed: atyarīrican idam ūnam akran iti sa yadā eṣām yajñaḥ saṃtasthetha enān tat darśayām  cakruḥ idam vai atyarīricata idam ūnam akarta iti
translated: While the Rishis were performing that sacrifice, the Gandharvas sat down by them. They used to say, 'This is too much; this is too little.' When their sacrifice was completed, they showed it to them, saying, 'This is too much; this is too little.'

original: sa yadatirecayāṃ cakruḥ yathā girirevaṃ tadāsātha yadūnaṃ cakruryathā śvabhrāḥ🔽pradarā evaṃ tadāsa / / /
analyzed: sa yat atirecayām cakruḥ yathā giriḥ evam tat āsātha yat ūnam cakruḥ yathā śvabhrāḥ 🔽pradarāḥ evam tat āsa
translated: Now, what they did too much, that became as high as a mountain; and what they did too little, that became as low as a ravine.

original: sa yatra śamyorāha tadabhimṛśati yajña namaśca ta upa ca yajñasya śive
analyzed: sa yatra śamyoḥ āha tat abhimṛśati yajña namaḥ ca te upa ca yajñasya śive
translated: When he says 'Shamyu', he touches it, saying, 'O sacrifice, bow down to thee and approach the auspicious

original: saṃtiṣṭhasva sviṣṭe me saṃtiṣṭhasveti sa yadatirecayati tannamaskāreṇa🔽śamayatyatha yadūnaṃ karotyupa ceti tena tadanyūnam bhavati yajñasya śive🔽saṃtiṣṭhasveti yadvai yajñasyānyūnātiriktaṃ tacivaṃ tena tadubhayaṃ śamayati sviṣṭe
analyzed: saṃtiṣṭhasva su iṣṭe me saṃtiṣṭhasva iti sa yat atirecayati tat namaskāreṇa  śamayati atha yat ūnam karoti upa ca iti tena tat anyūnam bhavati yajñasya śive  saṃtiṣṭhasva iti yat vai yajñasya anyūna atiriktam tacivam tena tat ubhayam śamayati su iṣṭe
translated: of the sacrifice. Be completed for me, be completed for the well-sacrificed.' What he exceeds, he appeases by bowing down.🔽Then what he makes less, he makes that not less by approaching with that. 'Be completed for the auspicious🔽of the sacrifice' - what is neither deficient nor in excess in the sacrifice, that is auspicious. By that he appeases both. 'Be completed for me,

original: me saṃtiṣṭhasveti yadvai yajñasyānyūnātiriktaṃ tatsviṣṭaṃ teno tadubhayaṃ🔽śamayatyevamu hāsyaitena yajñenānyūnātiriktenaiveṣṭam bhavati ya evaṃ
analyzed: me saṃtiṣṭhasva iti yat vai yajñasya anyūna atiriktam tat su iṣṭam tena u tat ubhayam  śamayati evam u ha asya etena yajñena anyūna atiriktena eva iṣṭam bhavati yaḥ evam
translated: be completed for the well-sacrificed' - what is neither deficient nor in excess in the sacrifice, that is well-sacrificed. By that he appeases both.

original: vidvānevamabhimṛśati tasmādevamevābhimṛśette ha te gandharvā āsuḥ śūrpaṃ
analyzed: vidvān evam abhimṛśati tasmāt evam eva abhimṛśet te ha te gandharvāḥ āsuḥ śūrpam
translated: Thus indeed his sacrifice becomes well-sacrificed, neither deficient nor in excess, for whom, knowing thus, they touch thus. Therefore one should touch thus. Those were the Gandharvas: the winnowing basket,

original: yavamānkṛṣirudvālavāndhānāntarvān / / /
analyzed: yavamān kṛṣiḥ udvālavān dhānā antarvān
translated: the barley, the plough, the threshing floor, the corn-bin.

original: eṣa vai pūrṇamāḥ ya eṣa tapatyaharaharhyevaiṣa pūrṇo'thaiṣa eva darśo
analyzed: eṣa vai pūrṇamās yaḥ eṣa tapati ahar ahar hi eva eṣa pūrṇaḥ uta eṣaḥ eva darśaḥ
translated: This is the full moon, for this one shines full day by day. This is the new moon,

original: yaccandramā dṛdṛśa iva hyeṣaḥ / / /
analyzed: yat candramāḥ dṛdṛśe iva hi eṣaḥ
translated: for this moon is seen as if it were not.

original: atho itarathāhuḥ eṣa eva pūrṇamā yaccandramā etasya hyanu pūraṇam
analyzed: atha u itarathā āhuḥ eṣaḥ eva pūrṇamās yat candramāḥ etasya hi anu pūraṇam
translated: And in another way they say: The full moon is the same as the moon, for the full moon is after it.

original: paurṇamāsītyācakṣate'thaiṣa eva darśo ya eṣa tapati dadṛśa iva hyeṣaḥ / / /
analyzed: paurṇamāsī iti ācakṣate itha eṣaḥ eva darśaḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati dadṛśe iva hi eṣaḥ
translated: They call it the full moon. And this shining one is the new moon, for it is as if it were seen.

original: iyameva pūrṇamāḥ pūrṇeva hīyamasāveva dyaurdarśo dadṛśa iva hyasau dyauḥ / / /🔽rātrireva pūrṇamāḥ pūrṇeva hīyaṃ rātrirahareva darśo dadṛśa iva hīdamahareṣā nu
analyzed: iyam eva pūrṇamās pūrṇā iva hi iyam asau eva dyauḥ darśaḥ dadṛśe iva hi asau dyauḥ  rātriḥ eva pūrṇamās pūrṇā iva hi iyam rātriḥ ahar eva darśaḥ dadṛśe iva hi idam ahar eṣā nu
translated: This earth is the full moon, for it is as if it were full. This very sky is the new moon, for this sky is as if it were seen.

original: devatrā darśapūrṇamāsayormīmāṃsā / / /🔽athādhyātmam udāna eva pūrṇamā udānena hyayam puruṣaḥ pūryata iva prāṇa eva
analyzed: devatrā darśa pūrṇamāsayoḥ mīmāṃsā  atha adhyātmam udānaḥ eva pūrṇamās udānena hi ayam puruṣaḥ pūryate iva prāṇaḥ eva
translated: The night is the full moon, for it is as if it were full. The day is the new moon, for this day is as if it were seen. This is the investigation of the new and full moon sacrifices in relation to the gods.

original: darśo dadṛśa iva hyayam prāṇastadetāvannādaścānnapradaśca darśapūrṇamāsau / / /🔽prāṇa evānnādaḥ prāṇena hīdamannamadyata udāna evānnaprada udānena🔽hīdamannam pradīyate sa yo haitāvannādaṃ cānnapradaṃ ca darśapūrṇamāsau
analyzed: darśaḥ dadṛśe iva hi ayam prāṇaḥ tat etau anna ādaḥ ca anna pradaḥ ca darśa pūrṇamāsau  prāṇaḥ eva anna ādaḥ prāṇena hi idam annam adyate udānaḥ eva anna pradaḥ udānena  hi idam annam pradīyate sa yaḥ ha etau anna ādam ca anna pradam ca darśa pūrṇamāsau
translated: Now in relation to the self: The up-breath is the full moon, for by the up-breath this person is as if filled. The out-breath is the new moon, for this out-breath is as if seen. Thus these two, the new and full moon sacrifices, are the eater of food and the giver of food.🔽The out-breath is the eater of food, for by the out-breath this food is eaten. The up-breath is the giver of food, for by the up-breath this food is given. He who thus knows the new and full moon sacrifices as the eater of food and the giver of food

original: vedānnādo haiva bhavati pra hāsmā annādyaṃ dīyate / / /
analyzed: veda anna ādaḥ ha eva bhavati pra ha asmai annādyam dīyate
translated: becomes an eater of food, and food is given to him.

original: mana eva pūrṇamāḥ pūrṇamiva hīdam mano vāgeva darśo dadṛśa iva hīyaṃ🔽vāktadetāvadhyātmam pratyakṣaṃ darśapūrṇamāsau sa yadupavasathe
analyzed: manaḥ eva pūrṇamās pūrṇam iva hi idam manaḥ vāc eva darśaḥ dadṛśe iva hi iyam  vāc tat etau adhyātmam pratyakṣam darśa pūrṇamāsau sa yat upavasathe
translated: The mind is the full moon, for the mind is as it were full. Speech is the new moon, for this (speech) is as it were seen.🔽These two, the new and full moon sacrifices, are thus directly perceived in the self. When he eats the food fit for the vow-observing sacrificer on the Upavasatha day,

original: vratopāyanīyamaśnāti tenaitāvadhyātmam pratyakṣaṃ darśapūrṇamāsau prīṇāti
analyzed: vrata upāyanīyam aśnāti tena etau adhyātmam pratyakṣam darśa pūrṇamāsau prīṇāti
translated: he thus directly pleases the new and full moon sacrifices in the self.

original: yajñena prātardaivau / / /
analyzed: yajñena prātardaivau
translated: With the sacrifice in the morning, he pleases the two gods.

original: tadāhuḥ yanna pūrṇamāsāyeti havirgṛhyate na darśāyeti havirgṛhyate na
analyzed: tat āhuḥ yat na pūrṇamāsāya iti haviḥ gṛhyate na darśāya iti haviḥ gṛhyate na
translated: Regarding this, they say: 'The offering is taken for the full moon sacrifice, not for the new moon sacrifice.

original: pūrṇamāsāyānubrūhi na darśāyānubrūhi na pūrṇamāsaṃ yaja na darśaṃ yajetyatha🔽kenāsya darśapūrṇamāsāviṣṭau bhavata iti sa yam manasa āghārayati mano vai🔽pūrṇamāstena pūrṇamāsaṃ yajatyatha yaṃ vāca āghārayati vāgvai darśasteno darśaṃ
analyzed: pūrṇamāsāya anubrūhi na darśāya anubrūhi na pūrṇamāsam yaja na darśam yaja iti atha  kena asya darśa pūrṇamāsau iṣṭau bhavataḥ iti sa yam manase āghārayati manaḥ vai  pūrṇamās tena pūrṇamāsam yajati atha yam vāce āghārayati vāc vai darśaḥ tena u darśam
translated: Recite for the full moon sacrifice, not for the new moon sacrifice. Offer to the full moon sacrifice, not to the new moon sacrifice.'

original: yajatyeteno hāsya darśapūrnamāsāviṣṭau bhavataḥ / / /
analyzed: yajati etena u ha asya darśapūrnamāsau iṣṭau bhavataḥ
translated: By what then are the new and full moon sacrifices included in it? The one he offers to the mind, the mind is the full moon sacrifice. By that he offers to the full moon sacrifice. Then the one he offers to speech, speech is the new moon sacrifice. By that he offers to the new moon sacrifice. By this the new and full moon sacrifices are included in it.

original: taddhaike carū nirvapanti paurṇamāsyāṃ sarasvate'māvāsyāyāṃ sarasvatyā
analyzed: tat ha eke carū nirvapanti paurṇamāsyām sarasvatā imāvāsyāyām sarasvatyā
translated: Regarding this, some offer oblations on the full moon day to Sarasvatī and on the new moon day to Sarasvatī.

analyzed: etat pratyakṣam darśa pūrṇamāsau yajāmahe iti vadantaḥ tat u tathā na kuryāt manaḥ vai

translated: Sarasvatī, and speech is Sarasvatī. When he offers these two libations, then

translated: offers these two libations on both occasions, then his new and full moon sacrifices are completed. With the completed

translated: new and full moon sacrifices, he then goes to the other world. In this way, he becomes a non-transgressor.

analyzed: api ha vai etarhi devebhyaḥ ośvamedham ālabhante tat āhuḥ prākṛta uśvamedhaḥ iti itara
translated: Even now they offer the horse sacrifice to the gods. Regarding this, they say: The horse sacrifice is ordinary, and others🔽say: It is extraordinary.

analyzed: id ūnam sa tat vai eṣaḥ eva aśvamedhaḥ yat candramāḥ
translated: Surely, that very moon is the horse sacrifice.

original: tadāhuḥ padepade'śvaśya medhyasyāhutiṃ juhvatīti sa yatsāyamprātaragnihotraṃ🔽juhoti dve sāyamāhutī juhoti dve prātastāścatasra āhutyaścatuṣpādvā aśvastadasya
analyzed: tat āhuḥ padepadeśvaśya medhyasya āhutim juhvati iti sa yat sāyamprātar agnihotram  juhoti dve sāyamāhutī juhoti dve prātar tāḥ catasraḥ āhutyaḥ catuṣpād vai aśvaḥ tat asya

translated: he offers two oblations in the evening and two in the morning. Those are four oblations. The horse has four feet. Thus an oblation is offered at every step of his.

analyzed: tat āhuḥ vivṛtta īśvasya iṣṭim nirvapati iti eṣa vai somaḥ rājā devānām annam
translated: They say, The horse sacrifice is performed when the moon has turned. The moon is indeed the food of the gods.

original: yaccandramāḥ sa yatraiṣa etāṃ rātriṃ na purastānna paścāddadṛśe tadimaṃ
analyzed: yat candramāḥ sa yatra eṣaḥ etām rātrim na purastāt na paścāt dadṛśe tat imam
translated: When it is not seen either in front or behind on that night, then it comes to this world

original: lokamāgacati so'smiṃloke vivartate / / /
analyzed: lokam āgacati saḥ usmin loke vivartate
translated: and turns in this world.

original: sa yadāmāvāsyena yajate vivṛtta evāsyaitadiṣṭiṃ nirvapatyatha yatpaurṇamāsena
analyzed: sa yadā āmāvāsyena yajate vivṛtte eva asya etat iṣṭim nirvapati atha yat paurṇamāsena
translated: When he performs the new moon sacrifice, then the horse sacrifice is performed for him when it has turned. Then when he performs the full moon sacrifice,

analyzed: yajata aśvamedham eva etat ālabhate tam ālabhya devebhyaḥ prayacati saṃvatsare vā
translated: he seizes the horse sacrifice. Having seized it, he offers it to the gods. In a year

translated: they seize the other horse sacrifice. This month, moving around, makes up the year.

original: tadasya saṃvatsare saṃvatsara evāśvamedha ālabdho bhavati / / /🔽taṃ vā etam māsimāsyevāśvamedhamālabhante sa yo haivaṃ vidvānagnihotraṃ ca

translated: In the year, the horse sacrifice is obtained in the year itself.🔽They offer the horse sacrifice every month, knowing this. He who offers the Agnihotra

original: vidyādahamevaiṣa idhma iti / / /
analyzed: vidyāt aham eva eṣa idhmaḥ iti
translated: He should know that he is the kindling wood.

original: anūkamevāsya sāmidhenyaḥ tasmāttā brūyātsaṃtanvanniva me'nubrūhīti saṃtatamiva
analyzed: anūkam eva asya sāmidhenyaḥ tasmāt tāḥ brūyāt saṃtanvan iva menubrūhi iti saṃtatam iva

analyzed: hi idam anūkam manaḥ ca eva asya vāc ca āghārau sarasvān ca sarasvatī ca sa
translated: continuing. And his mind and speech are the two libations, Sarasvati and Sarasvati.

translated: And because they perform the Upâmsu silently, therefore this heart is as it were hidden.🔽Now that sacrificial cake which is offered to Agni and Soma is his left half. The Sâmnâyya (milk and rice boiled together) is offered to Indra,

original: sāṃnāyyamantarāṃsamevāsya sviṣṭakṛdviṣam prāśitram / / /
analyzed: sāṃnāyyam antarāṃsam eva asya sviṣṭakṛt viṣam prāśitram

translated: And when he cuts off the Prâshitra, it is as if the Prâshitra of Pragâpati were cut off,

translated: The Ida is his belly; and just as they cut out (the food) from the Ida, so this food of all forms is cut out into his belly.

translated: There are three after-sacrifices; they are his three downward breaths; the Sukra and the Sâṃyâvana are his two arms; the four Patnîsamyâgas are his four feet, the thighs being two, and the two leg-bones two; the Samishtayagus is his two feet.
