analyzed: tat āptam avaruddham abhijitam bhavati
translated: all that is obtained, secured, and conquered by him.

original: ardhamāsā haviṣpātrāṇi sa yo ha vā ardhamāsā haviṣpātrāṇīti vedānte
analyzed: ardha māsāḥ haviḥ pātrāṇi sa yaḥ ha vai ardha māsāḥ haviḥ pātrāṇi iti vedānte
translated: The half-months are the sacrificial vessels. He who knows the half-months to be the sacrificial vessels,

original: haivāsyārdhamāsānāmiṣṭam bhavatyatho yatkiṃ cārdhamāseṣu kriyate sarvaṃ
analyzed: ha eva asya ardha māsānām iṣṭam bhavati atha u yat kim ca ardha māseṣu kriyate sarvam
translated: He has indeed offered to the half-months. Then whatever is done in the half-months, all that

original: haivāsya tadāptamavaruddhamabhijitam bhavati / / /🔽ahorātre pariveṣṭrī sa yo ha vā ahorātre pariveṣṭrī iti vedānte
analyzed: ha eva asya tat āptam avaruddham abhijitam bhavati  ahar rātre pariveṣṭrī sa yaḥ ha vai ahar rātre pariveṣṭrī iti vedānte
translated: is indeed obtained, secured, and conquered by him.🔽The day and night are the enclosing sticks. He who knows the day and night as the enclosing sticks, at the end

original: haivāsyāhorātrayoriṣṭam bhavatyatho yatkiṃ cāhorātrayoḥ kriyate sarvaṃ haivāsya
analyzed: ha eva asya ahar rātrayoḥ iṣṭam bhavati atha u yat kim ca ahar rātrayoḥ kriyate sarvam ha eva asya
translated: he has indeed offered to the day and night. Then whatever is done in the day and night, all that

original: tadāptamavaruddhamabhijitam bhavati / / /
analyzed: tat āptam avaruddham abhijitam bhavati
translated: is indeed obtained, secured, and conquered by him.

original: iyameva prathamā sāmidhenī agnirdvitīyā vāyustṛtīyāntarikṣaṃ caturthī
analyzed: iyam eva prathamā sāmidhenī agniḥ dvitīyā vāyuḥ tṛtīyā antarikṣam caturthī
translated: This (earth) is the first kindling verse, Agni is the second, Vāyu is the third, the atmosphere is the fourth,

original: dyauṣpañcamyādityaḥ ṣaṣṭhī candramāḥ saptamī mano'ṣṭamī vāṅnavamī tapo
analyzed: dyauḥ pañcamī ādityaḥ ṣaṣṭhī candramāḥ saptamī manāḥ uṣṭamī vāc navamī tapo
translated: the sky is the fifth, the sun is the sixth, the moon is the seventh, the mind is the eighth, speech is the ninth, austerity

original: daśamī brahmaikādaśyetā hi vā idaṃ sarvaṃ samindhata etābhiridaṃ sarvaṃ
analyzed: daśamī brahmā ekādaśī etāḥ hi vai idam sarvam samindhate etābhiḥ idam sarvam
translated: is the tenth, Brahman is the eleventh. For these indeed kindle all this. By these all this

original: samiddhaṃ tasmātsāmidhenyo nāma / / /
analyzed: samiddham tasmāt sāmidhenyaḥ nāma
translated: is kindled. Therefore they are called kindling verses.

original: sa vai triḥ prathamāmanvāha sa yatprathamamanvāha prācīṃ tena diśaṃ jayati
analyzed: sa vai tris prathamām anvāha sa yat prathamam anvāha prācīm tena diśam jayati
translated: He recites the first three times. When he recites the first, he conquers the eastern direction by that.

original: yaddvitīyaṃ dakṣiṇāṃ tena diśaṃ jayati yattṛtīyamūrdhvāmeva tena diśaṃ jayati / / /
analyzed: yat dvitīyam dakṣiṇām tena diśam jayati yat tṛtīyam ūrdhvām eva tena diśam jayati
translated: By the second (verse) he conquers the southern region, by the third the upper region.🔽He recites the last (verse) three times. By the first (time of reciting it) he conquers the western region,

original: trirvevottamāmanvāha sa yatprathamamanvāha pratīcīṃ tena diśaṃ jayati🔽yaddvitīyamudīcīṃ tena diśaṃ jayati yattṛtīyamimāmeva tena pratiṣṭhāṃ
analyzed: tris u eva uttamām anvāha sa yat prathamam anvāha pratīcīm tena diśam jayati  yat dvitīyam udīcīm tena diśam jayati yat tṛtīyam imām eva tena pratiṣṭhām
translated: by the second the northern region, by the third this very foundation (of the world).

original: jayatyevamu hābhirimāṃlokānjayatyetā diśaḥ / / /🔽ṛtameva pūrva āghāraḥ satyamuttaro'va ha vā ṛtasatye runddhe'tho yatkiṃ
analyzed: jayati evam u ha ābhiḥ imān lokān jayati etāḥ diśaḥ  ṛtam eva pūrvaḥ āghāraḥ satyam uttarā uva ha vai ṛta satye runddhethaḥ yat kim
translated: Thus he conquers these worlds, these regions.

original: cartasatyābhyāṃ jayyaṃ sarvaṃ haiva tajjayati / / /
analyzed: carta satyābhyām jayyam sarvam ha eva tat jayati
translated: The first libation is truth, the second is truth. He who offers the libations wins truth and truth. Moreover, whatever is to be won by truth and truth, all that he wins.

original: tviṣireva prathamaḥ prayājaḥ apacitirdvitīyo yaśastṛtīyo brahmavarcasaṃ
analyzed: tviṣiḥ eva prathamaḥ prayājaḥ apacitiḥ dvitīyaḥ yaśaḥ tṛtīyaḥ brahmavarcasam
translated: The first fore-offering is splendour, the second is prosperity, the third is fame, the fourth is holy lustre,

original: caturtho'nnādyam pañcamaḥ / / /
analyzed: caturtha unnādyam pañcamaḥ
translated: the fifth is food.

original: sa prathamam prayājamanumantrayeta tviṣimānbhūyāsamityapacitimānbhūyāsamiti
analyzed: sa prathamam prayājam anumantrayeta tviṣimān bhūyāsam iti apacitimān bhūyāsam iti
translated: He should recite the first fore-offering with (the formula), 'May I become resplendent.' The second with (the formula), 'May I become prosperous.'

original: dvitīyaṃ yaśasvī bhūyāsamiti tṛtīyam brahmavarcasī bhūyāsamiti caturthamannādo
analyzed: dvitīyam yaśasvī bhūyāsam iti tṛtīyam brahmavarcasī bhūyāsam iti caturtham anna ādaḥ
translated: The third with (the formula), 'May I become famous.' The fourth with (the formula), 'May I become full of holy lustre.' The fifth with (the formula), 'May I become an eater of food.'

original: bhūyāsamiti pañcamaṃ tviṣimānha vā apacitimānyaśasvī brahmavarcasyannādo
analyzed: bhūyāsam iti pañcamam tviṣimān ha vai apacitimān yaśasvī brahmavarcasī anna ādaḥ
translated: He becomes prosperous, radiant, well-fed, famous, and has the splendor of the Brahmins and food.

original: bhavati ya evametadveda / / /
analyzed: bhavati yaḥ evam etat veda
translated: He who knows this thus.

original: etaddha sma vai tadvidvānāha śvetaketurāruṇeyaḥ kaṃ svidevāparīṣu
analyzed: etat ha sma vai tad vidvān āha śvetaketuḥ āruṇeyaḥ kam svid eva aparīṣu
translated: Now, they say, Śvetaketu Āruṇeya, knowing this, said: 'Who indeed, among the great ones,

original: mahānāgamivābhisaṃsāraṃ didṛkṣitāro ya evametatprayājānāṃ yaśo vediteti / / /
analyzed: mahā nāgam iva abhisaṃsāram didṛkṣitāraḥ yaḥ evam etat prayājānām yaśaḥ veditā iti
translated: desires to see the great serpent as it moves about, who knows thus the glory of the fore-sacrifices.'

original: bhūtameva pūrva ājyabhāgaḥ bhaviṣyaduttaro'va ha vai bhūtaṃ ca bhaviṣyacca
analyzed: bhūtam eva pūrvaḥ ājyabhāgaḥ bhaviṣyat uttaraḥ uva ha vai bhūtam ca bhaviṣyat ca
translated: The first portion of the ghee is the past, the second is the future. He indeed obtains the past and the future.

original: runddhe'tho yatkiṃ ca bhūtena ca bhaviṣyatā ca jayyaṃ sarvaṃ haiva tajjayati / / /
analyzed: runddhethaḥ yat kim ca bhūtena ca bhaviṣyatā ca jayyam sarvam ha eva tat jayati
translated: And whatever is to be conquered by the past and the future, all that he conquers.

original: brahmāgneyaḥ puroḍāśaḥ sa yo ha vai brahmāgneyaḥ puroḍāśa iti vedāva ha
analyzed: brahma āgneyaḥ puroḍāśaḥ sa yaḥ ha vai brahma āgneyaḥ puroḍāśaḥ iti vedāva ha
translated: The cake to Agni is the Brahman. He who knows the cake to Agni as the Brahman,

original: brahma runddhe'tho yatkiṃ ca brahmaṇā jayyaṃ sarvaṃ haiva tajjayati / / /
analyzed: brahma runddhethaḥ yat kim ca brahmaṇā jayyam sarvam ha eva tat jayati
translated: he indeed obtains the Brahman. And whatever is to be conquered by the Brahman, all that he conquers.

original: kṣatramupāṃśuyājaḥ sa yo ha vai kṣatramupāṃśuyāja iti vedāva ha kṣatraṃ
analyzed: kṣatram upāṃśuyājaḥ sa yaḥ ha vai kṣatram upāṃśuyājaḥ iti veda ava ha kṣatram
translated: The Upāṃśuyāja is the Kshatra. He who knows the Upāṃśuyāja as the Kshatra,

original: runddhe'tho yatkiṃ ca kṣatreṇa jayyaṃ sarvaṃ haiva tajjayati tadyadupāṃśuyājaṃ
analyzed: runddhethaḥ yat kim ca kṣatreṇa jayyam sarvam ha eva tat jayati tat yat upāṃśuyājam
translated: he indeed obtains the Kshatra. And whatever is to be conquered by the Kshatra, all that he conquers. That Upāṃśuyāja

original: kurvantyeke naike tasmāduccaiścopāṃśu ca kṣatrāyācakṣate / / /
analyzed: kurvanti eke na eke tasmāt uccais ca upāṃśu ca kṣatrāya ācakṣate
translated: Some do, some do not. Therefore they speak of the Kshatra as both high and low.

original: viduttaraḥ puroḍāśaḥ sa yo ha vai viduttaraḥ puroḍāśa iti vedāva ha viśaṃ
analyzed: vid uttaraḥ puroḍāśaḥ sa yaḥ ha vai vid uttaraḥ puroḍāśaḥ iti veda ava ha viśam
translated: The cake is superior. He who knows the cake as superior obtains a people.

original: runddhe'tho yatkiṃ ca viśā jayyaṃ sarvaṃ haiva tajjayati tadyadāgneyaśca puroḍāśa
analyzed: runddha ithaḥ yat kim ca viśā jayyam sarvam ha eva tat jayati tat yat āgneyaḥ ca puroḍāśa
translated: And whatever is to be gained by a people, all that he gains. Because the cake to Agni and the Upamshuyaja are the first,

original: upāṃśuyājaśca pūrvau bhavatastasmādubhe brahma ca kṣatraṃ ca viśi pratiṣṭhite / / /
analyzed: upāṃśuyājaḥ ca pūrvau bhavataḥ tasmāt ubhe brahma ca kṣatram ca viśi pratiṣṭhite
translated: therefore both Brahman and Kshatra are established in the people.

original: rāṣṭraṃ sāṃnāyyaṃ sa yo ha vai rāṣṭraṃ sāṃnāyyamiti vedāva ha rāṣṭraṃ
analyzed: rāṣṭram sāṃnāyyam sa yaḥ ha vai rāṣṭram sāṃnāyyam iti veda ava ha rāṣṭram
translated: The Snanayya is the kingdom. He who knows the Snanayya as the kingdom obtains a kingdom.

original: runddhe'tho yatkiṃ ca rāṣṭreṇa ja yyaṃ sarvaṃ haiva tajjayati tadyatsaṃnayantyeke
analyzed: runddhethaḥ yat kim ca rāṣṭreṇa ja yyam sarvam ha eva tat jayati tat yat saṃnayanti eke
translated: And whatever is to be gained by a kingdom, all that he gains. Because some unite and some do not,

original: naike tasmādrāṣṭraṃ saṃ caiti vi ca / / /
analyzed: na eke tasmāt rāṣṭram sam ca eti vi ca
translated: therefore the kingdom both unites and divides.

original: tapaḥ sviṣṭakṛt sa yo ha vai tapaḥ sviṣṭakṛditi vedāva ha tapo runddhe'tho yatkiṃ ca
analyzed: tapaḥ sviṣṭakṛt sa yaḥ ha vai tapaḥ sviṣṭakṛt iti veda ava ha tapaḥ runddhethaḥ yat kim ca
translated: The Sviष्टकृत् is austerity. He who knows the Sviष्टकृत् as austerity obtains austerity.

original: tapasā jayyaṃ sarvaṃ haiva tajjayati / / /
analyzed: tapasā jayyam sarvam ha eva tat jayati
translated: And whatever is to be gained by austerity, all that he gains.

original: lokaḥ prāśitraṃ sa yo ha vai lokaḥ prāśitramiti vedāva ha lokaṃ runddhe'tho yatkiṃ
analyzed: lokaḥ prāśitram sa yaḥ ha vai lokaḥ prāśitram iti veda ava ha lokam runddhethaḥ yat kim
translated: The Prashitra is the world. He who knows the Prashitra as the world obtains the world. And whatever is to be gained by the world,

original: ca lokena jayyaṃ sarvaṃ haiva tajjayati no ha lavena lokādvyathathe lavena ha vā
analyzed: ca lokena jayyam sarvam ha eva tat jayati na u ha lavena lokāt vyathathe lavena ha vā
translated: Whatever is to be conquered by the world, he conquers that indeed, not by a fraction. By a fraction they suffer from the world. By a fraction indeed,

original: amuṣmiṃloke lokādvyathante'tha ya evaṃ veda na ha bahu cana pāpaṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: amuṣmin loke lokāt vyathante tha yaḥ evam veda na ha bahu cana pāpam kṛtvā
translated: Whatever is to be conquered by the world, he conquers that indeed, not by a particle. By a particle they are separated from the world. By a particle they are indeed separated from the world yonder. But one who knows thus, having done not much evil,

original: lokādvyathate / / /🔽śraddheḍā sa yo ha vai śraddheḍeti vedāva ha śraddhāṃ runddhe'tho yatkiṃ ca
analyzed: lokāt vyathate  śraddhā iḍā sa yaḥ ha vai śraddhā iḍā iti veda ava ha śraddhām runddhethaḥ yat kim ca
translated: is not separated from the world.

original: śraddhayā jayyaṃ sarvaṃ haiva tajjayati / / /
analyzed: śraddhayā jayyam sarvam ha eva tat jayati
translated: Faith is the ladle. He who knows faith as the ladle indeed obtains faith. And whatever is to be conquered by faith, he conquers all that indeed.

original: aśanireva prathamo'nuyājaḥ hrādunirdvitīya ulkuṣī tṛtīyaḥ / / /🔽sa prathamamanuyājamanumantrayeta aśanyamuṃ jahīti yaṃ🔽dviṣyāddhrādunyamuṃ jahīti dvitīyamulkuṣyamuṃ jahīti tṛtīyam / / /🔽sa ya eṣa kṣipram mriyate aśanirha tamanuyājo hantyatha yo visravanmiśra iva
analyzed: aśaniḥ eva prathamaḥ anuyājaḥ hrāduniḥ dvitīyaḥ ulkuṣī tṛtīyaḥ  sa prathamam anuyājam anumantrayeta aśani amum jahi iti yam  dviṣyāt hrāduni amum jahi iti dvitīyam ulkuṣi amum jahi iti tṛtīyam  sa yaḥ eṣa kṣipram mriyate aśaniḥ ha tam anuyājaḥ hanti atha yaḥ visravat miśraḥ iva
translated: The first after-offering is the thunderbolt, the second is the hailstone, the third is the meteor.🔽He should recite the first after-offering, Slay him with the thunderbolt, whom he hates. The second, Slay him with the hailstone. The third, Slay him with the meteor.

original: hrādunirha tamanuyājo hantyatha yo'bhyuṣṭamiśra ivolkuṣī ha tamanuyājo hanti / / /
analyzed: hrāduniḥ ha tam anuyājaḥ hanti atha yaḥ ubhyuṣṭa miśraḥ iva ulkuṣī ha tam anuyājaḥ hanti
translated: He who dies quickly is struck by the thunderbolt as the first after-offering. Then he who is mixed with oozing is struck by the hailstone as the second after-offering. Then he who is mixed with burning is struck by the meteor as the third after-offering.

original: saiṣā yajñameniḥ etayā vai menyā devā asurānparābhāvayāṃ cakrustatho
analyzed: sā eṣā yajña meniḥ etayā vai menyā devāḥ asurān parābhāvayām cakruḥ tathā
translated: This is the Yajna-menis. By this menis the gods overcame the Asuras. In the same way

original: evaivaṃvidyajamānaḥ pāpmānaṃ dviṣantam bhrātṛvyam parābhāvayati / / /
analyzed: eva evaṃvid yajamānaḥ pāpmānam dviṣantam bhrātṛvyam parābhāvayati
translated: In the same way, the sacrificer who possesses this knowledge overcomes his wicked, hateful enemy.

original: sa yadanuyājānto yajñaḥ syāt aśanyantaḥ syāddhrādunyanta utkuṣyantastasmādvai
analyzed: sa yat anuyāja antaḥ yajñaḥ syāt aśani antaḥ syāt hrādunyantaḥ utkuṣyantaḥ tasmāt vai
translated: If the sacrifice were to end with the after-sacrifices, it would end with thunderbolts, with loud noises, with jumping. Therefore,

original: devānāṃ yajña iḍānto vaiva śamyvanto vā / / /
analyzed: devānām yajñaḥ iḍā antaḥ vā eva śamyu antaḥ vā
translated: the sacrifice of the gods ends with the Idā or the Samyu.🔽By the fore-sacrifices the gods went to the heavenly world. The Asuras desired to follow them. By the after-sacrifices🔽they turned them back. In that the after-sacrifices are offered, the sacrificer turns back his wicked, hateful enemy.

original: prayājairvai devāḥ svargaṃ lokamāyaṃstānasurā anvājigāṃsaṃstānanuyājaiḥ🔽pratyauhaṃstadyadanuyājā ijyante pāpmānameva taddviṣantam bhrātṛvyaṃ
analyzed: prayājaiḥ vai devāḥ svargam lokam āyan tān asurāḥ anvājigāṃsan tān anuyājaiḥ  pratyauhan tat yat anuyājāḥ ijyante pāpmānam eva tat dviṣantam bhrātṛvyam
translated: By the fore-sacrifices the gods went to the heavenly world. The Asuras desired to follow them. By the after-sacrifices

original: yajamānaḥ pratyūhati / / /🔽prāṇā vai prayājāḥ apānā anuyājāstasmātprayājāḥ prāñco hūyante taddhi
analyzed: yajamānaḥ pratyūhati  prāṇāḥ vai prayājāḥ apānāḥ anuyājāḥ tasmāt prayājāḥ prāñcaḥ hūyante tat hi
translated: they turned them back. In that the after-sacrifices are offered, the sacrificer turns back his wicked, hateful enemy.

original: prāṇarūpam
analyzed: prāṇa rūpam
translated: The fore-sacrifices are the breaths, the after-sacrifices are the out-breaths. Therefore the fore-sacrifices are offered facing east, for that is the form of the in-breath.

original: pratyañco'nuyājāstadapānarūpametā ha vai darśapūrṇamāsayorupasado
analyzed: pratyañcaḥ unuyājāḥ tat apāna rūpam etāḥ ha vai darśa pūrṇamāsayoḥ upasadaḥ
translated: Facing west are the after-sacrifices, that is the form of the out-breath. These are indeed the upasads of the new and full moon sacrifices,

original: yadanuyājāstasmātta upasadrūpeṇa pratyañco hūyante / / /
analyzed: yat anuyājāḥ tasmāt te upasad rūpeṇa pratyañcaḥ hūyante
translated: namely the after-sacrifices. Therefore they are offered facing west in the form of the upasads.

original: saṃsthā sūktavākaḥ sa yo ha vai saṃsthā sūktavāka iti vedāva ha saṃsthāṃ runddhe'tho
analyzed: saṃsthā sūktavākaḥ sa yaḥ ha vai saṃsthā sūktavākaḥ iti veda ava ha saṃsthām runddhethaḥ
translated: The Suktavaka is the completion. He who knows the Suktavaka as the completion secures the completion.

original: yatkiṃ ca saṃsthayā jayyaṃ sarvaṃ haiva tajjayati gacati vayasaḥ saṃsthām / / /
analyzed: yat kim ca saṃsthayā jayyam sarvam ha eva tat jayati gacati vayasaḥ saṃsthām
translated: Whatever is to be gained by the completion (of the sacrifice), all that he gains; he goes to the completion of life.

original: pratiṣṭhā śamyorvākaḥ sa yo ha vai pratiṣṭhā śamyorvāk iti vedāva ha pratiṣṭhāṃ
analyzed: pratiṣṭhā śamyorvākaḥ sa yaḥ ha vai pratiṣṭhā śamyorvāc iti veda ava ha pratiṣṭhām
translated: The conclusion of the peace-offering is the foundation; he who knows the conclusion of the peace-offering as the foundation, gains the foundation.

original: runddhe'tho yatkiṃ ca pratiṣṭhayā jayyaṃ sarvaṃ haiva tajjayati gacati pratiṣṭhām / / /
analyzed: runddhethaḥ yat kim ca pratiṣṭhayā jayyam sarvam ha eva tat jayati gacati pratiṣṭhām
translated: And whatever is to be gained by the foundation, all that he gains; he goes to the foundation.

original: te devāḥ etānpatnīsaṃyājānpaścātparyauhanta mithunamevaitadupariṣṭādadadhata
analyzed: te devāḥ etān patnīsaṃyājān paścāt paryauhanta mithunam eva etat upariṣṭāt adadhata
translated: The gods surrounded these Patnīsaṃyājas on the back side, they placed the pair above,

original: prajātyai tadyatpatnīsaṃyājā ijyante mithunamevaitadupariṣṭāddhatte prajātyai
analyzed: prajātyai tat yat patnīsaṃyājāḥ ijyante mithunam eva etat upariṣṭāt dhatte prajātyai
translated: for propagation. In that the Patnīsaṃyājas are offered, he places the pair above, for propagation.

original: devānāṃ ha vai prajātimanu prajāyate mithunenamithunena ha prajāyate ya
analyzed: devānām ha vai prajātim anu prajāyate mithunena mithunena ha prajāyate yaḥ
translated: One is born in accordance with the birth of the gods; by pair after pair one is born,

original: evametadveda / / /
analyzed: evam etat veda
translated: he who knows this thus.

original: annaṃ samiṣṭayajuḥ sa yo ha vā annaṃ samiṣṭayajuriti vedāva hānnaṃ runddhe'tho
analyzed: annam samiṣṭa yajuḥ sa yaḥ ha vai annam samiṣṭa yajuḥ iti veda ava ha annam runddhethaḥ
translated: The Samishtayagus is food; he who knows the Samishtayagus as food, gains food.

original: yatkiṃ cānnena jayyaṃ sarvaṃ haiva tajjayati / / /
analyzed: yat kim ca annena jayyam sarvam ha eva tat jayati
translated: And whatever is to be gained by food, all that he gains.

original: saṃvatsaro yajamānaḥ tamṛtavo yājayanti vasanta āgnīdhrastasmādvasante
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ yajamānaḥ tam ṛtavaḥ yājayanti vasantaḥ āgnīdhraḥ tasmāt vasante
translated: The sacrificer is the year; the seasons officiate for him; the spring is the Agnidhra; therefore in spring

original: dāvāścaranti taddhyagnirūpaṃ grīṣmo'dhvaryustapta iva vai
analyzed: dāvāḥ caranti tat hi agni rūpam grīṣmaḥ dhvaryuḥ taptaḥ iva vai
translated: For that is the form of fire. The summer is the Adhvaryu, as if heated.

original: grīṣmastaptamivādhvaryurniṣkrāmati varṣā udgātā tasmādyadā balavadvarṣati
analyzed: grīṣmaḥ taptam iva adhvaryuḥ niṣkrāmati varṣāḥ udgātā tasmāt yadā balavat varṣati
translated: The summer is as if heated, the Adhvaryu goes out as if heated. The rainy season is the Udgātṛ. Therefore, when it rains strongly,

original: sāmna ivopabdiḥ kriyate śaradbrahmā tasmādyadā sasyam pacyate brahmaṇvatyaḥ
analyzed: sāmnaḥ iva upabdiḥ kriyate śarad brahmā tasmāt yadā sasyam pacyate brahmaṇvatyaḥ
translated: a sound as if of the Sāman is made. The autumn is the Brahman. Therefore, when the crops ripen,

original: prajā ityāhurhemanto hotā tasmāddhemanvaṣaṭkṛtāḥ paśavaḥ sīdantyetā ha vā enaṃ
analyzed: prajāḥ iti āhuḥ hemantaḥ hotā tasmāt heman vaṣaṭkṛtāḥ paśavaḥ sīdanti etāḥ ha vai enam
translated: they say, The beings are full of Brahman. The winter is the Hotṛ. Therefore, after the Vaṣaṭ-utterance in the winter, the animals sit down. These indeed are

original: devatā yājayanti sa yadyenamaiṣāvīrā yājayeyuretā eva devatā manasā dhyāyedetā
analyzed: devatāḥ yājayanti sa yadi enam aiṣāvīrāḥ yājayeyuḥ etāḥ eva devatāḥ manasā dhyāyet etāḥ
translated: the deities that officiate for him. If they were to make him sacrifice without a wife, he should think of these deities in his mind.

original: haivainaṃ devatā yājayanti / / /🔽atha haiṣaiva tulā yaddakṣiṇo vedyantaḥ sa yatsādhu karoti tadantarvedyatha🔽yadasādhu tadbahirvedi tasmāddakṣiṇaṃ vedyantamadhispṛśyevāsīta tulāyāṃ ha vā
analyzed: ha eva enam devatāḥ yājayanti  atha ha eṣā eva tulā yat dakṣiṇaḥ vedi antaḥ sa yat sādhu karoti tat antarvedi atha  yat asādhu tat bahirvedi tasmāt dakṣiṇam vedi antam adhispṛśya iva āsīta tulāyām ha vā
translated: These indeed are the deities that officiate for him.🔽Now, this is the balance: the right side of the altar. What he does well, that is within the altar.🔽What he does badly, that is outside the altar. Therefore, one should sit as if touching the right side of the altar. On the balance,

original: amuṣmiṃloka ādadhati yataradyaṃsyati tadanveṣyati yadi sādhu vāsādhu vetyatha ya
analyzed: amuṣmin loke ādadhati yatarad yaṃsyati tat anveṣyati yadi sādhu vā asādhu vā iti atha yaḥ
translated: they place him in the other world, thinking, He will seek out what is better than this, whether it is good or bad. But one who

original: evaṃ vedāsminhaivaloke tulāmārohatyatyamuṣmiṃloke tulādhānam mucyate
analyzed: evam veda asmin ha eva loke tulām ārohati ati amuṣmin loke tulādhānam mucyate
translated: knows thus mounts the balance in this world, and in the other world he escapes the weighing.

original: sādhukṛtyā haivāsya yacati na pāpakṛtyā / / /
analyzed: sādhu kṛtyāḥ ha eva asya yacati na pāpa kṛtyāḥ
translated: He seeks it through his good deeds, not through his evil deeds.

original: vāggha vā etasyāgnihotrasyāgnihotrī mana eva vatsastadidam manaśca vākca
analyzed: vāc ha vai etasya agnihotrasya agnihotrī manaḥ eva vatsaḥ tat idam manaḥ ca vāc ca
translated: The Agnihotra cow is indeed the speech of this Agnihotra, and the calf is the mind. This mind and speech

original: samānameva sannāneva tasmātsamānyā rajjvā vatsaṃ ca mātaraṃ cābhidadhati teja
analyzed: samānam eva sat nānā iva tasmāt samānyā rajjvā vatsam ca mātaram ca abhidadhati
translated: are the same, yet separate. Therefore, with a single rope they tie the calf and the mother together.

original: eva śraddhā satyamājyam / / /
analyzed: eva śraddhā satyam ājyam
translated: The fire is indeed faith, the ghee is truth.

original: taddhaitajjanako vaidehaḥ yājñavalkyam papraca vetthāgnihotraṃ iti
analyzed: tat ha etat janakaḥ vaidehaḥ yājñavalkyam papraca vettha agnihotram yājñavalkyaiḥ iti
translated: Now, Janaka of Videha asked Yajnavalkya: Do you know the Agnihotra?

original: veda samrāḍiti kimiti paya eveti / / /
analyzed: veda samrāj iti kim iti payaḥ eva iti
translated: I know it, O king, he said. What is it? Milk alone, he said.

original: yatpayo na syāt kena juhuyā iti vrīhiyavābhyāmiti yadvrīhiyavau na syātāṃ kena
analyzed: yat payaḥ na syāt kena juhuyāḥ iti vrīhi yavābhyām iti yat vrīhi yavau na syātām kena
translated: If there were no milk, with what would one offer? With rice and barley, he said. If there were no rice and barley, with what

original: juhuyā iti yā anyā oṣadhaya iti yadanyā oṣadhayo na syuḥ kena juhuyā iti yā āraṇyā🔽oṣadhtyeneti yadvānaspatyaṃ na syātkena juhuyā ityadbhiriti yadāpo na syuḥ kena
analyzed: juhuyāḥ iti yāḥ anyāḥ oṣadhayaḥ iti yat anyāḥ oṣadhayaḥ na syuḥ kena juhuyāḥ iti yā āraṇyā  oṣadhtyena iti yat vānaspatyam na syāt kena juhuyāḥ iti adbhiḥ iti yadā āpaḥ na syuḥ kena
translated: would one offer? With other plants, he said. If there were no other plants, with what would one offer? With wild plants, he said.

original: juhuyā iti / / /
analyzed: juhuyāḥ iti
translated: If there were no plants, with what would one offer? With water, he said. If there were no water, with what would one offer?🔽He said: At that time, there was nothing here at all. Then it was indeed offered through faith in truth.

original: sa hovāca na vā iha tarhi kiṃ canāsīdathaitadahūyataiva satyaṃ śraddhāyāmiti
analyzed: sa ha uvāca na vai iha tarhi kim cana āsīt atha etat ahūyata eva satyam śraddhāyām iti
translated: He said:

original: vetthāgnihotraṃ yājñavalkya dhenuśataṃ dadāmīti hovāca / / /🔽tadapyete ślokāḥ kiṃ svidvidvānpravasatyagnihotrī gṛhebhyaḥ kathaṃ svidasya
analyzed: vettha agnihotram yājñavalkya dhenu śatam dadāmi iti ha uvāca  tat api ete ślokāḥ kim svid vidvān pravasati agnihotrī gṛhebhyaḥ katham svid asya
translated: You know the Agnihotra, Yajnavalkya, said he, I will give you a hundred cows.

original: kāvyaṃ kathaṃ saṃtato agnibhiriti kathaṃ svidasyānapaproṣitam bhavatītyevaitadāha / / /
analyzed: kāvyam katham saṃtataḥ agnibhiḥ iti katham svid asya an apaproṣitam bhavati iti eva etat āha
translated: And about this there are these verses: What is it that the learned Agnihotrin leaves his home for? How is his poetry? How is he connected with the fires? How is it that he is not absent? he says this.

original: yo javiṣṭho bhuvaneṣu sa vidvānpravasanvide tathā tadasya kāvyaṃ tathā saṃtato
analyzed: yaḥ javiṣṭhaḥ bhuvaneṣu sa vidvān pravasan vide tathā tat asya kāvyam tathā saṃtataḥ
translated: He who is the swiftest in the worlds, he who is wise, when he goes away, he knows that, that is his poetry, thus he is connected with the fires. He says this.

original: agnibhiriti mana evaitadāha manasaivāsyānapaproṣitam bhavatīti / / /🔽yatsa dūram paretya atha tatra pramādyati kasmintsāsya hutāhutirgṛhe yāmasya
analyzed: agnibhiḥ iti manaḥ eva etat āha manasā eva asya an apaproṣitam bhavati iti  yat sa dūram paretya atha tatra pramādyati kasmin sā asya hutā āhutiḥ gṛhe yāmasya
translated: He says this: The mind, indeed, is that. By the mind, indeed, he is not absent.

original: juhvatīti yatsa dūram paretyātha tatra pramādyati kasminnasya sāhutirhutā
analyzed: juhvati iti yat sa dūram paretya atha tatra pramādyati kasmin asya sā āhutiḥ hutā
translated: When he has gone far away, and then becomes heedless there, in which of his houses is the offering made to him, to whom they offer the oblation? When he has gone far away, and then becomes heedless there, in which of his houses is the offering made to him,

original: bhavatītyevaitadāha / / /
analyzed: bhavati iti eva etat āha
translated: to whom they offer the oblation? he says this.

original: yo jāgāra bhuvaneṣu viśvā jātāni yo'bibhaḥ tasmintsāsya hutāhutirgṛhe yāmasya
analyzed: yaḥ jāgāra bhuvaneṣu viśvā jātāni yaḥ bibhar tasmin sā asya hutā āhutiḥ gṛhe yāmasya
translated: He who has watched in the worlds, who has protected all beings, in him is the offering made to him, in his house, to whom they offer the oblation. He says this.

original: juhvatīti prāṇamevaitadāha tasmādāhuḥ prāṇa evāgnihotramiti / / /
analyzed: juhvati iti prāṇam eva etat āha tasmāt āhuḥ prāṇaḥ eva agnihotram iti
translated: He says this: The breath, indeed, is that. Therefore they say, The Agnihotra is the breath.

original: yo ha vā agnihotre ṣaṇmithunāni veda mithunenamithunena ha prajāyate sarvābhiḥ🔽prajātibhiryajamānaśca patnī ca tadekam mithunaṃ tasmādasya patnīvadagnihotraṃ
analyzed: yaḥ ha vai agnihotre ṣaḍ mithunāni veda mithunena mithunena ha prajāyate sarvābhiḥ  prajātibhiḥ yajamānaḥ ca patnī ca tat ekam mithunam tasmāt asya patnīvat agnihotram
translated: He who knows the six pairs in the Agnihotra is propagated by pair after pair, by all the modes of propagation.🔽The sacrificer and his wife are one pair. Therefore, his Agnihotra should be like a wife.

original: syādetanmithunamupāpnavānīti vatsaścāgnihotrī ca tadekam mithunaṃ tasmādasya
analyzed: syāt etat mithunam upāpnavāni iti vatsaḥ ca agnihotrī ca tat ekam mithunam tasmāt asya
translated: Thinking, May I obtain this pair, the calf and the Agnihotra cow are one pair. Therefore,

original: puṃvatsāgnihotrī syādetanmithunamupāpnavānīti sthālī cāṅgārāśca tadekam
analyzed: puṃvat sā agnihotrī syāt etat mithunam upāpnavāni iti sthālī ca aṅgārāḥ ca tat ekam
translated: his Agnihotra cow should have a male calf. Thinking, May I obtain this pair, the pan and the embers are one pair.

original: mithunaṃ srukca sruvaśca tadekam mithunamāhavanīyaśca samicca tadekam🔽mithunamāhutiśca svāhākāraśca tadekam mithunametāni ha vā agnihotre🔽ṣaṇmithunāni tāni ya evaṃ veda mithunenamithunena ha prajāyate sarvābhiḥ
analyzed: mithunam sruc ca sruvaḥ ca tat ekam mithunam āhavanīyaḥ ca samidh ca tat ekam  mithunam āhutiḥ ca svāhākāraḥ ca tat ekam mithunam etāni ha vai agnihotre  ṣaṣ mithunāni tāni yaḥ evam veda mithunena mithunena ha prajāyate sarvābhiḥ
translated: The ladle and the spoon are one pair. The Ahavaniya and the kindling wood are one pair.🔽The oblation and the Svāhā exclamation are one pair. These are the six pairs in the Agnihotra.

original: prajātibhiḥ / / /
analyzed: prajātibhiḥ
translated: He who knows them thus is propagated by pair after pair, by all the modes of propagation.

original: brahma vai mṛtyave prajāḥ prāyacat tasmai brahmacāriṇameva na
analyzed: brahma vai mṛtyave prajāḥ prāyacat tasmai brahmacāriṇam eva na
translated: Brahmā indeed gave creatures to Death. To him he did not give the celibate student.

original: prāyacatso'bravīdastu mahyamapyetasminbhāga iti yāmeva rātriṃ samidhaṃ nāharātā
analyzed: prāyacat saḥ u bravīt astu mahyam api etasmin bhāge iti yām eva rātrim samidham na āharātā
translated: He said, Let me have a share in him too. On the night on which he did not bring the kindling wood,

original: iti tasmādyāṃ rātrim brahmacārī samidhaṃ nāharatyāyuṣa eva tāmavadāya vasati
analyzed: iti tasmāt yām rātrim brahmacārī samidham na āharati āyuṣe eva tām avadāya vasati
translated: Therefore, the night on which a student does not bring a piece of wood, he lives taking away from his life.

original: tasmādbrahmacārī samidhamāharennedāyuṣo'vadāya vasānīti / / /
analyzed: tasmāt brahmacārī samidham āharet na id āyuṣaḥ vadāya vasāni iti
translated: Therefore, a student should bring a piece of wood, thinking, 'I will not live taking away from my life.'

original: dīrghasattraṃ vā eṣa upaiti yo brahmacaryamupaiti sa
analyzed: dīrghasattram vai eṣaḥ upaiti yaḥ brahmacaryam upaiti sa
translated: He who enters the state of studentship enters a long sacrificial session.

original: yāmupayantsamidhamādadhāti sā prāyaṇīyā yāṃ snāsyantsodayanīyātha yā antareṇa
analyzed: yām upayan samidham ādadhāti sā prāyaṇīyā yām snāsyan sā udayanīyā atha yāḥ antareṇa
translated: The piece of wood he puts on when he enters is the Prāyaṇīyā (departure-Savan), that which he puts on when he is going to bathe is the Udayanīyā (return-Savan), and that which he puts on in between

original: sattryā evāsya tā brāhmaṇo brahmacaryamupayan / / /
analyzed: sattryāḥ eva asya tāḥ brāhmaṇaḥ brahmacaryam upayan
translated: is the Sattrīyā (of the sacrificial session). A Brāhmaṇa who enters the state of studentship

original: caturdhā bhūtāni praviśati agnim padā mṛtyum padācāryam padātmanyevāsya
analyzed: caturdhā bhūtāni praviśati agnim padā mṛtyum padā ācāryam padā ātmani eva asya
translated: enters the four quarters. He enters Agni with one foot, Death with one foot, the teacher with one foot, and he himself remains

original: caturthaḥ pādaḥ pariśiṣyate / / /
analyzed: caturthaḥ pādaḥ pariśiṣyate
translated: with the fourth foot.

original: sa yadagnaye samidhamāharati ya evāsyāgnau pādastameva tena parikrīṇāti taṃ
analyzed: sa yat agnaye samidham āharati yaḥ eva asya agnau pādaḥ tam eva tena parikrīṇāti tam
translated: When he brings a piece of wood to Agni, he buys back that foot of his which is in Agni.

original: saṃskṛtyātmandhatte sa enamā/viśati / / /
analyzed: saṃskṛtya ātman dhatte saḥ enam āviśati
translated: Having purified it, he takes it into himself, and it enters him.

original: atha yadātmānaṃ daridrīkṛtyeva ahrīrbhūtvā bhikṣate ya evāsya mṛtyau
analyzed: atha yat ātmānam daridrīkṛtya iva ahrīḥ bhūtvā bhikṣate yaḥ eva asya mṛtyau
translated: Then when he begs, having made himself poor as it were, and having become shameless, he buys back that foot of his which is in Death.

original: pādastameva tena parikrīṇāti taṃ saṃskṛtyātmandhatte sa enamāviśati / / /
analyzed: pādaḥ tam eva tena parikrīṇāti tam saṃskṛtya ātman dhatte saḥ enam āviśati
translated: Having purified it, he takes it into himself, and it enters him.

original: atha yadācāryavacasaṃ karoti yadācāryāya karma karoti ya evāsyācārye pādastameva
analyzed: atha yat ācārya vacasam karoti yat ācāryāya karma karoti yaḥ eva asya ācārye pādaḥ tam eva
translated: Now, when he does what the teacher tells him, when he does work for the teacher, then,

original: tena parikrīṇāti taṃ saṃskṛtyānmandhatte sa enamāviśati / / /
analyzed: tena parikrīṇāti tam saṃskṛtya anmandhatte saḥ enam āviśati
translated: with that very part of himself that is in the teacher, he buys him; having prepared it, he puts it on (the student's) head, and it enters him.

original: na ha vai snātvā bhikṣeta apa ha vai snātvā bhikṣāṃ jayatyapa
analyzed: na ha vai snātvā bhikṣeta apa ha vai snātvā bhikṣām jayati apa
translated: One should not beg for alms after bathing; for by bathing one conquers the alms.

original: jñātīnāmaśanāyāmapa pitṝṇāṃ sa evaṃ vidvānyasyā eva bhūyiṣṭhaṃ ślāgheta tām
analyzed: jñātīnām aśanāyām apa pitṝṇām saḥ evam vidvān yasyāḥ eva bhūyiṣṭham ślāgheta tām
translated: (One conquers) the food of one's kinsmen, and (the food) of one's ancestors. The one who knows thus should beg from her who is most praised.

original: bhikṣetetyāhustallokyamiti sa yadyanyāṃ bhikṣitavyāṃ na vindedapi
analyzed: bhikṣeta iti āhuḥ tat lokyam iti sa yadi anyām bhikṣitavyām na vindet api
translated: They say, That is the worldly way. If he does not find another from whom he should beg,

original: svāmevācāryajāyām bhikṣetātho svām mātaraṃ nainaṃ
analyzed: svām eva ācārya jāyām bhikṣeta atha u svām mātaram na enam
translated: he may beg from his own teacher's wife, or from his own mother.

original: saptamyabhikṣitātīyāttamevaṃ vidvāṃsamevaṃ carantaṃ sarve vedā āviśanti yathā ha
analyzed: saptamī abhikṣitā atīyāt tam evam vidvāṃsam evam carantam sarve vedāḥ āviśanti yathā ha
translated: He should not go beyond the seventh time (of begging). The one who knows thus, who behaves thus, all the Vedas enter him, just as

original: vā agniḥ samiddho rocata evaṃ ha vai sa snātvā rocate ya evaṃ vidvānbrahmacaryaṃ
analyzed: vai agniḥ samiddhaḥ rocate evam ha vai sa snātvā rocate yaḥ evam vidvān brahmacaryam
translated: fire, when it is well-kindled, shines. So does he shine, who, knowing thus,

original: carati / / /
analyzed: carati
translated: leads the religious life.🔽Uddālaka Āruṇi, surrounded by students, was performing a race. A gold coin was staked by him. This is what he

original: uddālako hāruṇiḥ udīcyānvṛto dhāvayāṃ cakāra tasya niṣka upāhita āsaitaddha sma
analyzed: uddālakaḥ ha āruṇiḥ udīcya anvṛtaḥ dhāvayām cakāra tasya niṣkaḥ upāhitaḥ āsa etat ha sma
translated: recalled:

original: vai tatpūrveṣāṃ vṛtānāṃ dhāvayatāmekadhanamupāhitam bhavatyupavalhāya
analyzed: vai tat pūrveṣām vṛtānām dhāvayatām ekadhanam upāhitam bhavati upavalhāya
translated: That was the one wealth which was brought to the assembled ancestors who were running. It was for the sake of the Upāṁshusavana stone.

original: bibhyatāṃ tānhodīcyānām brāhmaṇānbhīrviveda / / /
analyzed: bibhyatām tān ha udīcyānām brāhmaṇān bhīḥ viveda
translated: The Brahmins of the north were afraid of him.

original: kaurupañcālo vā ayam brahmā brahmaputraḥ yadvai no'yamardhaṃ na paryādadīta🔽hantainam brahmodyamāhvayāmahā iti kena vīreṇeti svaidāyaneneti śaunako ha
analyzed: kaurupañcālaḥ vai ayam brahmā brahma putraḥ yat vai na uyam ardham na paryādadīta  hanta enam brahmodyam āhvayāmahai iti kena vīreṇa iti svaidāyanena iti śaunakaḥ ha
translated: Either this Brahmin is from Kuru-Pañcāla, or he is the son of a Brahmin. If he does not give us this half,🔽let us challenge him to a contest in sacred knowledge. They said, With which hero? They said, With Svaidāyana. Svaidāyana

original: svaidāyana āsa / / /
analyzed: svaidāyanaḥ āsa
translated: was Śaunaka.

original: te hocuḥ svaidāyana tvayā vīreṇemam pratisaṃyatāmahā iti sa hovācopātra khalu
analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ svaidāyana tvayā vīreṇa imam pratisaṃyatāmahai iti sa ha uvāca upa atra khalu
translated: They said, Svaidāyana, with you as our hero, let us challenge him. He said, Let us stay here for a while.

original: ramatāhaṃ nvenaṃ vedānīti taṃ hābhiprapede taṃ hābhiprapannamabhyuvāda
analyzed: ramata aham nu enam vedāni iti tam ha abhiprapede tam ha abhiprapannam abhyuvāda
translated: I know him. He approached him. He addressed him as he was approaching.

original: iti gautamasya putretītaraḥ pratiśuśrāva taṃ ha tata eva praṣṭuṃ🔽dadhre / / /
analyzed: svaidāyanāḥ iti ho gautamasya putra iti itaraḥ pratiśuśrāva tam ha tatas eva praṣṭum  dadhre
translated: The other replied, He is the son of Gautama. He then began to question him.

original: sa vai gautamasya putra vṛto janaṃ dhāvayet yo darśapūrṇamāsayoraṣṭau
analyzed: sa vai gautamasya putra vṛtaḥ janam dhāvayet yaḥ darśa pūrṇamāsayoḥ aṣṭau
translated: The son of Gautama, when chosen, should make the people run, who knows eight

original: purastādājyabhāgānvidyātpañca madhyato havirbhāgānṣaṭ prājāpatyānaṣṭā
analyzed: purastāt ājyabhāgān vidyāt pañca madhyatas haviḥ bhāgān ṣaṭ prājāpatyān aṣṭā
translated: Ajyabhagas before the new and full moon sacrifices, five Havisbhagas in the middle, six Prajapati sacrifices, eight

original: upariṣṭādājyabhāgān / / /
analyzed: upariṣṭāt ājyabhāgān

analyzed: etat ha vai nyak yaḥ iyam uccais ādāya śanais nidadhāti sa yam iced pāpīyān syāt iti
translated: Now that (call for the 'Sraushat') is indeed downward, which (is uttered) loudly and softly put down; and if he should wish of any one, 'May he become worse,'

original: tasyoccairādāya śanairnidadhyāttena sa pāpīyānbhavati / / /
analyzed: tasya uccais ādāya śanais nidadhyāt tena sa pāpīyān bhavati
translated: let him call the 'Sraushat' for him loudly and put it down softly; and he (the person) becomes worse.

original: atha haitattiryak yo'yaṃ yāvataivādatte tāvatā nidadhāti sa yamicennaiva
analyzed: atha ha etat tiryak yaḥ iyam yāvatā eva ādatte tāvatā nidadhāti sa yam iced na eva
translated: Now that (call for the 'Sraushat') is indeed across, which (is uttered) as much (loudly) as he takes it up, so much he puts it down; and if he should wish of any one, 'May he not become worse, nor better,'

original: śreyāntsyānna pāpīyāniti tasya yāvataivādadīta tāvatā nidadhyāttena sa naiva🔽śreyānna
analyzed: śreyān syāt na pāpīyān iti tasya yāvatā eva ādadīta tāvatā nidadhyāt tena sa na eva  śreyān na
translated: 'May I be better, not worse,' (thinking thus) he should put down as much as he has taken away. By that he becomes

original: pāpīyānbhavati / / /
analyzed: pāpīyān bhavati
translated: neither better nor worse.

original: atha haitadūrdhvam yo'yaṃ śanairādāyoccairnidadhāti sa yamicecreyāntsyāditi tasya
analyzed: atha ha etat ūrdhvam yaḥ yam śanais ādāya uccais nidadhāti sa yam iced reyān syāt iti tasya
translated: Now, this (is the way) upwards, (when) he who takes (the Sâmidhenî verses) slowly and puts them down loudly. He whom he wishes to become better,

original: śanairādāyoccairnidadhyāttena sa śreyānbhavati / / /🔽atha haitatkṛpaṇam yo'yamaṇu dīrghamasvaramāśrāvayati yo hainaṃ tatra
analyzed: śanais ādāya uccais nidadhyāt tena sa śreyān bhavati  atha ha etat kṛpaṇam yaḥ u yam aṇu dīrgham asvaram āśrāvayati yaḥ ha enam tatra
translated: (of him) he should take (the verses) slowly and put them down loudly. By that he becomes better.

original: brūyātkṛpaṇaṃ nvā ayamadhvaryuryajamānamakaddviṣato
analyzed: brūyāt kṛpaṇam nvai ayam adhvaryuḥ yajamānam akaḥ dviṣataḥ
translated: Now, this (is the way) to be pitied, (when) he who calls (on the Hotri to recite the Sâmidhenî verses) in a low voice, indistinctly, and slowly. If any one should say to him,

original: bhrātṛvyasyopāvasāyinamitīśvaro ha tathaiva syāt / / /
analyzed: bhrātṛvyasya upāvasāyinam iti īśvaraḥ ha tathā eva syāt
translated: 'Surely, this Adhvaryu has made the sacrificer pitiable, a prey to his hateful foe,' he would be able to do so indeed.

original: atha haitadbahiḥśri yo'yamapavyādāyauṣṭhā uccairasvaramāśrāvayati śrīrvai svaro
analyzed: atha ha etat bahis śri yaḥ yama pavyādāya oṣṭhāḥ uccais asvaram āśrāvayati śrīḥ vai svaraḥ
translated: Now, this (is the way) to be without prosperity, (when) he who calls (on the Hotri to recite the Sâmidhenî verses) with his lips apart, indistinctly, and in a low voice. Prosperity is the voice;

original: bāhyata eva tacriyaṃ dhatte'śanāyuko bhavati / / /
analyzed: bāhyatas eva tat riyam dhatte īśanāyukaḥ bhavati
translated: he places the prosperity outside himself, and becomes one who has no food.

original: atha haitadantaḥśri yo'yaṃ saṃdhāyauṣṭhā uccaiḥ svaravadāśrāvayati śrīrvai
analyzed: atha ha etat antaḥśri yaḥ uyam saṃdhāya oṣṭhau uccais svaravat āśrāvayati śrīḥ vai
translated: Now, this (is the way) to have prosperity within (oneself), (when) he who calls (on the Hotri to recite the Sâmidhenî verses) with his lips closed, distinctly, and in a loud voice. Prosperity is the voice;

original: svaro'ntarata eva tacriyaṃ dhatte'nnādo bhavati / / /
analyzed: svaraḥ untarataḥ eva tat riyam dhatte id nādaḥ bhavati
translated: he places the prosperity within himself, and becomes one who has food.

original: sa vai mandramivorasi parāstabhyobhayatobārhatamuccairantato nidadhyāttasya
analyzed: sa vai mandram iva urasi parāstabhya ubhayatobārhatam uccais antatas nidadhyāt tasya
translated: He should place it on the chest, as if it were a pleasant (object), on both sides, in a low voice, according to the Brâhmana (rules), and at the end in a loud voice.

original: nopamīmāṃsāsti tatpaśavyamāyuṣyam / / /
analyzed: na upamīmāṃsā asti tat paśavyam āyuṣyam
translated: There is no discussion about it. It is favourable to cattle and to (long) life.

original: athāto homasya taddhaitadeke kuśalā manyamānāḥ prācīṃ srucamupāvahṛtya hutvā
analyzed: atha atas homasya tat ha etat eke kuśalāḥ manyamānāḥ prācīm srucam upāvahṛtya hutvā
translated: Now, then, of the Homa. In this (matter) some, thinking themselves skilled, having taken the spoon towards the east, offer,

original: paryāhṛtyopabhṛtyadhinidadhati na tathā kuryādyo hainaṃ tatra brūyādanuyuvaṃ nvā
analyzed: paryāhṛtya upabhṛti adhinidadhati na tathā kuryāt yaḥ ha enam tatra brūyāt anuyuvam nvā
translated: and having turned it round, they place it on the Upabhrit. Let him not do so. If any one were to say to him in that case, 'Surely,

original: ayamadhvaryuryajamānamakaddviṣato bhrātṛvyasyānvavasāyinamitīśvaro ha
analyzed: ayam adhvaryuḥ yajamānam akaḥ dviṣataḥ bhrātṛvyasya anvavasāyinam iti īśvaraḥ ha
translated: this Adhvaryu has made the sacrificer subject to his spiteful enemy, to his rival,' he would be liable

original: tathaiva syāt / / /🔽pārśvata u haike srucamupāvahṛtya hutvā paryāhṛtyopabhṛtyadhinidadhati na tathā🔽kuryādyo hainaṃ tatra brūyādatīrthena nvā ayamadhvaryurāhutīḥ prārautsītsaṃ vā
analyzed: tathā eva syāt  pārśvatas u ha eke srucam upāvahṛtya hutvā paryāhṛtya upabhṛti adhinidadhati na tathā  kuryāt yaḥ ha enam tatra brūyāt a tīrthena nvai ayam adhvaryuḥ āhutīḥ prārautsīt sam vā
translated: to do so in that way.🔽Some, on the side, having taken the spoon towards the east, offer, and having turned it round, they place it on the Upabhrit. Let him not do so. If any one were to say to him in that case, 'Surely,

original: śariṣyate ghuṇirvā bhaviṣyatītīśvaro ha tathaiva syāt / / /
analyzed: śariṣyate ghuṇiḥ vā bhaviṣyati iti īśvaraḥ ha tathā eva syāt
translated: this Adhvaryu has offered the oblations by an improper way; he will either perish or become a cripple,' he would be liable🔽to do so in that way.

original: itthameva kuryāt prācīmeva srucamupāvahṛtya hutvā
analyzed: ittham eva kuryāt prācīm eva srucam upāvahṛtya hutvā
translated: Let him do it in this way. Having taken the spoon towards the east, he offers,

original: tenaivādhihṛtyopabhṛtyadhinidadhyāttasya nopamīmāṃsāsti tatpaśavyamāyuṣyam / / /
analyzed: tena eva adhihṛtya upabhṛti adhinidadhyāt tasya na upamīmāṃsā asti tat paśavyam āyuṣyam
translated: With that very (Âgya) he should take up (the Âgya) and put it into the Upabhrit; there is no discussion about it; it is favourable to cattle and to life.

original: pradagdhāhutirha vā anyo'dhvaryuḥ āhutīrhānyaḥ saṃtarpayatyeṣa ha vai
analyzed: pradagdha āhutiḥ ha vai anyaḥ adhvaryuḥ āhutīḥ ha anyaḥ saṃtarpayati eṣa ha vai
translated: One Adhvaryu, indeed, offers the oblations that are burnt; another, indeed, satisfies the oblations.

original: pradagdhāhutiradhvayuryo'yamājyaṃ hutvāvadānāni juhotyetaṃ ha vai
analyzed: pradagdha āhutiḥ adhvayuḥ yaḥ yam ājyam hutvā avadānāni juhoti etam ha vai
translated: He, indeed, is the Adhvaryu who offers the oblations that are burnt, who, having offered the Âgya, offers the portions (of the oblations).

original: tadadṛśyamānā vāgabhyuvāda pradagdhāhutirnvā ayamadhvaryurityatha hainā eṣa
analyzed: tat adṛśyamānā vāc abhyuvāda pradagdha āhutiḥ nvai ayam adhvaryuḥ iti atha ha enāḥ eṣa
translated: Him, indeed, speech, invisible, addressed thus: 'Surely, this Adhvaryu offers the oblations that are burnt.' Then, indeed, he satisfies them.

original: saṃtarpayati yo'yamājyaṃ hutvāvadānāni juhotyatha punarantata ājyenābhijuhotyeṣa
analyzed: saṃtarpayati yaḥ yam ājyam hutvā avadānāni juhoti atha punar antatas ājyena abhijuhoti eṣa
translated: He, indeed, satisfies them, who, having offered the Âgya, offers the portions (of the oblations), and then finally offers again with Âgya.

original: haināḥ saṃtarpayati tāsāṃ saṃtṛptānāṃ devā hiraṇmayāṃścamasānpūrayante / / /
analyzed: ha enāḥ saṃtarpayati tāsām saṃtṛptānām devāḥ hiraṇmayān camasān pūrayante
translated: The gods fill the golden cups for them, when they are satisfied.

original: tadu hovāca yājñavalkyaḥ yadvā upastīryāvadāyābhighārayati tadevaināḥ saṃtarpayati
analyzed: tat u ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ yat vai upastīrya avadāya abhighārayati tat eva enāḥ saṃtarpayati
translated: But Yâgñavalkya said: 'When he takes up (the Âgya) after having spread (Âgya) on the Dhruvâ spoon and pours it on (the oblations), then he satisfies them.

original: tāsāṃ saṃtṛptānāṃ devā hiraṇmayāṃścamasānpūrayante'yasthūṇagṛhapatīnāṃ vai
analyzed: tāsām saṃtṛptānām devāḥ hiraṇmayān camasān pūrayanteya sthūṇa gṛhapatīnām vai
translated: The gods fill the golden cups for them, when they are satisfied.'

original: śaulbāyano'dhvaryurāsa / / /
analyzed: śaulbāyanaḥ adhvaryuḥ āsa
translated: Now, Saubhâyana, the Adhvaryu of the house of Ayasthûna,

original: sa hovāca idamahedaṃ sattraṃ kṛśapaśvalpājyamathāyaṃ gṛhapatirasmīti manyata iti / / /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca idam aha idam sattram kṛśa paśu alpa ājyam atha ayam gṛhapatiḥ asmi iti manyate iti
translated: He said, 'This our Sattra has been performed with poor cattle and little ghee, yet he thinks he is the householder.'

original: sa hovāca adhvaryavā vai no'krukṣa ete vai te srucau ye tvaṃ saṃvatsaraṃ nāśaka
analyzed: sa ha uvāca adhvaryavāḥ vai na ukrukṣe ete vai te srucau ye tvam saṃvatsaram na aśaka
translated: He said, 'O Adhvaryu, you have indeed deceived us. These are indeed your two ladles, which you were not able to take up for a year.

original: ādātuṃ yadvai tvāhametayoranuśiṣyām pra prajayā paśubhirjāyethā abhi svargaṃ🔽lokaṃ vaheriti / / /
analyzed: ādātum yat vai tvā aham etayoḥ anuśiṣyām pra prajayā paśubhiḥ jāyethāḥ abhi svargam  lokam vaheḥ iti
translated: If I were to instruct you in them, you would be propagated with offspring and cattle and would carry (the sacrificer) to heaven.

original: sa hovāca upa tvāyānīti sa hovācātra vāva khalvarhasi yo naḥ🔽saṃvatsare'dhvaryurabhūranupetāyaiva ta etadbravāṇīti tasmā u haitadeva
analyzed: sa ha uvāca upa tvā ayāni iti sa ha uvāca atra vāva khalu arhasi yaḥ naḥ  saṃvatsara idhvaryuḥ abhūḥ an upetāya eva te etat bravāṇi iti tasmai u ha etat eva
translated: He said, 'I will come to you.' He said, 'Here indeed you deserve (to be instructed), since you have been the Adhvaryu for us for a year.

original: srucorādānamuvāca yadetadvyākhyām tasmādevaṃvidamevādhvaryuṃ
analyzed: srucoḥ ādānam uvāca yat etat vyākhyām tasmāt evaṃvidam eva adhvaryum
translated: For one who has not come (to the Sattra), I will speak this.' Therefore he spoke to him this very taking up of the ladles, which is this explanation. Therefore one should make the Adhvaryu one who knows thus,

original: kurvītanānevaṃvidam / / /
analyzed: kurvītana anevaṃvidam
translated: not one who does not know thus.

original: prajāpatirvai prajāḥ sṛjamāno'tapyata tasmācrāntāttapānācrīrudakrāmatsā
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ vai prajāḥ sṛjamānā atapyata tasmāt ācrāntā ātta pānā acrīḥ udakrāmat sā
translated: Prajapati, creating the creatures, became heated. From him, heated by that heat, Shri went forth.

original: dīpyamānā
analyzed: dīpyamānā
translated: Shining,🔽luminous, trembling, she stood. The gods meditated on her,

original: bhrājamānā lelāyantyatiṣṭhatāṃ dīpyamānām bhrājamānāṃ lelāyantīṃ devā
analyzed: bhrājamānā lelāyantī atiṣṭhatām dīpyamānām bhrājamānām lelāyantīm devā
translated: shining,

original: abhyadhyāyan / / /
analyzed: abhyadhyāyan
translated: luminous, trembling.

original: te prajāpatimabruvan hanāmemāmedamasyā dadāmahā iti sa hovāca strī vā eṣā
analyzed: te prajāpatim abruvan hanāma imām ā idam asyāḥ dadāmahai iti sa ha uvāca strī vai eṣā
translated: They said to Prajapati, 'Let us slay her, let us give this to her.' He said, 'She is a woman,

original: yacrīrna vai striyaṃ ghnantyuta tvā asyā jīvantyā evādadata iti / / /
analyzed: yacrīḥ na vai striyam ghnanti uta tvai asyāḥ jīvantyāḥ eva ādadate iti
translated: for a woman they do not slay. Rather, give this to her while she is alive.'

original: tasyā agnirannādyamādatta somo rājyaṃ varuṇaḥ sāmrājyam mitraḥ kṣatramindro
analyzed: tasyāḥ agniḥ annādyam ādatta somaḥ rājyam varuṇaḥ sāmrājyam mitraḥ kṣatram indraḥ
translated: Of her, Agni took away food, Soma, kingship, Varuna, overlordship, Mitra, the Kshatra, Indra,

original: balam bṛhaspatirbrahmavarcasaṃ savitā rāṣṭram pūṣā bhagaṃ sarasvatī puṣṭiṃ
analyzed: balam bṛhaspatiḥ brahmavarcasam savitā rāṣṭram pūṣā bhagam sarasvatī puṣṭim
translated: power, Brihaspati, Brahmavarkasa, Savita, the kingdom, Pushan, fortune, Sarasvati, prosperity,

original: tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi / / /
analyzed: tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi
translated: Tvastr, forms.

original: sā prajāpatimabravīt ā vai ma idamadiṣateti sa hovāca yajñenainānpunaryācasveti / / /
analyzed: sā prajāpatim abravīt ā vai me idam adiṣata iti sa ha uvāca yajñena enān punar yācasva iti
translated: She said to Prajapati, 'They have taken away this of mine.' He said, 'With the sacrifice, ask them back.'

original: saitāṃ daśahaviṣamiṣṭimapaśyat āgneyamaṣṭākapālam puroḍāśaṃ saumyaṃ caruṃ
analyzed: sā etām daśa haviṣam iṣṭim apaśyat āgneyam aṣṭākapālam puroḍāśam saumyam carum
translated: She saw this Isti with ten oblations: an eight-kapala cake to Agni, an oblation to Soma,

original: vāruṇaṃ daśakapālam puroḍāśam maitraṃ carumaindramekādaśakapālam
analyzed: vāruṇam daśa kapālam puroḍāśam maitram carum aindram ekādaśa kapālam
translated: a ten-kapala cake to Varuna, an oblation to Mitra, an eleven-kapala cake to Indra,

original: puroḍāśam bārhaspatyaṃ caruṃ sāvitraṃ dvādaśakapālaṃ vāṣṭākapālaṃ vā puroḍāśam
analyzed: puroḍāśam bārhaspatyam carum sāvitram dvādaśa kapālam vā aṣṭākapālam vā puroḍāśam
translated: an oblation to Brihaspati, a twelve-kapala or eight-kapala cake to Savita,

original: pauṣṇaṃ caruṃ sārasvataṃ caruṃ tvāṣṭraṃ daśakapālam puroḍāśam / / /
analyzed: pauṣṇam carum sārasvatam carum tvāṣṭram daśa kapālam puroḍāśam
translated: an oblation to Pushan, an oblation to Sarasvati, a ten-kapala cake to Tvastr.

original: tānetayānuvākyayānvavadat agniḥ somo varuṇo mitra indro bṛhaspatiḥ savitā yaḥ
analyzed: tān etayā anuvākyayā anvavadat agniḥ somaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ indraḥ bṛhaspatiḥ savitā yaḥ
translated: He addressed them with this Anuvakya: Agni, Soma, Varuna, Mitra, Indra, Brihaspati, Savita,

original: sahasrī pūṣā no gobhiravasā sarasvatī tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi samanaktu yajñairiti te
analyzed: sahasrī pūṣā naḥ gobhiḥ avasā sarasvatī tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi samanaktu yajñaiḥ iti te
translated: The thousandfold one, Pushan, may they anoint us with cattle, with favor, Sarasvati, may Tvashtra anoint the forms with sacrifices. They

original: pratyupātiṣṭhanta / / /
analyzed: pratyupātiṣṭhanta
translated: stood facing him.

original: tānetayā yājyayā parastātpratilomam pratyaittvaṣṭā rūpāṇi dadatī sarasvatī pūṣā
analyzed: tān etayā yājyayā parastāt pratilomam pratyait tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi dadatī sarasvatī pūṣā
translated: He followed them with this Yajya from the other side, in the reverse order: Tvashtra, giving forms, Sarasvati, Pushan,

original: bhagaṃ savitā me dadātu bṛhaspatirdadadindro balam me mitraṃ kṣatraṃ varuṇaḥ
analyzed: bhagam savitā me dadātu bṛhaspatiḥ dadat indraḥ balam me mitram kṣatram varuṇaḥ
translated: May Savita give me fortune, Brihaspati give me strength, Indra give me power, Mitra give me lordship, Varuna

original: somo agniriti te punardānāyādhriyanta / / /
analyzed: somaḥ agniḥ iti te punardānāya adhriyanta
translated: Soma, Agni. They remained for the giving back.

original: saitānupahomānapaśyat agnirannādo'nnapatirannādyamasminyaj ñe mayi dadhātu
analyzed: sā etān upahomān apaśyat agniḥ anna āda unna patiḥ annādyam asmin yat ñe mayi dadhātu
translated: He saw these Upamshuyaja offerings: May Agni, the giver of food, the lord of food, bestow food upon me in this sacrifice.

original: svāhetyāhutimevādāyāgnirudakrāmatpunarasyā annādyamadadāt / / /
analyzed: svāhā iti āhutim eva ādāya agniḥ udakrāmat punar asyai annādyam adadāt
translated: Svaha. Taking the oblation, Agni departed. He gave back her food.

original: somo rājā rājapatiḥ rājyamasminyajñe mayi dadhātu svāhetyāhutimevādāya soma
analyzed: somaḥ rājā rāja patiḥ rājyam asmin yajñe mayi dadhātu svāhā iti āhutim eva ādāya soma
translated: May Soma, the king, the lord of kings, bestow lordship upon me in this sacrifice. Svaha. Taking the oblation, Soma

original: udakrāmatpunarasyai rājyamadadāt / / /
analyzed: udakrāmat punar asyai rājyam adadāt
translated: departed. He gave back her lordship.

original: varuṇaḥ samrāṭ samrāṭpatiḥ sāmrājyamasminyajñe mayi dadhātu
analyzed: varuṇaḥ samrāj samrāj patiḥ sāmrājyam asmin yajñe mayi dadhātu
translated: May Varuna, the emperor, the lord of emperors, bestow imperial power upon me in this sacrifice.

original: svāhetyāhutimevādāya varuṇa udakrāmatpunarasyai sāmrājyamadadāt / / /
analyzed: svāhā iti āhutim eva ādāya varuṇaḥ udakrāmat punar asyai sāmrājyam adadāt
translated: Having taken up the oblation with Svâhâ, Varuna went forth; he gave back to her his sovereignty.

original: mitraḥ kṣatraṃ kṣatrapatiḥ kṣatramasminyajñe mayi dadhātu
analyzed: mitraḥ kṣatram kṣatra patiḥ kṣatram asmin yajñe mayi dadhātu
translated: May Mitra, the lord of the Kshatra, bestow the Kshatra on me in this sacrifice.

original: svāhetyāhutimevādāya mitra/
analyzed: svāhā iti āhutim eva ādāya mitra
translated: Having taken up the oblation with Svâhâ, Mitra

original: udakrāmatpunarasyai kṣatramadadāt / / /
analyzed: udakrāmat punar asyai kṣatram adadāt
translated: went forth; he gave back to her the Kshatra.

original: indro balam balapatiḥ balamasminyajñe mayi dadhātu svāhetyāhutimevādāyendra
analyzed: indraḥ balam bala patiḥ balam asmin yajñe mayi dadhātu svāhā iti āhutim eva ādāya indra
translated: May Indra, the lord of strength, bestow strength on me in this sacrifice. Having taken up the oblation with Svâhâ, Indra

original: udakrāmatpunarasyai balamadadāt / / /
analyzed: udakrāmat punar asyai balam adadāt
translated: went forth; he gave back to her the strength.

original: bṛhaspatirbrahma brahaspatiḥ brahmavarcasamasminyajñe mayi dadhātu
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ brahma brahaspatiḥ brahmavarcasam asmin yajñe mayi dadhātu
translated: May Brihaspati, the Brahman, bestow the Brahman and the splendour of the Brahman on me in this sacrifice.

translated: He said, Gautama, what is your Agnihotra? What is the calf? What is the cow from which the milk is obtained? What is the rope?

translated: What is the milk that has been taken up? What is the milk being raised? What is the milk being carried? What is the milk that has been placed?🔽What kindling wood do you put on? I would not commit that sin, (said Yajnavalkya). That is not so, said he.

original: brahmacāryasānītyāha brahmaṇa evaitadātmānam paridadātyathainamāha ko
analyzed: brahmacārī asāni iti āha brahmaṇe eva etat ātmānam paridadāti atha enam āha kaḥ
translated: 'The Brahmakârin is the guest,' he says; for he (the student) is indeed a guest of the Brahman (the Veda). He then says to him,

original: nāmāsīti prajāpatirvai kaḥ prājāpatyamevainaṃ tatkṛtvopanayate / / /🔽athāsya hastaṃ gṛhṇāti indrasya
analyzed: nāma asi iti prajāpatiḥ vai kaḥ prājāpatyam eva enam tat kṛtvā upanayate  atha asya hastam gṛhṇāti indrasya
translated: He says, 'Brahmachāri, come hither!' He thereby gives himself up to the Brahman (the Veda). He then says to him, 'What is thy name?' 'Ka' (who) is Pragâpati: he thus introduces him to Pragâpati.

original: brahmacāryasyagnirācāryastavāhamācāryastavāsāvityete vai śreṣṭhe baliṣṭhe devate🔽etābhyāmevainaṃ śreṣṭhābhyām baliṣṭhābhyāṃ devatābhyām paridadāti tathā hāsya
analyzed: brahmacārī asi agniḥ ācāryaḥ tava aham ācāryaḥ tava asau iti ete vai śreṣṭhe baliṣṭhe devate  etābhyām eva enam śreṣṭhābhyām baliṣṭhābhyām devatābhyām paridadāti tathā ha asya
translated: He then takes hold of his hand, with , 'Indra's Brahmakârin thou art, Agni thy teacher, I am thy teacher, he is thy teacher.' These two are the most excellent and most powerful deities:

original: brahmacārī na kāṃ canārtimārcati na sa yaevaṃ veda / / /🔽athainam bhūtebhyaḥ paridadāti prajāpataye tvā paridadāmi devāya tvā savitre🔽paridadāmītyete vai śreṣṭhe varṣiṣṭhe devate etābhyāmevainaṃ śreṣṭhābhyāṃ
analyzed: brahmacārī na kām cana ārtim ārcati na sa yaḥ evam veda  atha enam bhūtebhyaḥ paridadāti prajāpataye tvā paridadāmi devāya tvā savitre  paridadāmi iti ete vai śreṣṭhe varṣiṣṭhe devate etābhyām eva enam śreṣṭhābhyām
translated: by means of these two most excellent and most powerful deities he delivers him over (to the teacher); and thus his Brahmakârin meets with no misfortune, nor does he who knows this.

original: varṣiṣṭhābhyāṃ devatābhyām paridadāti tathā hāsya brahmacārī na kāṃ🔽canārtimārcati na sa ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: varṣiṣṭhābhyām devatābhyām paridadāti tathā ha asya brahmacārī na kām 🔽cana ārtim ārcati na sa yaḥ evam veda
translated: He then delivers him over to the beings, with , 'To Pragâpati I deliver thee, to the god Savitri I deliver thee.' These two are the most excellent and most powerful deities: by means of these two most excellent and most powerful deities he delivers him over (to the teacher); and thus his Brahmakârin meets with no misfortune, nor does he who knows this.

original: adbhyastvauṣadhībhyaḥ paridadāmīti tadenamadbhyaścauṣadhibhyaśca paridadāti🔽dyāvāpṛthivībhyāṃ tvā paridadāmīti tadenamābhyāṃ dyāvāpṛthivībhyām paridadāti
analyzed: adbhyaḥ tvā oṣadhībhyaḥ paridadāmi iti tat enam adbhyaḥ ca oṣadhibhyaḥ ca paridadāti  dyāvāpṛthivībhyām tvā paridadāmi iti tat enam ābhyām dyāvāpṛthivībhyām paridadāti
translated: 'From the waters and plants I give thee in charge', he says; he thus gives him in charge to the waters and plants.🔽'I give thee in charge to Heaven and Earth', he says; he thus gives him in charge to these two, Heaven and Earth.

original: yayoridaṃ sarvamadhi viśvebhyastvā bhūtebhyaḥ paridadāmyariṣṭyā iti tadenaṃ🔽sarvebhyo bhūtebhyaḥ paridadātyariṣṭyai tathā hāsya brahmacārī na kāṃ
analyzed: yayoḥ idam sarvam adhi viśvebhyaḥ tvā bhūtebhyaḥ paridadāmi ariṣṭyai iti tat enam  sarvebhyaḥ bhūtebhyaḥ paridadāti ariṣṭyai tathā ha asya brahmacārī na kām
translated: 'To all beings I give thee in charge for safety', he says; he thus gives him in charge to all beings for safety.

original: canārtimārcati na sa ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: cana ārtim ārcati na sa yaḥ evam veda
translated: Thus his student does not come to any harm. He who knows thus.

original: brahmacāryasītyāha brahmaṇa evainaṃ tatparidadātyapo'śā netyamṛtaṃ vā
analyzed: brahmacārī asi iti āha brahmaṇe eva enam tat paridadāti apośāḥ na iti amṛtam vā
translated: 'Thou art a student', he says; he thus gives him in charge to the Brahman. 'Eat water', he says; water is immortality;

original: āpo'mṛtamaśānetyevainaṃ tadāha karma kurviti vīryaṃ vai karma vīryaṃ
analyzed: āpaḥ umṛtam aśāna iti eva enam tat āha karma kuru iti vīryam vai karma vīryam
translated: 'eat immortality', he says. 'Do the rite', he says; the rite is vigour;

original: kurvityevainaṃ tadāha samidhamādhehīti samintsvātmānaṃ tejasā
analyzed: kuru iti eva enam tat āha samidham ādhehi iti samintsva ātmānam tejasā
translated: 'do vigour', he says. 'Put on fuel', he says; 'heat thyself with heat,

original: brahmavarcasenetyevainaṃ tadāha mā śuṣupthā iti mā mṛthā ityevainaṃ
analyzed: brahmavarcasena iti eva enam tat āha mā śuṣupthāḥ iti mā mṛthāḥ iti eva enam
translated: with splendour', he says. 'Do not sleep', he says; 'do not die', he says.

original: tadāhāpo'śānetyamṛtaṃ vā āpo'mṛtamaśānetyevainaṃ tadāha tadenamubhayato'mṛtena
analyzed: tat āha apa uśāna iti amṛtam vai āpaḥ umṛtam aśāna iti eva enam tat āha tat enam ubhayatas mṛtena
translated: 'Eat water', he says; water is immortality; 'eat immortality', he says. Thus on both sides he surrounds him with immortality.

original: parigṛhṇāti tathā hāsya brahmacārī na kāṃ canārtimārcati na sa ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: parigṛhṇāti tathā ha asya brahmacārī na kām cana ārtim ārcati na sa yaḥ evam veda
translated: He takes hold of it; thus his student does not come to any harm, nor does he who knows this thus.

original: athāsmai sāvitrīmanvāha tāṃ ha smaitām purā saṃvatsare'nvāhuḥ saṃvatsarasammitā
analyzed: atha asmai sāvitrīm anvāha tām ha sma etām purā saṃvatsarenvā āhuḥ saṃvatsara sammitā
translated: Then he recites the Gayatri to him. Formerly they used to recite it after a year, for a year is equal to

original: vai garbhāḥ prajāyante jāta evāsmiṃstadvācaṃ dadhma iti / / /
analyzed: vai garbhāḥ prajāyante jāte eva asmin tat vācam dadhmaḥ iti
translated: a foetus. 'We place speech in him as soon as he is born,' they say.

original: atha ṣaṭsu māseṣu ṣaḍvā ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsarasya saṃvatsarasammitā vai garbhāḥ
analyzed: atha ṣaṭsu māseṣu ṣaṭ vai ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsarasya saṃvatsara sammitāḥ vai garbhāḥ
translated: Then in six months, for there are six seasons in a year. A year is equal to

original: prajāyante jāta evāsmiṃstadvācaṃ dadhma iti / / /
analyzed: prajāyante jāte eva asmin tat vācam dadhmaḥ iti
translated: a foetus. 'We place speech in him as soon as he is born,' they say.

original: atha caturviṃśatyahe caturviṃśatirvai saṃvatsarasyārdhamāsāḥ saṃvatsarasammitā vai
analyzed: atha caturviṃśati ahe caturviṃśatiḥ vai saṃvatsarasya ardha māsāḥ saṃvatsara sammitāḥ vai
translated: Then in twenty-four days, for there are twenty-four half-months in a year. A year is equal to

original: garbhāḥ prajāyante jāta evāsmiṃstadvācaṃ dadhma iti / / /
analyzed: garbhāḥ prajāyante jāte eva asmin tat vācam dadhmaḥ iti
translated: a foetus. 'We place speech in him as soon as he is born,' they say.

original: atha dvādaśāhe dvādaśa vai māsāḥ saṃvatsarasya saṃvatsarasam / / /
analyzed: atha dvādaśa ahe dvādaśa vai māsāḥ saṃvatsarasya saṃvatsarasam
translated: Then in twelve days, for there are twelve months in a year. A year is equal to🔽a foetus. 'We place speech in him as soon as he is born,' they say.

original: atha ṣaḍahe ṣadvā ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsarasya saṃvatsarasaṃ / / /
analyzed: atha ṣaṣ ahe ṣaṣ vai ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsarasya saṃvatsarasam
translated: Then in six days, for there are six seasons in a year. A year is equal to🔽a foetus. 'We place speech in him as soon as he is born,' they say.

original: atha tryahe trayo vā ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsarasya saṃvatsarasaṃ / / /
analyzed: atha tri ahe trayaḥ vai ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsarasya saṃvatsarasam
translated: Then in three days, for there are three seasons in a year. A year is equal to🔽a foetus. 'We place speech in him as soon as he is born,' they say.

original: tadapi ślokaṃ gāyanti ācāryo garbhī bhavati hastamādhāya dakṣiṇam tṛtīyasyāṃ sa🔽jāyate sāvitryā saha brāhmaṇa iti sadyo ha tvāva brāhmaṇāyānubrūyādāgneyo vai
analyzed: tat api ślokam gāyanti ācāryaḥ garbhī bhavati hastam ādhāya dakṣiṇam tṛtīyasyām sa  jāyate sāvitryā saha brāhmaṇaḥ iti sadyas ha tvāva brāhmaṇāya anubrūyāt āgneyaḥ vai
translated: They also sing this verse: The teacher becomes pregnant, placing his right hand (on the student's head). In the third (month), he is born, together with the Sāvitrī, as a Brāhmaṇa.

original: brāhmaṇaḥ sadyo vā agnirjāyate tasmātsadya eva brāhmaṇāyānubrūyāt / / /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ sadyas vai agniḥ jāyate tasmāt sadyas eva brāhmaṇāya anubrūyāt
translated: But one should immediately recite it for a Brāhmaṇa. For the Brāhmaṇa is connected with Agni, and Agni is born immediately. Therefore one should immediately recite it for a Brāhmaṇa.

original: tāṃ haitāmeke sāvitrīmanuṣṭubhamanvāhurvāgvā anuṣṭuptadasminvācaṃ dadhma
analyzed: tām ha etām eke sāvitrīm anuṣṭubham anvāhuḥ vāc vai anuṣṭubh tat asmin vācam dadhma
translated: Some recite that Sāvitrī in the Anushtubh meter, saying, The Anushtubh is speech. We place speech in him.

original: iti na tathā kuryādyo hainaṃ tatra brūyādā nvā ayamasya vācamadita mūko
analyzed: iti na tathā kuryāt yaḥ ha enam tatra brūyāt ā nvai ayam asya vācam adita mūkaḥ
translated: One should not do it that way. If someone were to say to him there, He has taken away his speech. He will be dumb,

original: bhaviṣyatītīśvaro ha tathaiva syāttasmādetāṃ gāyatrīmeva sāvitrīmanubrūyāt / / /
analyzed: bhaviṣyati iti īśvaraḥ ha tathā eva syāt tasmāt etām gāyatrīm eva sāvitrīm anubrūyāt
translated: it would be as if he were to do so. Therefore one should recite that Sāvitrī in the Gāyatrī meter.

original: atha haike dakṣiṇataḥ tiṣṭhate vāsīnāya vānvāhurna tathā kuryādyo hainaṃ tatra
analyzed: atha ha eke dakṣiṇatas tiṣṭhate vā āsīnāya vā anvāhuḥ na tathā kuryāt yaḥ ha enam tatra
translated: Then some recite it to one sitting to the south. One should not do it that way. If someone were to say to him there,

original: brūyādbulbaṃ nvā ayamimamajījanata bulbo bhaviṣyatītīśvaro ha tathaiva
analyzed: brūyāt bulbam nvai ayam imam ajījanata bulbaḥ bhaviṣyati iti īśvaraḥ ha tathā eva
translated: He has generated this as a tumor. He will be a tumor, it would be as if he were to do so.

original: syāttasmātpurastādeva pratīce samīkṣamāṇāyānubrūyāt / / /
analyzed: syāt tasmāt purastāt eva pratīce samīkṣamāṇāya anubrūyāt
translated: Therefore one should recite it to one sitting in front, facing east.

original: tāṃ vai paco'nvāha trayo vai prāṇāḥ prāṇa udāno🔽vyānastānevāsmiṃstaddadhātyathārdharcaśo dvau vā imau prāṇau prāṇodānāveva
analyzed: tām vai paca unvāha trayaḥ vai prāṇāḥ prāṇaḥ udānaḥ  vyānaḥ tān eva asmin tat dadhāti atha ardharcaśaḥ dvau vai imau prāṇau prāṇa udānau eva
translated: He recites it by parts; there are three vital airs, expiration, inspiration, and cross-breathing;🔽he thus puts them into him. Then by half-verses; there are two of these vital airs, expiration and inspiration;

original: prāṇodānāvevāsmiṃstaddadhātyatha kṛtsnāmeko vā ayam prāṇaḥ kṛtsna eva
analyzed: prāṇa udānau eva asmin tat dadhāti atha kṛtsnām ekaḥ vai ayam prāṇaḥ kṛtsnaḥ eva
translated: he thus puts expiration and inspiration into him. Then complete; this vital air is complete;

original: prāṇamevāsmiṃstatkṛtsnaṃ dadhāti / / /🔽tadāhuḥ na brahmaṇam brahmacaryamupanīya mithunaṃ caredgarbho vā eṣa
analyzed: prāṇam eva asmin tat kṛtsnam dadhāti  tat āhuḥ na brahmaṇam brahmacaryam upanīya mithunam caret garbhaḥ vai eṣa
translated: he thus puts the complete vital air into him.

original: bhavati yo brahmacaryamupaiti nedimam brahmaṇaṃ viṣiktādretaso janayānīti / / /
analyzed: bhavati yaḥ brahmacaryam upaiti na id imam brahmaṇam viṣiktāt retasaḥ janayāni iti
translated: As to that they say, 'Let him not approach a female after he has initiated a Brahman, for he who enters on the Brahmakarya becomes an embryo; let me not beget this Brahman from corrupted seed.'

original: tadu vā āhuḥ kāmameva careddvayyo vā imāḥ prajā daivyaścaiva manuṣyaśca tā vā
analyzed: tat u vai āhuḥ kāmam eva caret dvayyaḥ vai imāḥ prajāḥ daivyaḥ ca eva manuṣyaḥ ca tāḥ vā
translated: But they also say, 'Let him approach (a female) at will; for twofold are these creatures, divine and human;

original: imā manuṣyaḥ prajāḥ prajananātprajāyante candāṃsi vai daivyaḥ prajāstāni mukhato
analyzed: imāḥ manuṣyaḥ prajāḥ prajananāt prajāyante candāṃsi vai daivyaḥ prajāḥ tāni mukhataḥ
translated: and these human creatures are born from generation; but the divine creatures are the metres; from the mouth he begets them;

original: janayate tata etaṃ janayate tasmādu kāmameva caret / / /
analyzed: janayate tatas etam janayate tasmāt u kāmam eva caret
translated: and from them he begets this (child); therefore let him approach (a female) at will.'

original: tadāhuḥ na brahmacārī sanmadhvaśnīyādoṣadhīnāṃ vā eṣa paramo raso yanmadhu
analyzed: tat āhuḥ na brahmacārī san madhu aśnīyāt oṣadhīnām vai eṣa paramaḥ rasaḥ yat madhu
translated: As to that they say, 'Let not a Brahman who is a student eat honey; for honey is the highest essence of plants;

original: nedannādyasyāntaṃ gacānītyatha ha smāha śvetaketurāruṇeyo brahmacārī
analyzed: na id annādyasya antam gacāni iti atha ha sma āha śvetaketuḥ āruṇeyaḥ brahmacārī
translated: lest the food should come to an end.' Then Śvetaketu Āruṇeya, the student, said:

original: sanmadhvaśnaṃstrayyai vā etadvidyāyai śiṣṭaṃ yanmadhu sa tu raso
analyzed: sat madhu aśnan trayyai vai etat vidyāyai śiṣṭam yat madhu sa tu
translated: 'The honey that is left over is the remnant of that knowledge of the three Vedas, and honey is the essence.

original: yasyedṛkśiṣṭamiti yathā ha vā ṛcaṃ vā yajurvā sāma vābhivyāharettādṛktadya evaṃ
analyzed: yasya īdṛś śiṣṭam iti yathā ha vai ṛcam vā yajuḥ vā sāma vā abhivyāharet tādṛś tat yaḥ evam
translated: He who has such a remnant left over.' Just as one would recite a Ṛc verse, a Yajuṣ formula, or a Sāman chant, so is it

original: vidvānbrahmacārī sanmadhvaśnāti tasmādu kāmamevāśnīyāt / / /
analyzed: vidvān brahmacārī san madhu aśnāti tasmāt u kāmam eva aśnīyāt
translated: when a student who knows this eats the honey that is left over. Therefore one may eat it if one wishes.

original: devānvā ūrdhvāntsvargaṃ lokaṃ yataḥ asurāstamasāntaradadhuste hocurna vā
analyzed: devān vai ūrdhvān svargam lokam yataḥ asurāḥ tamasā antaradadhuḥ te ha ūcuḥ na vā
translated: The gods, who were above, in the heavenly world, were enveloped in darkness by the Asuras. They said:

original: asyānyena sattrādapaghāto'sti hanta sattramāsāmahā iti / / /
analyzed: asya anyena sattrāt apaghātaḥ asti hanta sattram āsāmahai iti
translated: 'There is no way to destroy this darkness except by a sacrificial session. Let us perform a sacrificial session.'

original: te śatāgniṣṭomaṃ sattramupeyuḥ te yāvadāsīnaḥ🔽parāpaśyettāvatastamo'pāghnataivameva śatokthyena
analyzed: te śata agniṣṭomam sattram upeyuḥ te yāvat āsīnaḥ  parāpaśyet tāvataḥ tam opāghnata evam eva śata ukthyena
translated: They performed a sacrificial session of a hundred Agniṣṭoma sacrifices. As far as one can see while sitting,🔽they destroyed the darkness to that extent. In the same way, by the Śatākhyāna (sacrifice),

original: yāvattiṣṭhanparāpaśyettāvatastamo'pāghnata / / /
analyzed: yāvat tiṣṭhan parāpaśyet tāvataḥ tam opāghnata
translated: as far as one can see while standing, they destroyed the darkness to that extent.

original: te hocuḥ apa vāva tamo hanmahe na tveva sarvamiva hanta prajāpatim pitaram
analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ apa vāva tamaḥ hanmahe na tu eva sarvam iva hanta prajāpatim pitaram
translated: They said: 'We have indeed destroyed the darkness, but not everything, as it were. Let us go to our father Prajāpati.'

original: pratyayāmeti te prajāpatim pitaram pratītyocurasurā vai no bhagava ūrdhvāntsvargaṃ
analyzed: pratyayāma iti te prajāpatim pitaram pratītya ūcuḥ asurāḥ vai naḥ bhagavaḥ ūrdhvān svargam
translated: They went to Prajapati, their father, and said: O revered one, the Asuras have hidden us from the world above, from heaven,

original: lokaṃ yatastamasāntaradadhuḥ / / /
analyzed: lokam yatas tamasā antaradadhuḥ
translated: from the light.

original: te śatāgniṣṭomaṃ sattramupaima te yāvadāsīnaḥ🔽parāpaśyettāvatastamo'pāhanmahyevameva śatokthyena
analyzed: te śata agniṣṭomam sattram upaima te yāvat āsīnaḥ  parāpaśyet tāvataḥ tam opāhanmahi evam eva śata ukthyena
translated: They entered the Sattra of the Agnishtoma of a hundred (nights). As long as they sat,🔽as far as they could see, so far they removed the darkness. By the Ukthya of a hundred (nights),

original: yāvattiṣṭhanparāpaśyettāvatastamo'pāhanmahi pra no bhagavañcādhi
analyzed: yāvat tiṣṭhan parāpaśyet tāvataḥ tam opāhanmahi pra naḥ bhagavan ca adhi
translated: as long as they stood, as far as they could see, so far they removed the darkness. 'Greatly indeed, O revered one,

original: yathāsurāṃstamo'pahatya sarvam pāpmānamapahatya svargaṃ lokam prajñāsyāma iti / / /
analyzed: yathā asurān tamaḥ upahatya sarvam pāpmānam apahatya svargam lokam prajñāsyāmaḥ iti
translated: how may we remove the darkness of the Asuras, how may we remove all evil and attain the world of heaven?'

original: sa hovāca asarvakratubhyāṃ vai yajñābhyāmaganta yadagniṣṭomena cokthyena ca
analyzed: sa ha uvāca a sarva kratubhyām vai yajñābhyām aganta yat agniṣṭomena ca ukthyena ca
translated: He said: You have come with two sacrifices that are not all-encompassing, with the Agnistoma and the Ukthya.

original: śatātirātraṃ sattramupeta tenāsurāṃstamo'pahatya sarvam pāpmānamapahatya
analyzed: śatātirātram sattram upeta tena asurān tam upahatya sarvam pāpmānam apahatya
translated: Enter the Sattra of the Atiratra of a hundred (nights). By that you will remove the darkness of the Asuras, remove all evil,

original: svargaṃ lokam prajñāsyatheti / / /
analyzed: svargam lokam prajñāsyatha iti
translated: and attain the world of heaven.

original: te śatātirātraṃ sattramupeyuḥ tenāsurāṃstamo'pahatya sarvam pāpmānamapahatya
analyzed: te śatātirātram sattram upeyuḥ tena asurān tam upahatya sarvam pāpmānam apahatya
translated: They entered the Sattra of the Atiratra of a hundred (nights). By that they removed the darkness of the Asuras, removed all evil,

original: svargaṃ lokam prajajñusteṣāmarvākpañcāśeṣvevāhaḥsvaharabhi rātrisāmāni parīyū
analyzed: svargam lokam prajajñuḥ teṣām arvāk pañcāśeṣu eva ahaḥsu ahar abhi rātri sāmāni parīyū
translated: and attained the world of heaven. Among them, in the first fifty nights, the night-Sāmans were repeated in the morning and evening.

original: rātrimabhyahaḥsāmāni / / /
analyzed: rātrim abhi ahar sāmāni
translated: The night and day are the same.

original: te hocuḥ amuhāma vai na prajānīmo hanta prajāpatimeva pitaram pratyayāmeti te
analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ amuhāma vai na prajānīmaḥ hanta prajāpatim eva pitaram pratyayāma iti te
translated: They said: We are confused, we do not know. Let us go to Prajapati, our father.

original: prajāpatimeva pitaram pratītyocurahanno rātrisāmāni rātryāmahno bhavanti naḥ

translated: Having gone to Prajapati, their father, they said: The night-chants are in the night for us, the day-chants are in the day for us.

analyzed: vipaścit yajñān mugdhān vidvān dhīraḥ anuśādhi naḥ iti

translated: He said to them: Just as a powerful snake, having emerged from a lake,

analyzed: dhīrāḥ santaḥ a dhīra vat praśāstrā tam upeta śanais a pratiśaṃsata iti

translated: They said: How, O revered one, is it praised? How is it not praised? He said: Where

translated: the Hotri, reciting the Ashvina hymn, reaches the end of the sacrifice dedicated to Agni and the Gayatri meter,

analyzed: prātaranuvākam upākurutāt uccais hotā śaṃsati śanais itaraḥ jañjapyamānaḥ iva anvāha
translated: They perform the morning recitation. The Hotṛ recites loudly, the other recites slowly, as if muttering.

original: tanna vācā vācam pratyeti na candasā candaḥ / / /🔽parihite prātaranuvāke yathāyatanamevopāṃśvantaryāmau hutvā droṇakalaśe
analyzed: tat na vācā vācam pratyeti na candasā candaḥ  parihite prātaranuvāke yathāyatanam eva upāṃśu antaryāmau hutvā droṇakalaśe

analyzed: pavitram prapīḍyam nidadhāti tirohnayaiḥ caritvā pratyañcaḥ pratiparetya  tirohnayānā iva bhakṣayādhvai atha anupūrvam yajña pucam saṃsthāpya yaḥ ūrdhvā  antaryāmāt grahāḥ tān gṛhītvā vipruṣām homam hutvā saṃtanim ca bahiṣpavamānena
translated: he presses the strainer into the Dronakalasha. Having performed the rites of the next day, they return facing west,🔽and consume the remnants of the next day's Soma. Then, having completed the sacrificial after-rites in due order, and having taken the libations

translated: These are the verses: With four united Saindhava horses, the wise dispelled the darkness, the learned gods

analyzed: śatakratu devāḥ sattram atanvata iti

translated: For four are united here: two Hotṛ priests and two Adhvaryu priests. As if with the two jaws of a plow,

analyzed: vitatam mohayanti naḥ pūrvasya ahnaḥ pariṣiṃṣanti karma
translated: They spread out and confuse us. They sprinkle the ritual of the previous day.

analyzed: tat uttareṇa abhivitanvata ihnā durvijñānam kāvyam devatānām somāḥ somaiḥ vyatiṣaktāḥ

analyzed: kāṣṭhāt tathā etam devayajñam samāpnoti
translated: Day after day one should offer oblations to the elements. In this way one completes that sacrifice to the elements. Day after day one should give a pot of water. Day after day one should utter svaha from a piece of wood. In this way one completes that sacrifice to the gods.

analyzed: lokaḥ udayanam yāvantam ha vai imām pṛthivīm vittena pūrṇām dadan lokam jayati

analyzed: tris tāvantam jayati bhūyāṃsam ca akṣayyam yaḥ evam vidvān aharahar svādhyāyam adhīte
translated: he conquers three times as much and more, and imperishable, he who, knowing this, studies the Veda daily.

original: tasmātsvāhyāyo'dhyetavyaḥ / / /🔽payāahutayo ha vā etā devānām yadṛcaḥ sa ya evaṃ vidvānṛco'harahaḥ

analyzed: nt svadhāḥ abhivahanti
translated: and streams of honey, they carry the offerings of svadhā to the ancestors.

analyzed: ājya āhutayaḥ ha vai etāḥ devānām yat yajūṃṣi sa yaḥ evam vidvān yajūṃṣi ahar ahar

analyzed: svādhyāyam adhīte ājya āhutibhiḥ eva tat devān tarpayati te enam tṛptāḥ tarpayanti
translated: By the study of the Veda, he satisfies the gods with the oblations of ghee. Being satisfied, they satisfy him.

analyzed: yogakṣemeṇa prāṇena re  soma āhutayaḥ ha vai etāḥ devānām yat sāmāni sa yaḥ evam vidvān sāmāni aharahar

analyzed: svādhyāyam adhīte soma āhutibhiḥ eva tat devān tarpayati te enam tṛptāḥ tarpayanti
translated: he satisfies the gods with the Soma-oblations. Being satisfied, they satisfy him.

original: yogakṣemeṇa prāṇena re / / /

analyzed: medā āhutayaḥ ha vai etāḥ devānām yat atharva aṅgirasaḥ sa yaḥ evam  vidvān atharva aṅgirasaḥ uharahar svādhyāyam adhīte medā āhutibhiḥ eva
