analyzed: tat devān tarpayati te enam tṛptāḥ tarpayanti yogakṣemeṇa prāṇena re  madhu āhutayaḥ ha vai etāḥ devānām yat anuśāsanāni vidyā vākovākyam itihāsa purāṇam
translated: he satisfies the gods with the clarified butter-oblations. Being satisfied, they satisfy him. With the attainment of union and safety, with the vital breath, he delights them.

original: taddevāṃstarpayati ta enaṃ tṛptāstarpayanti yogakṣemeṇa prāṇena re / / /
analyzed: tat devān tarpayati te enam tṛptāḥ tarpayanti yogakṣemeṇa prāṇena re
translated: That satisfies the gods. Being satisfied, they satisfy him with well-being and life.

original: tasya vā etasya brahmayajñasya catvāro vaṣaṭkārā yadvāto vāti yadvidyotate🔽yatstanayati yadavasphūrjati tasmādevaṃvidvāte vāti vidyotamāne

analyzed: mucyate gacati brahmaṇaḥ sātmatām sa ced api prabalam iva na śaknuyāt api ekam

analyzed: deva padam adhīyīta eva tathā bhūtebhyaḥ na hīyate

analyzed: atha atas svādhyāya praśaṃsā priye svādhyāya pravacane bhavataḥ yukta manāḥ

analyzed: bhavati apara adhīnaḥ harahar arthān sādhayate sukham svapiti parama cikitsakaḥ
translated: one who is not dependent, one who accomplishes his goals day by day, one who sleeps happily, one who is the supreme physician for himself,

analyzed: bhavati indriya saṃyamaḥ ca eka ārāma tā ca prajñā ṛddhiḥ yaśaḥ loka paktiḥ prajñā
translated: one who has control over the senses, one who delights in solitude, one whose wisdom increases, one who has fame, one who is respected by the world, one whose wisdom increases,

analyzed: vardhamānā caturaḥ dharmān brāhmaṇam abhiniṣpādayati brāhmaṇyam
translated: and one who accomplishes the four goals of human life. He becomes a true Brahmin.

analyzed: bhunakti arcayā ca dānena ca a jyeya tayā ca a vadhya tayā ca

analyzed: kāṣṭhā yaḥ evam vidvān svādhyāyam adhīte tasmāt svādhyāyaḥ udhyetavyaḥ

original: yadyaddha vā ayaṃ candasaḥ svādhyāyamadhīte tenatena haivāsya
analyzed: yat yat ha vai ayam candasaḥ svādhyāyam adhīte tena tena ha eva asya
translated: Whatever one studies as one's own Veda, by that very thing

analyzed: yajñakratunā iṣṭam bhavati yaḥ evam vidvān svādhyāyam adhīte
translated: his sacrifice is performed, one who, knowing this, studies the Veda.

original: tasmātsvādhyāyo'dhyetavyaḥ / / /
analyzed: tasmāt svādhyāyaḥ udhyetavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, the Veda should be studied.

original: yadi ha vā apyabhyaktaḥ alaṃkṛtaḥ suhitaḥ sukhe śayane śayānaḥ svādhyāyamadhīta

translated: If one, anointed, adorned, well-fed, lying on a comfortable bed, studies the Veda,

analyzed: ā ha eva sa nakha agrebhyaḥ tapyate yaḥ evam vidvān svādhyāyam adhīte
translated: he is indeed tormented by that, from the tips of his nails, one who, knowing this, studies the Veda.

original: tasmātsvādhyāyo'dhyetavyaḥ / / /
analyzed: tasmāt svādhyāyaḥ udhyetavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, the Veda should be studied.

original: madhu ha vā ṛcaḥ ghṛtaṃ ha sāmānyamṛtaṃ yajūṃṣi yaddha vā ayaṃ
analyzed: madhu ha vai ṛcaḥ ghṛtam ha sāmāni amṛtam yajūṃṣi yat ha vai ayam
translated: The Ṛc verses are indeed honey, the Sāman chants are indeed clarified butter, the Yajuṣ formulas are indeed nectar. Whatever

original: vākovākyamadhīte kṣīraudanamāṃsaudanau haiva tau / / /
analyzed: vākovākyam adhīte kṣīraudana māṃsaudanau ha eva tau
translated: He who recites the Vakya hymns satisfies the gods with milk-rice and meat-rice.

original: madhunā ha vā eṣa devāṃstarpayati ya evaṃ vidvānṛco'harahaḥ svādhyāyamadhīte ta
analyzed: madhunā ha vai eṣa devān tarpayati yaḥ evam vidvān ṛcaḥ uhar ahar svādhyāyam adhīte
translated: He who, knowing thus, recites the Ṛc verses day after day for his daily recitation, satisfies the gods with honey.

original: enaṃ tṛptāstarpayanti sarvaiḥ kāmaiḥ sarvairbhogaiḥ / / /🔽ghṛtena ha vā eṣa devāṃstarpayati ya evaṃ vidvāntsāmānyaharahaḥ
analyzed: enam tṛptāḥ tarpayanti sarvaiḥ kāmaiḥ sarvaiḥ bhogaiḥ  ghṛtena ha vai eṣa devān tarpayati yaḥ evam vidvān sāmāni ahar ahar
translated: They, being satisfied, satisfy him with all desires and all enjoyments.

original: svādhyāyamadhīte ta enaṃ tṛptā / / /🔽amṛtena ha vā eṣa devāṃstarpayati ya evaṃ vidvānyajūṃṣyaharahaḥ
analyzed: svādhyāyam adhīte te enam tṛptā  amṛtena ha vai eṣa devān tarpayati yaḥ evam vidvān yajūṃṣi aharahar
translated: He who, knowing thus, recites the Sāman hymns day after day for his daily recitation, satisfies the gods with ghee. They, being satisfied, satisfy him with all desires and all enjoyments.

original: svādhyāyamadhīte ta enaṃ tṛptā / / /🔽kṣīraudanamāṃsaudanābhyāṃ ha vā eṣa devāṃstarpayati ya evaṃ
analyzed: svādhyāyam adhīte te enam tṛptā  kṣīraudana māṃsaudanābhyām ha vai eṣa devān tarpayati yaḥ evam
translated: He who, knowing thus, recites the Yajuṣ hymns day after day for his daily recitation, satisfies the gods with nectar. They, being satisfied, satisfy him with all desires and all enjoyments.

original: vidvānvākovākyamitihāsapurāṇamityaharahaḥ svādhyāyamadhīte ta enaṃ tṛptā / / /🔽yanti vā āpaḥ etyāditya eti candramā yanti nakṣatrāṇi yathā ha vā etā devatā neyurna
analyzed: vidvān vākovākyam itihāsa purāṇam iti ahar ahar svādhyāyam adhīte te enam tṛptā  yanti vai āpaḥ eti ādityaḥ eti candramāḥ yanti nakṣatrāṇi yathā ha vai etāḥ devatāḥ na iyuḥ na
translated: He who, knowing thus, recites the Vakya hymns, Itihāsa and Purāṇa day after day for his daily recitation, satisfies the gods with milk-rice and meat-rice. They, being satisfied, satisfy him with all desires and all enjoyments.

original: kuryurevaṃ haiva tadaharbrāhmaṇo bhavati yadahaḥ svādhyāyaṃ nādhīte
analyzed: kuryuḥ evam ha eva tat ahar brāhmaṇaḥ bhavati yat ahar svādhyāyam na adhīte
translated: The waters move, the sun moves, the moon moves, the stars move. Just as these deities would move and not do their work, so indeed is that brāhmaṇa on that day when he does not recite his daily recitation.

original: tasmātsvādhyāyo'dhyetavyastasmādapyṛcaṃ vā yajurvā sāma vā gāthāṃ vā kuṃvyāṃ
analyzed: tasmāt svādhyāyaḥ udhyetavyaḥ tasmāt api ṛcam vā yajuḥ vā sāma vā gāthām vā
translated: Therefore, the Veda should be studied. Therefore, even if one were to recite a Ṛk verse, a Yajuṣ formula, a Sāman chant, a Gāthā, or a Kuvīti verse

original: vābhivyāharedvratasyāvyavacedāya / / /🔽prajāpatirvā idamagra āsīt eka eva so'kāmayata syām prajāyeyeti so'śrāmyatsa
analyzed: vā abhivyāharet vratasya a vyavacedāya  prajāpatiḥ vai idam agre āsīt ekaḥ eva saḥ ukāmayata syām prajāyeya iti saḥ śrāmyat sa
translated: in a pot, it should be done for the sake of not interrupting the vow.

original: tapo'tapyata tasmācrāntāttepānāttrayo lokā asṛjyanta pṛthivyantarikṣaṃ dyauḥ / / /
analyzed: tapaḥ tapyata tasmāt crāntāt tepānāt trayaḥ lokāḥ asṛjyanta pṛthivī antarikṣam dyauḥ
translated: Prajāpati was here first, alone. He desired, Let me be, let me beget offspring. He became weary, he performed austerity. From him, being weary and performing austerity, the three worlds were created: the earth, the atmosphere, and the sky.

original: sa imāṃstrīṃlokānabhitatāpa tebhyastaptebhyastrīṇi jyotīṃṣyajāyantāgniryo'yam🔽pavate sūryaḥ / / /
analyzed: saḥ imān trīn lokān abhitatāpa tebhyaḥ taptebhyaḥ trīṇi jyotīṃṣi ajāyanta agniḥ yaḥ uyam  pavate sūryaḥ
translated: He heated these three worlds. From them being heated, three lights were born: fire, this one that blows, and the sun.

original: sa imāni trīṇi jyotīṃṣyabhitatāpa tebhyastaptebhyastrayo vedā ajāyantāgnerṛgvedo
analyzed: saḥ imāni trīṇi jyotīṃṣi abhitatāpa tebhyaḥ taptebhyaḥ trayaḥ vedāḥ ajāyanta agneḥ ṛgvedaḥ
translated: He heated these three lights. From them being heated, the three Vedas were born: the Ṛg Veda from fire,

original: vāyoryajurvedaḥ sūryātsāmavedaḥ / / /
analyzed: vāyoḥ yajurvedaḥ sūryāt sāmavedaḥ
translated: the Yajur Veda from Vāyu, and the Sāma Veda from the sun.

original: sa imāṃstrīnvedānabhitatāpa tebhyastaptebhyastrīṇi śukrāṇyajāyanta
analyzed: saḥ imān trīn vedān abhitatāpa tebhyaḥ taptebhyaḥ trīṇi śukrāṇi ajāyanta
translated: He heated these three Vedas. From them being heated, three bright things were born:

original: bhūrityṛgvedādbhuva iti yajurvedātsvariti sāmavedāttadṛgvedenaiva hotramakurvata
analyzed: bhūḥ iti ṛgvedāt bhuvar iti yajurvedāt svar iti sāmavedāt tat ṛgvedena eva hotram akurvata
translated: bhūḥ from the Ṛg Veda, bhuvaḥ from the Yajur Veda, and svaḥ from the Sāma Veda. With the Ṛg Veda alone they performed the Hotṛ function,

original: yajurvedenādhvaryavaṃ sāmavedenodgīthaṃ yadeva trayyai vidyāyai śukraṃ tena
analyzed: yajurvedena ādhvaryavam sāmavedena udgītham yat eva trayyai vidyāyai śukram tena
translated: The Adhvaryu office by the Yajur Veda, the Udgata office by the Sama Veda, and whatever is pure in the three Vedas by that.

original: brahmatvamathoccakrāma / / /🔽te devāḥ prajāpatimabruvan yadi na ṛkto vā yajuṣṭo vā sāmato vā yajño
analyzed: brahmatvam atha uccakrāma  te devāḥ prajāpatim abruvan yadi naḥ ṛktaḥ vā yajuṣṭaḥ vā sāmataḥ vā
translated: With the Yajur Veda he went forth as the Adhvaryu, with the Sama Veda as the Udgâtri, and with whatever is pure in the three Vedas he went forth as the Brahman.

original: hvaletkenainam bhiṣajyemeti / / /
analyzed: hvalet kena enam bhiṣajyema iti
translated: Then they said, 'If the sacrifice should fail either through the Rig-Veda, or the Yajur-Veda, or the Sâma-Veda, by what means shall we heal it?'

original: sa hovāca yadyṛkto bhūriti caturgṛhītamājyaṃ gṛhītvā gārhapatye juhavatha yadi
analyzed: sa ha uvāca yadi ṛktaḥ bhūḥ iti caturgṛhītam ājyam gṛhītvā gārhapatye juhavatha yadi
translated: He said, 'If it should fail through the Rig-Veda, then take four ladlings of ghee and offer it on the Gârhapatya with (the word) Bhûr;

original: yajuṣṭo bhuva iti caturgṛhītamājyaṃ gṛhītvāgnīdhrīye juhavathānvāhāryapacane vā🔽haviryajñe yadi sāmataḥ svariti caturgṛhītamājyaṃ gṛhītvāhavanīye juhavatha yadyu
analyzed: yajuṣṭaḥ bhuvaḥ iti caturgṛhītam ājyam gṛhītvā āgnīdhrīye juhavatha anvāhāryapacane vā  haviḥ yajñe yadi sāmataḥ svar iti caturgṛhītam ājyam gṛhītvā āhavanīye juhavatha yadi u
translated: if through the Yajur-Veda, then take four ladlings of ghee and offer it on the Âhavanîya or on the Anvâhârya-pacana with (the word) Bhuvas;

original: avijñātamasatsarvāṇyanudrutyāhavanīye juhavatha tadṛgvedenaivargvedam🔽bhiṣajyati yajurvedena yajurvedaṃ sāmavedena sāmavedaṃ sa yathā parvaṇā parva
analyzed: a vijñātam asat sarvāṇi anudrutya āhavanīye juhavatha tat ṛgvedena eva ṛgvedam  bhiṣajyati yajurvedena yajurvedam sāmavedena sāmavedam sa yathā parvaṇā parva
translated: if through the Sâma-Veda, then take four ladlings of ghee and offer it on the Âhavanîya with (the word) Svaḥ; but if it should be unknown, then repeat all (the Vedas) and offer on the Âhavanîya. Thus by the Rig-Veda he heals the Rig-Veda,

original: saṃdadhyādevaṃ haiva sa saṃdadhāti ya etābhirbhiṣajyatyatha yo hāto'nyena
analyzed: saṃdadhyāt evam ha eva sa saṃdadhāti yaḥ etābhiḥ bhiṣajyati atha yaḥ ha atonyena
translated: by the Yajur-Veda the Yajur-Veda, and by the Sâma-Veda the Sâma-Veda. As one would join together the parts of a limb, so he joins together (the Vedas). He who heals (the sacrifice) by these (means), but he who abandons it and heals it by other (means),

original: bhiṣajyati yathā śīrṇena śīrṇaṃ saṃdhitsedyathā vā śīrṇe garamabhinidadhyādevaṃ
analyzed: bhiṣajyati yathā śīrṇena śīrṇam saṃdhitset yathā vā śīrṇe garam abhinidadhyāt evam
translated: As one would heal a wound with a fresh (part), or as one would put poison into a wound,

original: tattasmādevaṃvidameva brahmāṇaṃ kurvīta nānevaṃvidam / / /🔽tadāhuḥ yadṛcā hotraṃ kriyate yajuṣādhvaryavaṃ sāmnodgītho'tha kena
analyzed: tat tasmāt evaṃvidam eva brahmāṇam kurvīta na an evaṃvidam  tat āhuḥ yat ṛcā hotram kriyate yajuṣā ādhvaryavam sāmnā udgītha utha kena
translated: so would he do. Therefore let him make him who knows this to be the Brahman priest, not him who does not know this.

original: brahmatvamityanayā trayyā vidyayeti ha brūyāt / / /
analyzed: brahmatvam iti anayā trayyā vidyayā iti ha brūyāt
translated: As to this they say, 'If the Hotri's office is performed by the Rik, the Adhvaryu's by the Yagus, and the Udgâtri's by the Sâman, by what then is the Brahman's office performed?' 'By this threefold science,' let him say.

original: prajāpatirha vā eṣa yadaṃśuḥ so'syaiṣa ātmaivātmā hyayam prajāpatirvāgevādābhyaḥ🔽sa yadaṃśuḥ gṛhītvādābhyaṃ gṛhṇātyātmānamevāsyaitatsaṃskṛtya tasminnetāṃ vācam
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ ha vai eṣa yat aṃśuḥ saḥ usya eṣa ātmā eva ātmā hi ayam prajāpatiḥ vāc eva adābhyaḥ  sa yat aṃśuḥ gṛhītvā adābhyam gṛhṇāti ātmānam eva asya etat saṃskṛtya tasmin etām vācam
translated: The Amsu, doubtless, is Pragâpati, and that (cup) is his body; for Pragâpati is this (universe), and speech is Âdâbhya.

original: pratiṣṭhāpayati / / /🔽atha mano ha vā aṃśuḥ vāgadābhyaḥ prāṇa evāṃśurudāno'dābhyaścakṣurevāṃśuḥ
analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpayati  atha manaḥ ha vai aṃśuḥ vāc adābhyaḥ prāṇaḥ eva aṃśuḥ udāna udābhyaḥ cakṣuḥ eva aṃśuḥ
translated: When he draws the Âdâbhya after drawing the Amsu, he thereby perfects his body, and establishes that speech in it.

original: śrotramadābhyastadyadetau grahau gṛhṇanti sarvatvāyaiva kṛtsnatāyai / / /
analyzed: śrotra madābhyaḥ tat yat etau grahau gṛhṇanti sarva tvāya eva kṛtsna tāyai
translated: The Amsu, doubtless, is the mind, and Âdâbhya is speech; the Amsu is the out-breathing, and Âdâbhya the up-breathing; the Amsu is the eye, and Âdâbhya the ear. Thus when they draw these two cups, it is for the sake of completeness, for the sake of all.

original: atha devāśca ha vā asurāśca ubhaye prājāpatyā aspardhanta ta etasminneva yajñe
analyzed: atha devāḥ ca ha vai asurāḥ ca ubhaye prājāpatyāḥ aspardhanta te etasmin eva yajñe
translated: Now the gods and the Asuras, both of them sprung from Pragâpati, once strove together. They strove about this very sacrifice,

original: prajāpatāvaspardhantāsmākamayaṃ syādasmākamayaṃ syāditi / / /
analyzed: prajāpatau aspardhanta asmākam ayam syāt asmākam ayam syāt iti
translated: They competed with Prajapati, saying, This one shall be ours, this one shall be ours.

original: tato devāḥ arcantaḥ śrāmyantaścerusta etaṃ grahaṃ dadṛśuretamadābhyaṃ
analyzed: tatas devāḥ arcantaḥ śrāmyantaḥ ceruḥ te etam graham dadṛśuḥ etam adābhyam
translated: Then the gods, singing praises and toiling, wandered about. They saw this libation, this Adabhya.🔽They grasped it. They cleared the pressing-days. They completely

original: tamagṛhṇata te savanāni prāvṛhanta te sarvaṃ yajñaṃ🔽samavṛñjatāntarāyannasurānyajñāt / / /🔽te hocuḥ adabhāma vā enāniti tasmādadābhyo na vai no'dabhanniti tasmādadābhyo
analyzed: tam agṛhṇata te savanāni prāvṛhanta te sarvam yajñam  samavṛñjata antarāyan asurān yajñāt  te ha ūcuḥ adabhāma vai enān iti tasmāt adābhyaḥ na vai na udabhan iti tasmāt adābhyaḥ
translated: seized the whole sacrifice. They turned away the Asuras from the sacrifice.🔽They said, We have indeed overcome them. Therefore it is Adabhya. They have not overcome us, therefore it is Adabhya.

original: vāgvā adābhyaḥ seyamadabdhā vāktasmādvevādābhya evaṃ ha vai dviṣato🔽bhrātṛvyasya sarvaṃ yajñaṃ saṃvṛṅkta evaṃ dviṣantam bhrātṛvyaṃ🔽sarvasmādyajñānnirbhajati bahirdhā karoti ya u evametadveda / / /
analyzed: vāc vai adābhyaḥ sā iyam adabdhā vāc tasmāt u eva adābhyaḥ evam ha vai dviṣataḥ  bhrātṛvyasya sarvam yajñam saṃvṛṅkte evam dviṣantam bhrātṛvyam  sarvasmāt yajñāt nirbhajati bahirdhā karoti yaḥ u evam etat veda
translated: The Adabhya is speech. This speech is not overcome. Therefore it is Adabhya. Thus, indeed, he who knows this🔽completely seizes the whole sacrifice of an enemy, of one who hates him.🔽Thus he completely seizes the enemy, of one who hates him, from the whole sacrifice. He excises him, he who knows this thus.

original: sa yenaiva pātreṇāṃśuṃ gṛhṇāti tasminneva pātre nigrābhyābhyo'pa ānīya
analyzed: sa yena eva pātreṇa aṃśum gṛhṇāti tasmin eva pātre nigrābhya ābhya upas ānīya
translated: In the very vessel in which he takes the Amsu, he brings the water for the Nigrahya libations

original: tasminnetānaṃśūngṛhṇāti / / /
analyzed: tasmin etān aṃśūn gṛhṇāti
translated: and takes these Amsus in it.

original: upayāmagṛhīto'si agnaye tvā gāyatracandasaṃ gṛhṇāmīti gāyatram prātaḥsavanaṃ
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ asi agnaye tvā gāyatra candasam gṛhṇāmi iti gāyatram prātaḥsavanam
translated: You are taken with a support. I take you for Agni, of the Gayatri meter, the morning pressing is Gayatri.

original: tatprātaḥsavanam pravṛhatīndrāya tvā triṣṭupcandasaṃ gṛhṇāmīti traiṣṭubham🔽mādhyandinaṃ savanaṃ tanmādhyandinaṃ savanam pravṛhati viśvebhyastvā devebhyo
analyzed: tat prātaḥsavanam pravṛhati indrāya tvā triṣṭubh candasam gṛhṇāmi iti traiṣṭubham  mādhyandinam savanam tat mādhyandinam savanam pravṛhati viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ
translated: That is the morning pressing. He draws it with 'To Indra I draw thee, of the Tristubh metre', (saying) 'For the Tristubh metre' .🔽That is the midday pressing. He draws it with 'To the All-gods I draw thee, of the Jagati metre', (saying) 'For the Jagati metre' .

original: jagaccandasaṃ gṛhṇāmīti jāgataṃ tṛtīyasavanaṃ tattṛtīyasavanam🔽pravṛhatyanuṣṭupte'bhigara iti yadvā ūrdhvaṃ savanebhyastadānuṣṭubhaṃ🔽tadevaitatpravṛhati tannābhiṣuṇoti vajro vai grāvā vāgadābhyo nedvajreṇa vācaṃ🔽hinasānīti / / /
analyzed: jagat candasam gṛhṇāmi iti jāgatam tṛtīyasavanam tat tṛtīyasavanam  pravṛhati anuṣṭubh tebhigare iti yat vai ūrdhvam savanebhyaḥ tat ānuṣṭubham  tat eva etat pravṛhati tat na abhiṣuṇoti vajraḥ vai grāvā vāc adābhyaḥ na id vajreṇa vācam  hinasāni iti
translated: 'That morning pressing I carry forth for Indra, in the Tristubh metre I take thee!'--the midday pressing he carries forth;--'for the All-gods, in the Jagatî metre I take thee!'--the evening pressing he carries forth;--'for the Visve Devâh, in the Anushtubh metre I take thee!'--the Abhigit (hymn) is of the Anushtubh metre: what is above the pressings that is of the Anushtubh metre;--that he thus carries forth. He does not press it, thinking, 'Lest I should injure speech by the thunderbolt.'

original: aṃśūnevādhūnoti vreśīnāṃ tvā patmannādhūnomi kukūnanānāṃ tvā🔽patmannādhūnomi bhandanānāṃ tvā patmannādhūnomi madintamānāṃ tvā🔽patmannādhūnomi madhuntamānāṃ tvā patmannādhūnomītyetā vai
analyzed: aṃśūn eva ādhūnoti vreśīnām tvā patman ādhūnomi kukūnanānām tvā  patman ādhūnomi bhandanānām tvā patman ādhūnomi madintamānām tvā  patman ādhūnomi madhuntamānām tvā patman ādhūnomi iti etāḥ vai
translated: He only presses the shoots, thinking, 'Lest I should injure speech by the thunderbolt.' 'In the region of the Vrîhi grains I press thee,'--thus he says;--'in the region of the Kukûna grains I press thee,'--thus he says;--'in the region of the Bhândana grains I press thee,'--thus he says;--'in the region of the most sweet I press thee,'--thus he says;--'in the region of the most honey-sweet I press thee,'--thus he says: these are the divine waters; and thus he puts into him (Agni) both the divine and the human waters.

original: daivīrāpastadyāścaiva daivīrāpo yāścemā mānuṣyastābhirevāsminnetadubhayībhī🔽rasaṃ dadhāti / / /
analyzed: daivīḥ āpaḥ tat yāḥ ca eva daivīḥ āpaḥ yāḥ ca imāḥ mānuṣyaḥ tābhiḥ eva asmin etat ubhayībhī 🔽rasam dadhāti
translated: 'In the region of the Vrîhi grains I press thee,'--thus he says;--'in the region of the Kukûna grains I press thee,'--thus he says;--'in the region of the Bhândana grains I press thee,'--thus he says;--'in the region of the most sweet I press thee,'--thus he says;--'in the region of the most honey-sweet I press thee,'--thus he says: these are the divine waters; and thus he puts into him (Agni) both the divine and the human waters.

original: śukraṃ tvā śukra ādhūnomīti śukraṃ hyetacukra ādhūnotyahno rūpe sūryasya
analyzed: śukram tvā śukre ādhūnomi iti śukram hi etat cukre ādhūnoti ahnaḥ rūpe sūryasya
translated: 'I stir thee, O pure one, with the pure', (with these words) he stirs it, for he stirs it with the pure one. 'In the form of the day, of the sun', (with these words) he stirs it;

original: raśmiṣviti tadahnaścaivainametadrūpe sūryasya ca raśmiṣvādhūnoti / / /🔽kakubhaṃ rūpaṃ vṛṣabhasya rocate bṛhaditi etadvai kakubhaṃ rūpaṃ vṛṣabhasya
analyzed: raśmiṣu iti tat ahnaḥ ca eva enam etat rūpe sūryasya ca raśmiṣu ādhūnoti  kakubham rūpam vṛṣabhasya rocate bṛhat iti etat vai kakubham rūpam vṛṣabhasya
translated: 'The pure I stir for thee with the pure', he says, for he stirs the pure with the pure; 'in the form of the day, in the rays of the sun', he says; thus he stirs it for him in the form of the day and in the rays of the sun.

original: rocate bṛhadya eṣa tapati śukraḥ śukrasya purogāḥ somaḥ somasya purogā iti
analyzed: rocate bṛhat yaḥ eṣa tapati śukraḥ śukrasya purogāḥ somaḥ somasya purogāḥ iti
translated: 'The lofty form of the bull shines', he says; that is the lofty form of the bull that shines, that burns yonder. 'The pure, the forerunner of the pure, the Soma, the forerunner of the Soma', he says;

original: tacukramevaitacukrasya purogāṃ karoti somaṃ somasya purogāṃ yatte somādābhyaṃ
analyzed: tad cukram eva etad cukrasya purogām karoti somam somasya purogām yat te soma adābhyam
translated: he makes the pure the forerunner of the pure, the Soma the forerunner of the Soma. 'With what invincible

original: nāma jāgṛvi tasmai tvā gṛhṇāmītyetaddha vā asyādābhyaṃ nāma jāgṛvi
analyzed: nāma jāgṛvi tasmai tvā gṛhṇāmi iti etat ha vai asya adābhyam nāma jāgṛvi
translated: name thou hast, O Soma, that I take', he says; that is his invincible name, that is watchful.

original: yadvāktadvācamevaitadvāce gṛhṇāti / / /🔽athopaniṣkramya juhoti tasmai te soma somāya svāheti tatsomamevaitatsomāya🔽juhoti tatho vācamagnau na pravṛṇaktyatha hiraṇyamabhivyanityasāveva
analyzed: yat vāc tat vācam eva etat vāce gṛhṇāti  atha upaniṣkramya juhoti tasmai te soma somāya svāhā iti tat somam eva etat somāya  juhoti tathā u vācam agnau na pravṛṇakti atha hiraṇyam abhivyaniti asau eva
translated: With speech he takes speech.

original: bandhustasya tāvatīreva dakṣiṇā yāvatīraṃśoḥ / / /
analyzed: bandhuḥ tasya tāvatīḥ eva dakṣiṇāḥ yāvatīḥ aṃśoḥ
translated: Having then gone out, he offers (with the verse), 'To him, to Soma, to thee, hail!' he thus offers Soma to Soma. Thus he does not put speech into the fire. He then touches the gold. The significance is the same as before. So much is the sacrificial fee as for a portion.

original: athāṃśūnpunarapyarjati uśiktvaṃ deva somāgneḥ priyam pātho'pīhi vaśī tvaṃ deva🔽somendrasya priyaṃ pātho'pīhyasmatsakhā tvaṃ deva soma viśveṣāṃ devānām
analyzed: atha aṃśūn punar apyarjati uśij tvam deva soma agneḥ priyam pāthaḥ upīhi vaśī tvam deva  soma indrasya priyam pāthaḥ upīhi asmad sakhā tvam deva soma viśveṣām devānām
translated: He then again draws the shoots: 'Be thou skilful, O divine Soma, go to the dear place of Agni. Be thou a lord, O divine Soma,

original: priyam pātho'pīhīti savanāni vā adaḥ pravṛhati
analyzed: priyam pāthaḥ upīhi iti savanāni vai adaḥ pravṛhati
translated: go to the dear place of Indra and Soma. Be thou a friend to us, O divine Soma, go to the dear place of all the gods.' The pressings, indeed, he here draws forth;

original: tānyevaitatpunarāpyāyayatyayātayāmāni karoti tairayātayāmairyajñaṃ tanvate / / /
analyzed: tāni eva etat punar āpyāyayati ayātayāmāni karoti taiḥ ayātayāmaiḥ yajñam tanvate
translated: he thereby again causes them to swell, makes them not exhausted; with them not exhausted they perform the sacrifice.

original: bhṛgurha vai vāruṇiḥ varuṇam pitaraṃ vidyayātimene taddha varuṇo vidāṃ
analyzed: bhṛguḥ ha vai vāruṇiḥ varuṇam pitaram vidyayā atimene tat ha varuṇaḥ vidām
translated: Bhṛgu, the son of Varuṇa, indeed, despised his father Varuṇa with his knowledge. Then Varuṇa knew that

original: cakārātivai mā vidyayā manyata iti / / /
analyzed: cakāra ati vai mā vidyayā manyate iti
translated: he (Bhṛgu) thought: 'He indeed despises me with his knowledge.'

original: sa hovāca prāṅ putraka vrajatāttatra yatpaśyetaddṛṣṭvā dakṣiṇā vrajatāttatra🔽yatpaśyestaddṛṣṭvā pratyagvrajatāttatra yatpaśyestaddṛṣṭvodagvrajatāttatra
analyzed: sa ha uvāca prāṅ putraka vrajatāt tatra yat paśya etat dṛṣṭvā dakṣiṇā vrajatāt tatra  yat paśyeḥ tat dṛṣṭvā pratyak vrajatāt tatra yat paśyeḥ tat dṛṣṭvā udak vrajatāt tatra
translated: He said: 'Go eastwards, my son, to where you see something, having seen it, go southwards to where you see something,🔽having seen it, go westwards to where you see something, having seen it, go northwards to where you see something,

original: yatpaśyestaddṛṣṭvaitayoḥ pūrvayoruttaramanvavāntaradeśaṃ vrajatāttatra
analyzed: yat paśyeḥ tat dṛṣṭvā etayoḥ pūrvayoḥ uttaram anu avāntara deśam vrajatāt tatra
translated: having seen it, go to the intermediate region between those two eastern ones, to where you see something,

original: yatpaśyestanma ācakṣīthā iti / / /
analyzed: yat paśyeḥ tat me ācakṣīthāḥ iti
translated: having seen it, tell it to me.'

analyzed: sa ha tatas eva prāṅ pravavrāje edu puruṣaiḥ puruṣān parvāṇi eṣām parvaśas

original: saṃvraścam parvaśo vibhajamānānidaṃ tavedam mameti sa hovāca bhīṣmam bata
analyzed: saṃvraścam parvaśas vibhajamānān idam tava idam mama iti sa ha uvāca bhīṣmam bata
translated: cutting them off joint by joint, dividing them, saying, 'This is yours, this is mine.' He said, 'Alas!

analyzed: bhoḥ puruṣān nvai etat puruṣāḥ parvāṇi eṣām saṃvraścam parvaśas vyabhakṣata iti te
translated: Men are indeed eating the limbs of the men, cutting them off limb by limb.' They

analyzed: ha ūcuḥ ittham vai ime smān amuṣmin loke sacanta tān vayam idam iha pratisacāmahai iti sa

translated: said, 'Is there not a father of yours who knows the Veda?'

analyzed: sa ha tatas eva dakṣiṇā pravavrāje edu puruṣaiḥ puruṣān parvāṇi eṣām parvaśas
translated: He then went away from there to the south. There the men were eating the limbs of the men, cutting them off limb by limb,

original: saṃkartam parvaśo vibhajamānānidaṃ tavedam mameti sa hovāca bhīṣmam bata
analyzed: saṃkartam parvaśas vibhajamānān idam tava idam mama iti sa ha uvāca bhīṣmam bata
translated: cutting them off joint by joint, dividing them, saying, 'This is yours, this is mine.' He said, 'Alas!

original: bhoḥ puruṣānnvā etatpuruṣāḥ parvāṇyeṣām parvaśaḥ saṃkartam parvaśo🔽vyabhakṣateti te hocuritthaṃ vā ime'smānamuṣmiṃloke'sacanta tānvayamidamiha
analyzed: bhoḥ puruṣān nvai etat puruṣāḥ parvāṇi eṣām parvaśas saṃkartam parvaśas  vyabhakṣata iti te ha ūcuḥ ittham vai ime smān amuṣmin loke sacanta tān vayam idam iha
translated: Men are indeed eating the limbs of the men, cutting them off limb by limb,

analyzed: pratisacāmahai iti sa ha uvāca asti iha kā ati pitā eva te veda iti
translated: cutting them off joint by joint, dividing them.' They said, 'In this way they have eaten us in the other world. Now we will eat them back here.' He said, 'Is there not a father of yours who knows the Veda?'

original: sa ha tata eva pratyaṅ pravavrāja edu puruṣaiḥ🔽puruṣāṃstūṣṇīmāsīnāṃstūṣṇīmāsīnairadyamānāntsa hovāca bhīṣmam bata bhoḥ
analyzed: sa ha tatas eva pratyaṅ pravavrāje edu puruṣaiḥ  puruṣān tūṣṇīm āsīnān tūṣṇīm āsīnaiḥ adyamānān sa ha uvāca bhīṣmam bata bhoḥ
translated: He then turned away from there and went to the west.🔽He saw men eating men who were sitting silently, and he said: 'Alas, alas!

analyzed: puruṣān nvai etat puruṣāḥ tūṣṇīm āsīnān tūṣṇīm āsīnāḥ adanti iti te ha ūcuḥ ittham vā
translated: Are these men eating those men who are sitting silently?' They said: 'Thus

analyzed: ime smān amuṣmin loke sacanta tān vayam idam iha pratisacāmahai iti sa ha uvāca asti iha
translated: indeed, these (men) have deceived us in that world, and now we are deceiving them here.' He said: 'There is a knower of this here.'

analyzed: kāti pitā eva te veda iti  sa ha tatas eva udaṅ pravavrāje edu puruṣaiḥ puruṣān ākrandayata
translated: 'Your father alone knows it.'🔽He then turned away from there and went to the north. He saw men eating men who were crying out.

analyzed: ākrandayadbhiḥ adyamānān sa ha uvāca bhīṣmam bata bhoḥ puruṣān nvai etat puruṣā

analyzed: ākrandayataḥ ākrandayantaḥ udanti iti te ha ūcuḥ ittham vai
translated: indeed, these (men) have deceived us in that world, and now we are deceiving them here.'

original: sa ha tata evaitayoḥ pūrvayoḥ uttaramanvavāntaradeśam pravavrājedu striyau
analyzed: sa ha tatas eva etayoḥ pūrvayoḥ uttaram anu avāntara deśam pravavrāja idu striyau
translated: He then turned away from there and went to the intermediate region between those two former (regions). He saw two women,

analyzed: kalyāṇīm ca ati kalyāṇīm ca te antareṇa puruṣaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ piṅga akṣaḥ daṇḍa pāṇiḥ tasthau tam
translated: a beautiful one and a very beautiful one, and between them a dark man with tawny eyes and a staff in his hand was standing. He said:

original: hainaṃ dṛṣṭvā bhīrviveda sa hetya saṃviveśa taṃ ha pitovācādhīṣva svādhyāyaṃ
analyzed: ha enam dṛṣṭvā bhīḥ viveda sa ha itya saṃviveśa tam ha pitā uvāca adhīṣva svādhyāyam
translated: Seeing it to be inferior, he was afraid, and he went back. His father said to him: 'Recite your lesson.'

original: kasmānnu svādhyāyaṃ nādhīṣa iti sa hovāca kimadhyeṣye na kiṃ canāstīti taddha
analyzed: kasmāt nu svādhyāyam na adhīṣe iti sa ha uvāca kim adhyeṣye na kim cana asti iti tat ha
translated: 'Why do you not recite your lesson?' 'What shall I recite?' he said. 'There is nothing.'

original: varuṇo vidāṃ cakārādrāgvā iti / / /🔽sa hovāca yānvai tatprācyāṃ diśyadrākṣīḥ puruṣaiḥ pu ruṣānparvāṇyeṣām parvaśaḥ
analyzed: varuṇaḥ vidām cakāra adrāk vai iti  sa ha uvāca yān vai tat prācyām diśi adrākṣīḥ puruṣaiḥ pu ruṣān parvāṇi eṣām parvaśas
translated: Varuṇa understood that (he meant) 'the tree' (vṛkṣa).🔽He said: 'Those whom you saw in the eastern direction, men cutting up men limb by limb,

original: saṃvraścam parvaśo vibhajamānānidaṃ tavedam mameti vanaspatayo vai te
analyzed: saṃvraścam parvaśas vibhajamānān idam tava idam mama iti vanaspatayaḥ vai te
translated: cutting them limb by limb, saying This is yours, this is mine, they were indeed the trees.

original: abhūvantsa yadvanaspatīnāṃ samidhamādadhāti tena vanaspatīnavarunddhe tena
analyzed: abhūvan sa yat vanaspatīnām samidham ādadhāti tena vanaspatīn avarunddhe tena
translated: When he puts on the kindling wood of the trees, thereby he wins the trees,

original: vanaspatīnāṃ lokaṃ jayati / / /🔽atha yānetataddakṣiṇāyāṃ diśyadrākṣīḥ puruṣaiḥ puruṣānparvāṇyeṣām parvaśaḥ
analyzed: vanaspatīnām lokam jayati  atha yān etat tat dakṣiṇāyām diśi adrākṣīḥ puruṣaiḥ puruṣān parvāṇi eṣām parvaśas
translated: thereby he conquers the world of the trees.🔽Then those whom you saw in the southern direction, men cutting up men limb by limb,

original: saṃkartam parvaśo vibhajamānānidaṃ tavedam mameti paśavo vai te abhūvantsa
analyzed: saṃkartam parvaśas vibhajamānān idam tava idam mama iti paśavaḥ vai te abhūvan sa
translated: cutting them limb by limb, saying This is yours, this is mine, they were indeed the cattle.🔽When he offers with milk, thereby he wins the cattle,

original: yatpayasā juhoti tena paśūnavarundhe tena paśūnāṃ lokaṃ jayati / / /
analyzed: yat payasā juhoti tena paśūn avarundhe tena paśūnām lokam jayati
translated: thereby he conquers the world of the cattle.'

original: atha yānetatpratīcyāṃ diśyadrākṣīḥ puruṣaiḥ
analyzed: atha yān etat pratīcyām diśi adrākṣīḥ puruṣaiḥ
translated: Now, as to that which you saw in the western region, men eating men,

original: puruṣāṃstūṣṇīmāsīnāṃstūṣṇīmāsīnairadyamānānoṣadhayo vai tā abhūvantsa
analyzed: puruṣān tūṣṇīm āsīnān tūṣṇīm āsīnaiḥ adyamānān oṣadhayaḥ vai tāḥ abhūvan sa
translated: who were sitting silently, and were being eaten by those sitting silently. They were the plants.

original: yattṛṇenāvajyotayati tenauṣadhīravarunddhe tenauṣadhīnāṃ lokaṃ jayati / / /
analyzed: yat tṛṇena avajyotayati tena oṣadhīḥ avarunddhe tena oṣadhīnām lokam jayati
translated: In that he offers with a straw, thereby he wins the plants, thereby he wins the world of plants.

original: atha yānetadudīcyāṃ diśyadrākṣīḥ puruṣaiḥ puruṣānākrandayata
analyzed: atha yān etat udīcyām diśi adrākṣīḥ puruṣaiḥ puruṣān ākrandayata
translated: Now, as to that which you saw in the northern region, men crying out,

original: ākrandayadbhiradyamānānāpo vai tā abhūvantsa yadapaḥ pratyānayati
analyzed: ākrandayadbhiḥ adyamānān apaḥ vai tāḥ abhūvan sa yat apaḥ pratyānayati
translated: and being eaten by those crying out. They were the waters. In that he brings back the waters,

original: tenāpo'varunddhe tenāpāṃ lokaṃ jayati / / /
analyzed: tena apaḥ uvarunddhe tena apām lokam jayati
translated: thereby he wins the waters, thereby he wins the world of the waters.

original: atha ye ete striyāvadrākṣīḥ kalyāṇīṃ cātikalyāṇīṃ ca sā yā kalyāṇī sā śraddhā sa
analyzed: atha ye ete striyau adrākṣīḥ kalyāṇīm ca atikalyāṇīm ca sā yā kalyāṇī sā śraddhā sa
translated: Now, as to those two women which you saw, the good one and the very good one. The good one was faith,

original: yatpūrvāmāhutiṃ juhoti tena śraddhāmavarunddhe tena śraddhāṃ jayatyatha
analyzed: yat pūrvām āhutim juhoti tena śraddhām avarunddhe tena śraddhām jayati atha
translated: in that he offers the first libation, thereby he wins faith, thereby he conquers faith.

original: yātikalyāṇī sāśraddhā sa yaduttarāmāhutiṃ juhoti tenāśraddhāmavarunddhe
analyzed: yā ati kalyāṇī sā aśraddhā sa yat uttarām āhutim juhoti tena aśraddhām avarunddhe
translated: And the very good one was want of faith. In that he offers the second libation, thereby he wins want of faith,

original: tenāśraddhāṃ jayati / / /
analyzed: tena aśraddhām jayati
translated: thereby he conquers want of faith.

original: atha ya ene so'ntareṇa puruṣaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ piṅgākṣo daṇḍapāṇirasthātkrodho vai
analyzed: atha yaḥ ene saḥ untareṇa puruṣaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ piṅga akṣaḥ daṇḍa pāṇiḥ asthāt krodhaḥ vai
translated: Now, as to that man who stood between them, black, with tawny eyes, and a staff in his hand. He was wrath,

original: so'bhūtsa yatsrucyapa ānīya ninayati tena krodhamavarunddhe tena krodhaṃ jayati sa
analyzed: sa ubhūt sa yat sruci apaḥ ānīya ninayati tena krodham avarunddhe tena krodham jayati sa
translated: He becomes that which he becomes. When he pours it into the ladle and offers it, thereby he conquers anger, thereby he wins anger.

original: ya evaṃ vidvānagnihotraṃ juhoti tena sarvaṃ jayati sarvamavarunddhe / / /
analyzed: yaḥ evam vidvān agnihotram juhoti tena sarvam jayati sarvam avarunddhe
translated: He who, knowing thus, offers the Agnihotra, by that he conquers everything, by that he wins everything.

original: janako ha vai vaideho brāhmaṇairdhāvayadbhiḥ samājagāma śvetaketunāruṇeyena
analyzed: janakaḥ ha vai vaidehaḥ brāhmaṇaiḥ dhāvayadbhiḥ samājagāma śvetaketunā āruṇeyena
translated: Janaka of Videha met some Brahmins who were traveling, with Svetaketu of the Aruna lineage,

original: somaśuṣmeṇa sātyayajñinā yājñavalkyena tānhovāca kathaṃkathamagnihotraṃ
analyzed: somaśuṣmeṇa sātyayajñinā yājñavalkyena tān ha uvāca katham katham agnihotram
translated: Soma-susruma of the Satyayajna lineage, and Yajnavalkya. He said to them, How do you offer the Agnihotra?

original: juhutheti / / /🔽sa hovāca śvetaketurāruṇeyo gharmāveva samrāḍahamajasrau yaśasā🔽viṣyandamānāvanyo'nyasminjuhomīti kathaṃ tadityādityo vai gharmastaṃ🔽sāyamagnau juhomyagnirvai gharmastam prātarāditye juhomīti kiṃ sa bhavati ya
analyzed: juhutha iti  sa ha uvāca śvetaketuḥ āruṇeyaḥ gharmau eva samrāj aham ajasrau yaśasā  viṣyandamānau anyonyasmin juhomi iti katham tat iti ādityaḥ vai gharmaḥ tam  sāyam agnau juhomi agniḥ vai gharmaḥ tam prātar āditye juhomi iti kim sa bhavati yaḥ
translated: In what way?🔽Svetaketu of the Aruna lineage said, O Emperor, I offer the two inexhaustible ones, Ghurma and Ajashra, flowing with glory into each other. How is that? Ghurma is the sun.

original: evaṃ juhotyajasra eva śriyā yaśasā bhavatyetayośca devatayoḥ sāyujyaṃ salokatāṃ🔽jayatīti / / /
analyzed: evam juhoti ajasraḥ eva śriyā yaśasā bhavati etayoḥ ca devatayoḥ sāyujyam salokatām  jayati iti
translated: I offer it into the fire in the evening. Ghurma is Agni. I offer it into the sun in the morning. What does he become who offers thus? He becomes inexhaustible in glory and fame. He conquers the union with those two deities and their world.

original: atha hovāca śomaśuṣmaḥ sātyayajñiḥ teja eva samrāḍahaṃ tejasi juhomīti kathaṃ
analyzed: atha ha uvāca śomaśuṣmaḥ sātyayajñiḥ tejaḥ eva samrāj aham tejasi juhomi iti katham
translated: Then Soma-susruma of the Satyayajna lineage said, I offer radiance into radiance, O Emperor. How is that?

original: tadityādityo vai tejastaṃ sāyamagnau juhomyagnirvai tejastam prātarāditye juhomīti
analyzed: tat iti ādityaḥ vai tejaḥ tam sāyam agnau juhomi agniḥ vai tejaḥ tam prātar āditye juhomi iti
translated: He says, That is the sun, for the sun is light. I offer it in the evening fire, for the fire is light. I offer it in the morning sun.

original: kiṃ sa bhavati ya evaṃ juhotīti tejasvī yaśasvyannādo bhavatyetayoścaiva devatayoḥ
analyzed: kim sa bhavati yaḥ evam juhoti iti tejasvī yaśasvī anna ādaḥ bhavati etayoḥ ca eva devatayoḥ
translated: What does he become who offers thus? He becomes radiant, glorious, and an eater of food. And by these two deities,

original: sāyujyaṃ salokatāṃ jayatīti / / /
analyzed: sāyujyam salokatām jayati iti
translated: he attains union and the same world.

original: atha hovāca yājñavalkyaḥ yadahamagnimuddharāmyagnihotrameva🔽tadudyacāmyādityaṃ vā astaṃ yantaṃ sarve devā anuyanti te ma etamagnimuddhṛtaṃ
analyzed: atha ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ yat aham agnim uddharāmi agnihotram eva  tat udyacāmi ādityam vai astam yantam sarve devāḥ anuyanti te me etam agnim uddhṛtam
translated: Then Yajnavalkya said, When I kindle the fire, I kindle the very Agnihotra.

original: dṛṣṭvopāvartante'thāham pātrāṇi nirṇijyopavāpyāgnihotrīṃ dohayitvā
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā upāvartanta itha aham pātrāṇi nirṇijya upavāpya agnihotrīm dohayitvā
translated: When the sun sets, all the gods follow it. They return when they see this fire kindled by me. Then, having cleansed the vessels and filled them,

original: paśyanpaśyatastarpayāmīti tvaṃ nediṣṭhaṃ yājñavalkyāgnihotrasyāmīmāṃsiṣṭhā
analyzed: paśyan paśyataḥ tarpayāmi iti tvam nediṣṭham yājñavalkya agnihotrasya amīmāṃsiṣṭhā
translated: having milked the Agnihotra cow, I offer libations while looking at you. You have inquired most closely, Yajnavalkya, about the Agnihotra.

original: dhenuśataṃ dadāmīti hovāca na tvevainayostvamutkrātriṃ na gatiṃ na pratiṣṭhāṃ na🔽tṛptiṃ na punarāvṛttiṃ na lokam pratyutthāyinamityuktvā rathamāsthāya pradhāvayāṃ
analyzed: dhenu śatam dadāmi iti ha uvāca na tu eva enayoḥ tvam utkrātrim na gatim na pratiṣṭhām na  tṛptim na punarāvṛttim na lokam pratyutthāyinam iti uktvā ratham āsthāya pradhāvayām
translated: I will give you a hundred cows, he said. But you have not inquired about their departure, their course, their support,

original: cakāra / / /
analyzed: cakāra
translated: their satisfaction, their return, or the world that rises up to meet them. Having said this, he mounted his chariot and drove away.

original: te hocuḥ ati vai no'yaṃ rājanyabandhuravādīddhantainam brahmodyamāhvayāmahā🔽iti sa hovāca yājñavalkyo brāhmaṇā vai vayaṃ smo rājanyabandhurasau yadyamuṃ
analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ ati vai na uyam rājanyabandhuḥ avādīt hanta enam brahmodyam āhvayāmahai  iti sa ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ vai vayam smaḥ rājanya bandhuḥ asau yadi amum
translated: They said, 'This Rājan-bandhu has indeed spoken overmuch to us. Come, let us challenge him to a discussion on spiritual matters.'

original: vayaṃ jayema kamajaiṣmeti brūyāmātha
analyzed: vayam jayema kam ajaiṣma iti brūyāma atha
translated: Yājñavalkya said, 'We are Brāhmaṇas, and he is a Rājan-bandhu. If we were to conquer him, whom should we have conquered?

original: yadyasāvasmānjayedbrāhmaṇānrājanyabandhurajaiṣīditi no
analyzed: yadi asau asmān jayet brāhmaṇān rājanyabandhuḥ ajaiṣīt iti no
translated: But if he were to conquer us, they would say, The Rājan-bandhu has conquered the Brāhmaṇas.

original: brūyurmedamādṛḍhvamiti taddhāsya jajñuratha ha yājñavalkyo
analyzed: brūyuḥ mā idam ādṛḍhvam iti tat ha asya jajñuḥ atha ha yājñavalkyaḥ
translated: Let us therefore go to him.' They went to him. Then Yājñavalkya🔽made him drive up in his chariot, and he went along with him. He said, 'Yājñavalkya,

original: rathamāstāyānupradhāvayāṃ cakāra taṃ hānvājagāma sa hovācāgnihotraṃ yājñavalkya🔽samrāḍiti / / /
analyzed: ratham āstāya anupradhāvayāṃ cakāra tam ha anvājagāma sa ha uvāca agnihotram yājñavalkya  samrāj iti
translated: what is the Agnihotra?'

original: te vā ete āhutī hute utkrāmataḥ te antarikṣamāviśataste antarikṣamevāhavanīyaṃ
analyzed: te vai ete āhutī hute utkrāmataḥ te antarikṣam āviśataḥ te antarikṣam eva āhavanīyam
translated: When these two oblations are offered, they go upwards. They enter the atmosphere. They make the atmosphere the Āhavanīya fire,

original: kurvāte vāyuṃ samidham marīcīreva śukrāmāhutiṃ te antarikṣaṃ tarpayataste tata
analyzed: kurvāte vāyum samidham marīcīḥ eva śukrām āhutim te antarikṣam tarpayataḥ te tata
translated: the wind the fuel, and the sun's rays the bright oblation. They gratify the atmosphere. From there

original: utkrāmataḥ / / /
analyzed: utkrāmataḥ
translated: they go upwards.🔽They enter the heaven. They make the heaven the Āhavanīya fire,

original: te divamāviśataḥ te divamevāhavanīyaṃ kurvāte ādityaṃ samidhaṃ candramasameva
analyzed: te divam āviśataḥ te divam eva āhavanīyam kurvāte ādityam samidham candramasam eva
translated: the sun the fuel, and the moon the bright oblation.

original: śukrāmāhutiṃ te divaṃ tarpayataste tata āvartete / / /
analyzed: śukrām āhutim te divam tarpayataḥ te tatas āvartete
translated: The libation of semen they offer to the heaven, and from there they return.

original: te imāmāviśataḥ te imāmevāhavanīyaṃ kurvāte agniṃ samidhamoṣadhīreva
analyzed: te imām āviśataḥ te imām eva āhavanīyam kurvāte agnim samidham oṣadhīḥ eva
translated: They enter this (earth), and make this (earth) the Ahavaniya fire, the fuel the plants,

original: śukrāmāhutiṃ te imāṃ tarpayataste tata utkrāmataḥ / / /
analyzed: śukrām āhutim te imām tarpayataḥ te tatas utkrāmataḥ
translated: and the libation of semen they offer to this (earth), and from there they go out.

original: te puruṣamāviśataḥ tasya mukhamevāhavanīyaṃ kurvāte jihvāṃ🔽samidhamannameva śukrāmāhutiṃ te puruṣaṃ tarpayataḥ sa ya evaṃ
analyzed: te puruṣam āviśataḥ tasya mukham eva āhavanīyam kurvāte jihvām  samidham annam eva śukrām āhutim te puruṣam tarpayataḥ sa yaḥ evam
translated: They enter a man, and make his mouth the Ahavaniya fire, the tongue

original: vidvānaśnātyagnihotramevāsya hutam bhavati te tata utkrāmataḥ / / /
analyzed: vidvān aśnāti agnihotram eva asya hutam bhavati te tatas utkrāmataḥ
translated: the fuel, and the libation of semen the food. They satisfy the man with that. He who, knowing thus, eats, his Agnihotra is offered. They go out from there.

original: te striyamāviśataḥ tasyā upasthamevāhavanīyaṃ kurvāte dhārakāṃ samidhaṃ dhārakā🔽ha vai nāmaiṣaitayā ha vai prajāpatiḥ prajā dhārayāṃ cakāra reta eva śukrāmāhutiṃ
analyzed: te striyam āviśataḥ tasyāḥ upastham eva āhavanīyam kurvāte dhārakām samidham dhārakā  ha vai nāma eṣā etayā ha vai prajāpatiḥ prajāḥ dhārayāṃ cakāra retaḥ eva śukrām āhutim
translated: They enter a woman, and make her vagina the Ahavaniya fire, the womb the fuel,

original: te striyaṃ tarpayataḥ sa ya evaṃ vidvānmithunamupaityagnihotramevāsya hutam
analyzed: te striyam tarpayataḥ sa yaḥ evam vidvān mithunam upaiti agnihotram eva asya hutam
translated: and the libation of semen the seed. They satisfy the woman with that. He who, knowing thus, approaches a woman, his Agnihotra is offered.

original: bhavati yastataḥ putro jāyate sa lokaḥ pratyutthāyyetadagnihotraṃ yājñavalkya nātaḥ
analyzed: bhavati yaḥ tatas putraḥ jāyate sa lokaḥ pratyutthāyi etat agnihotram yājñavalkya na atas
translated: The son who is born from that is the world that rises up to meet him. This is the Agnihotra, Yajnavalkya, not from here,

original: paramastīti hovāca tasmai ha yājñavalkyo varaṃ dadau sa hovāca kāmapraśna eva me
analyzed: param asti iti ha uvāca tasmai ha yājñavalkyaḥ varam dadau sa ha uvāca kāma praśnaḥ eva me
translated: He said, There is a Supreme One. To him Yajnavalkya gave a boon. He said, Let me ask you questions as I desire.

original: tvayi yājñavalkyāsaditi tato brahmā janaka āsa / / /🔽janako ha vaideho bahudakṣiṇena yajñeneje sa ha gavāṃ
analyzed: tvayi yājñavalkya asat iti tatas brahmā janakaḥ āsa  janakaḥ ha vaidehaḥ bahu dakṣiṇena yajñena īje sa ha gavām
translated: Then Janaka of Videha said, O Yajnavalkya!

original: sahasramavarundhannuvācaitā vo brāhmaṇā yo brahmiṣṭhaḥ sa udajatāmiti / / /
analyzed: sahasram avarundhan uvāca etāḥ vaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ yaḥ brahmiṣṭhaḥ saḥ udajatām iti
translated: Janaka of Videha performed a sacrifice with abundant gifts. He, having collected a thousand cows, said, O Brahmanas, let him who is the most learned in the Veda take these.

original: sa hovāca yājñavalkyo 'rvācīretā iti te hocustvaṃ svinno yājñavalkya brahmiṣṭho'
analyzed: sa ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ rvācī retāḥ iti te ha ūcuḥ tvam svinnaḥ yājñavalkya brahmiṣṭhā usī
translated: Yajnavalkya said, They are for one who is going away. They said, O Yajnavalkya, you are indeed the most learned in the Veda.

original: iti sa hovāca namo'stu brahmiṣṭhāya gokāmā eva vayaṃ sma iti / / /
analyzed: iti sa ha uvāca namaḥ astu brahmiṣṭhāya go kāmāḥ eva vayam smaḥ iti
translated: He said, Salutations to the most learned in the Veda! We are indeed desirous of cows.

original: te hocuḥ ko na imam prakṣyatīti sa hovāca vidagdhaḥ śākalyo'hamiti taṃ ha
analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ kaḥ naḥ imam prakṣyati iti sa ha uvāca vidagdhaḥ śākalyaḥ aham iti tam ha
translated: They said, Who will ask this? He said, The learned Shakala.

original: pratikhyāyovāca tvāṃ svicākalya brāhmaṇā / / /🔽sa hovāca kati devā yājñavalkyeti trayaśca trī ca śatā trayaśca trī ca sahasretyomiti
analyzed: pratikhyāya uvāca tvām svicākalya brāhmaṇā  sa ha uvāca kati devāḥ yājñavalkya iti trayaḥ ca trī ca śatā trayaḥ ca trī ca sahasrā iti om iti
translated: Having rejected him, he said, You Brahmanas indeed rejected Yajnavalkya.🔽He said, How many gods are there, Yajnavalkya? Three hundred and three, and three thousand, he said. How many? he said. Three hundred and three, and three thousand, he said. How many? he said.

original: hovāca katyeva devā yājñavalkyeti trayastriṃśadityomiti hovāca katyeva devā
analyzed: ha uvāca kati eva devāḥ yājñavalkya iti trayastriṃśat iti om iti ha uvāca kati eva devāḥ
translated: He said, How many gods are there, Yajnavalkya? Thirty-three, he said. How many? he said.

original: yājñavalkyeti traya ityomiti hovāca katyeva devā yājñavalkyeti dvāvityomiti hovāca🔽katyeva devā yājñavalkyetyadhyardha ityomiti hovāca katyeva devā yājñavalkyetyeka
analyzed: yājñavalkya iti trayaḥ iti om iti ha uvāca kati eva devāḥ yājñavalkya iti dvau iti om iti ha uvāca  kati eva devāḥ yājñavalkya iti adhyardhe iti om iti ha uvāca kati eva devāḥ yājñavalkya iti eka
translated: Yājñavalkya, how many gods are there? Three, said he. Om! How many gods are there, Yājñavalkya? Two, said he. Om! How many gods are there, Yājñavalkya? One and a half, said he. How many gods are there, Yājñavalkya? One, said he.🔽Yājñavalkya, how many gods are there? Three, said he. Om! How many gods are there, Yājñavalkya? Two, said he. Om! How many gods are there, Yājñavalkya? One and a half, said he. How many gods are there, Yājñavalkya? One, said he.

original: ityomiti hovāca katame te trayaśca trī ca śatā trayaśca trī ca sahasreti / / /
analyzed: iti om iti ha uvāca katame te trayaḥ ca trī ca śatā trayaḥ ca trī ca sahasrā iti
translated: Yajnavalkya, how many gods are there? Three, said he. Om! How many gods are there, Yajnavalkya? Two, said he. Om! How many gods are there, Yajnavalkya? One and a half, said he. Om! How many gods are there, Yajnavalkya? One, said he. Om! Who are those three and three hundred and three thousand?

original: sa hovāca mahimāna evaiṣāmete trayastriṃśattveva devā iti katame te🔽trayastriṃśadityaṣṭau vasava ekādaśa rudrā dvādaśādityāsta ekatriṃśadindraścaiva
analyzed: sa ha uvāca mahimānaḥ eva eṣām ete trayastriṃśat tu eva devāḥ iti katame te  trayastriṃśat iti aṣṭau vasavaḥ ekādaśa rudrāḥ dvādaśa ādityāḥ te ekatriṃśat indraḥ ca eva
translated: He said, These are their glories. There are thirty-three gods. Who are those thirty-three?

original: prajāpatiśca trayastrṃśāviti / / /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ ca trayastrṃśau iti
translated: He said, Eight Vasus, eleven Rudras, twelve Adityas, that makes thirty-one, and Indra and Prajapati are the thirty-third.

original: katame vasava iti agniśca pṛthivī ca vāyuścāntarikṣaṃ cādityaśca dyauśca🔽candramāśca nakṣatrāṇi caite vasava ete hīdaṃ sarvaṃ vāsayante te yadidaṃ sarvaṃ
analyzed: katame vasavaḥ iti agniḥ ca pṛthivī ca vāyuḥ ca antarikṣam ca ādityaḥ ca dyauḥ ca  candramāḥ ca nakṣatrāṇi ca ete vasavaḥ ete hi idam sarvam vāsayante te yat idam sarvam
translated: Who are the Vasus? Agni, earth, Vayu, space, Aditya, heaven,

original: vāsayante tasmādvasava iti / / /
analyzed: vāsayante tasmāt vasavaḥ iti
translated: moon, stars - these are the Vasus, for they make all this live. Since they make all this live, they are the Vasus.

original: katame rudrā iti daśeme puruṣe prāṇā ātmaikādaśaste
analyzed: katame rudrāḥ iti daśa ime puruṣe prāṇāḥ ātmā ekādaśaḥ te
translated: Who are the Rudras? These ten breaths in a person, and the self as the eleventh,

original: yadāsmānmartyācarīrādutkrāmantyatha rodayanti tadyadrodayanti tasmādrudrā iti / / /🔽katama ādityā iti dvādaśa māsāḥ saṃvatsarasyaita ādityā ete hīdaṃ sarvamādadānā
analyzed: yadā asmāt martyāḥ carīrāt utkrāmanti atha rodayanti tat yat rodayanti tasmāt rudrāḥ iti  katame ādityāḥ iti dvādaśa māsāḥ saṃvatsarasya ete ādityāḥ ete hi idam sarvam ādadānā
translated: When they depart from this mortal body, then they weep. Because they weep, therefore they are Rudras.

original: yanti te yadidaṃ sarvamādadānā yanti tasmādādityā iti / / /🔽katama indraḥ katamaḥ prajāpatiriti stanayitnurevendro yajñaḥ prajāpatiriti katama
analyzed: yanti te yat idam sarvam ādadānāḥ yanti tasmāt ādityāḥ iti  katamaḥ indraḥ katamaḥ prajāpatiḥ iti stanayitnuḥ eva indraḥ yajñaḥ prajāpatiḥ iti katama
translated: Which are the Adityas? The twelve months of the year, they are the Adityas, for they move, taking all this (universe). Since they move, taking all this, therefore they are the Adityas.

original: stanayitnurityaśaniriti katamo yajña iti paśava iti / / /🔽katame te trayo devā iti ima eva trayo lokā eṣu hīme sarve devā iti katamau tau
analyzed: stanayitnuḥ iti aśaniḥ iti katamaḥ yajñaḥ iti paśavaḥ iti  katame te trayaḥ devāḥ iti ime eva trayaḥ lokāḥ eṣu hi ime sarve devāḥ iti katamau tau
translated: Which is Indra? Which is Prajapati? The thunder is Indra, the sacrifice is Prajapati. Which is the thunder? The thunderbolt. Which is the sacrifice? The animals.

original: dvau devāvityannaṃ caiva prāṇaśceti katamo'dhyardha iti yo'yam pavata iti katama
analyzed: dvau devau iti annam ca eva prāṇaḥ ca iti katamaḥ adhyardhaḥ iti yaḥ uyam pavate iti katama
translated: Which are those three gods? These very three worlds, for in them all these gods are. Which are those two gods? Food and breath. Which is the half-and-a-quarter? He who blows here.

original: eko deva iti prāṇa iti / / /🔽sa hovāca anatipraśnyām mā devatāmatyaprākṣīḥ puretithyai mariṣyasi na te'sthīni
analyzed: ekaḥ devaḥ iti prāṇaḥ iti  sa ha uvāca anatipraśnyām mā devatām atyaprākṣīḥ purā itithyai mariṣyasi na testhīni
translated: Which is the one god? The breath.

original: cana gṛhānprāpsyantīti sa ha tathaiva mamāra tasya hāpyanyanmanyamānāḥ
analyzed: cana gṛhān prāpsyanti iti sa ha tathā eva mamāra tasya ha api anyat manyamānāḥ
translated: He said, 'You have asked about the deity that should not be asked about. Before the seventh day you will die, and your bones will not even reach your house.' He died just as he said. And others, thinking otherwise,

original: parimoṣiṇo'sthīnyapajahrustasmānnopavādī syāduta hyevaṃvitparo bhavati / / /
analyzed: parimoṣiṇaḥ usthīni apajahruḥ tasmāt na upavādī syāt uta hi evaṃvid paraḥ bhavati
translated: The Parimoṣin thieves carried off the bones; therefore one should not be a fault-finder, for he who knows thus becomes superior.

original: paśubandhena yajate paśavo vai paśubandhaḥ sa yatpaśubandhena yajate🔽paśumānasānīti tena gṛheṣu yajeta gṛheṣu paśūnbadhnā iti tena suyavase yajeta
analyzed: paśubandhena yajate paśavaḥ vai paśubandhaḥ sa yat paśubandhena yajate  paśu mānasāni iti tena gṛheṣu yajeta gṛheṣu paśūn badhnāḥ iti tena su yavase yajeta
translated: One performs the animal sacrifice. The animal sacrifice is indeed the animals. In that one performs the animal sacrifice,🔽(it is) thinking 'I shall become possessed of animals.' With it one should sacrifice in the house, thinking 'I shall bind the animals in the house.' With it one should sacrifice in a good pasture,

original: suyavase paśūnbadhnā iti jīryanti ha vai juhvato yajamānasyāgnayo'gnīnjīryato'nu
analyzed: su yavase paśūn badhnai iti jīryanti ha vai juhvataḥ yajamānasya agnayā ugnīn jīryataḥ nu
translated: thinking 'I shall bind the animals in a good pasture.' The fires of the sacrificer who offers become worn out. After the fires have become worn out,

original: yajamāno yajamānamanu gṛhāśca paśavaśca / / /
analyzed: yajamānaḥ yajamānam anu gṛhāḥ ca paśavaḥ ca
translated: the sacrificer, the house, and the animals (become worn out).

original: sa yatpaśubandhena yajate agnīnevaitatpunarṇavānkurute'gnīnām punarṇavatāmanu
analyzed: sa yat paśubandhena yajate agnīn eva etat punarṇavān kurute ignīnām punarṇavatām anu
translated: In that he performs the animal sacrifice, he makes the fires new again. After the fires have been made new again,

original: yajamānamanu gṛhāśca paśavaścāyuṣyo ha vā asyaiṣa ātmaniṣkrayaṇo bhavati
analyzed: yajamānam anu gṛhāḥ ca paśavaḥ ca āyuṣyaḥ ha vai asya eṣa ātma niṣkrayaṇaḥ bhavati
translated: the sacrificer, the house, and the animals (become new again). This (sacrifice) becomes for him an atonement for the self, for life.

original: māṃsīyanti ha vai juhvato yajamānasyāgnayaste yajamānameva dhyāyanti yajamānaṃ
analyzed: māṃsīyanti ha vai juhvataḥ yajamānasya agnayaḥ te yajamānam eva dhyāyanti yajamānam
translated: The fires of the sacrificer who offers become worn out. They think only of the sacrificer,

original: saṃkalpayanti pacanti vā anyeṣvagniṣu vṛthāmāṃsamathaiteṣāṃ nāto'nyā māṃsāśā
analyzed: saṃkalpayanti pacanti vai anyeṣu agniṣu vṛthāmāṃsam atha eteṣām na atonyā māṃsa āśā
translated: they intend the sacrificer. They cook the useless meat in the other fires, but for these there is no other hope of meat than this.

original: vidyate yasyo caite bhavanti / / /
analyzed: vidyate yasya u ca ete bhavanti
translated: For whom these (fires) exist, they become worn out.

original: sa yatpaśubandhena yajate ātmānamevaitanniṣkrīṇīte vīreṇa vīraṃ vīro hi
analyzed: sa yat paśubandhena yajate ātmānam eva etat niṣkrīṇīte vīreṇa vīram vīraḥ hi
translated: In that he sacrifices with the animal sacrifice, he redeems himself, the hero with the hero, for the hero is the animal.

original: paśurvīro yajamāna etadu ha vai paramannādyaṃ yanmāṃsaṃ sa
analyzed: paśuḥ vīraḥ yajamānaḥ etat u ha vai param annādyam yat māṃsam sa
translated: In that he sacrifices with the animal sacrifice, he redeems himself by the hero, for the hero is the animal, and the sacrificer is the hero. Now that is the highest food, to wit, flesh;

original: paramasyaivānnādyasyāttā bhavati taṃ vai saṃvatsaro nānījanamatīyādāyurvai
analyzed: paramasya eva annādyasya attā bhavati tam vai saṃvatsaraḥ na anījanam atīyāt āyuḥ vai
translated: he becomes the eater of the highest food. He should not let a year pass by without his having sacrificed; for the year is life;

original: saṃvatsara āyurevaitadamṛtamātmandhatte / / /
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ āyuḥ eva etat amṛtam ātman dhatte
translated: he thus takes to himself life, immortality.

original: haviryajñavidho ha vā anyaḥ paśubandhaḥ savavidho'nyaḥ sa haiṣa haviryajñavidho
analyzed: haviḥ yajña vidhaḥ ha vai anyaḥ paśubandhaḥ sava vidhaḥ nyaḥ sa ha eṣa haviḥ yajña vidhaḥ
translated: The animal sacrifice is performed in the manner of the sacrifice with oblations, and in the manner of the Savanas. Now that is the sacrifice with oblations

original: yasminvratamupanayati yasminnapaḥ praṇayati yasminpūrṇapātraṃ ninayati
analyzed: yasmin vratam upanayati yasmin apaḥ praṇayati yasmin pūrṇapātram ninayati
translated: in which he brings the vow, in which he pours out the water, in which he pours out the full (oblation),

original: yasminviṣṇukramānkramayatyatha haiṣa savavidho yasminnetāni na kriyante / / /🔽tadāhuḥ iṣṭiḥ iti mahāyajña iti ha brūyādiṣṭiṃ vai tarhi
analyzed: yasmin viṣṇukramān kramayati atha ha eṣa savavidhaḥ yasmin etāni na kriyante  tat āhuḥ iṣṭiḥ paśubandhāḥ mahāyajñāḥ iti mahāyajñaḥ iti ha brūyāt iṣṭim vai tarhi
translated: in which he steps the Vishnu strides. Now that is the Savana in which these (rites) are not performed.

original: paśubandhamakarvyenamakṛkṣathā ityenam brūyāt / / /
analyzed: paśubandham akarvī enam akṛkṣathāḥ iti enam brūyāt
translated: As to that they say, 'It is an Isti.' He should say, 'It is a great sacrifice.' 'You have performed an Isti, you have slaughtered the animal,' so he should say to him.

original: tasya prayājā eva prātaḥsavanam anuyājāstṛtīyasavanam puroḍāśa eva mādhyandinaṃ
analyzed: tasya prayājāḥ eva prātaḥsavanam anuyājāḥ tṛtīyasavanam puroḍāśaḥ eva mādhyandinam
translated: Its fore-sacrifices are the morning-service, its after-sacrifices the third service, and the sacrificial cake the midday-service.

original: savanam / / /
analyzed: savanam
translated: the pressing...🔽...

original: taddhaike vapāyāṃ hutāyāṃ dakṣiṇā nayanti tadu tathā na kuryādyo hainaṃ tatra
analyzed: tat ha eke vapāyām hutāyām dakṣiṇāḥ nayanti tat u tathā na kuryāt yaḥ ha enam tatra
translated: Some lead the sacrificial fee away after the omentum has been offered; let him not do so in that way; for he who would lead it away after the omentum has been offered would lead away the sacrifice.

original: brūyādbahirdhā nvā ayam prāṇebhyo dakṣiṇā anaiṣīnna prāṇānadadakṣadandho vā🔽srāmo vā badhiro vā pakṣahato vā bhaviṣyatītīśvaro ha tathaiva syāt / / /🔽itthameva kuryāt puroḍāśeḍāyāmevopahūtāyāṃ dakṣiṇā nayedaindro vā ayam🔽madhyataḥ prāṇa imamevaitadaindram madhyataḥ prāṇaṃ🔽dakṣiṇābhirdakṣayatyaindraṃ vai mādhyandinaṃ savanam mādhyandine vai savane
analyzed: brūyāt bahirdhā nvai ayam prāṇebhyaḥ dakṣiṇāḥ anaiṣīt na prāṇān adadakṣat andhaḥ vā  srāmaḥ vā badhiraḥ vā pakṣa hataḥ vā bhaviṣyati iti īśvaraḥ ha tathā eva syāt  ittham eva kuryāt puroḍāśa iḍāyām eva upahūtāyām dakṣiṇāḥ nayet aindraḥ vai ayam  madhyatas prāṇaḥ imam eva etat aindram madhyatas prāṇam  dakṣiṇābhiḥ dakṣayati aindram vai mādhyandinam savanam mādhyandine vai savane
translated: Now some lead the sacrificial fee away after the omentum has been offered. Let him not do so. For if anyone were to say of him, 'Surely, he has led the sacrificial fee away from the breaths, he has not given the breaths; he will become blind, or lame, or deaf, or paralysed on one side,' he would be liable to become so.

original: dakṣiṇā nīyante tasmātpuroḍāśeḍāyāmevopahūtāyāṃ dakṣiṇā nayet / / /
analyzed: dakṣiṇāḥ nīyante tasmāt puroḍāśa iḍāyām eva upahūtāyām dakṣiṇāḥ nayet
translated: Let him do it in this way. Let him lead the sacrificial fee away after the omentum has been offered, and the Puroruk formula has been pronounced. The breath in the middle is connected with Indra. He makes this breath in the middle, which is connected with Indra, strong by means of the sacrificial fee. The midday pressing is connected with Indra. The sacrificial fee is led away at the midday pressing. Therefore let him lead the sacrificial fee away after the omentum has been offered, and the Puroruk formula has been pronounced.

original: tadāhuḥ adhvaryo yaddīkṣitasya nānavabhṛtho'vakalpate kvainamadidīkṣa
analyzed: tat āhuḥ adhvaryo yat dīkṣitasya na anavabhṛthā uvakalpate kva enam adidīkṣa
translated: As to this they say, 'Adhvaryu, if the final bath is not performed for one who has been consecrated, where is he consecrated?'

original: ityāvabhṛthādanūddṛṃheyuradhvaryuśca pratiprasthātā ca hotā ca maitrāvaruṇaśca
analyzed: iti ā avabhṛthāt anūddṛṃheyuḥ adhvaryuḥ ca pratiprasthātā ca hotā ca maitrāvaruṇaḥ ca
translated: The Adhvaryu, the Pratiprasthâtri, the Hotri, and the Maitrâvarukya should pile up (the altar) after the final bath.

original: brahmā cāgnīdhraścaitairvā eṣa ṣaḍḍhotā tamanudrutya ṣaḍḍhotāraṃ
analyzed: brahmā ca agnīdhraḥ ca etaiḥ vai eṣa ṣaḍḍhotā tam anudrutya ṣaḍḍhotāram
translated: And Agni is the Agnidhra. With these he is the six-hotar. Having followed him, he offers to the six-hotar.

original: juhotyekāmāhutiṃ kṛtvā pañca vājyā dyauṣpṛṣṭhamantarikṣamātmāṅgairyajñam🔽pṛthivīṃ śarīraiḥ vācaspate'cidrayā vācācidrayā juhvā divi devāvṛdhaṃ
analyzed: juhoti ekām āhutim kṛtvā pañca vājyāḥ dyauḥ pṛṣṭham antarikṣam ātma aṅgaiḥ yajñam  pṛthivīm śarīraiḥ vācaspate cidrayā vācā acidrayā juhvā divi devāvṛdham
translated: Having made one oblation, he offers five Vajapeya oblations. The sky is the back, the atmosphere the body, with the limbs the sacrifice,

original: hotrāmairayatsvāheti saiva dīkṣā / / /
analyzed: hotrām airayat svāhā iti sā eva dīkṣā
translated: the earth with the bodies. O lord of speech, with the unmoving speech, with the unmoving ladle, he made the gods prosper in the sky with the oblations.🔽That is the initiation.

original: tadāhuḥ adhvaryo yaddīkṣitasya nānavabhṛtho'vakalpate
analyzed: tat āhuḥ adhvaryo yat dīkṣitasya na anavabhṛthā uvakalpate
translated: They say: O Adhvaryu, if the final bath is not possible for the initiated,

original: kvainamavabhṛthamavaneṣyasīti sa yaddhṛdayaśūlena caranti sa haivaitasyāvabhṛthaḥ / / /
analyzed: kva enam avabhṛtham avaneṣyasi iti sa yat hṛdayaśūlena caranti sa ha eva etasya avabhṛthaḥ
translated: where will you perform his final bath? When they perform with the heart-spike, that is his final bath.

original: madhuko ha smāha paiṅgyaḥ visomena vā eke paśubandhena yajante sasomenaike
analyzed: madhukaḥ ha sma āha paiṅgyaḥ visomena vai eke paśubandhena yajante sa somena eke
translated: Madhuka Paiṅgya said: Some perform the animal sacrifice without Soma, some with Soma.

original: divi vai soma āsīttaṃ gāyatrī vayo bhūtvāharattasya yatparṇamacidyata tatparṇasya🔽parṇatvamiti nvā etadbrāhmaṇamudyate visomena vā eke paśubandhena yajante
analyzed: divi vai somaḥ āsīt tam gāyatrī vayaḥ bhūtvā aharat tasya yat parṇam acidyata tat parṇasya  parṇa tvam iti nvai etat brāhmaṇam udyate visomena vai eke paśubandhena yajante
translated: Soma was in the sky. Gayatri, becoming a bird, brought it down. What leaf of it was cut off, that is the leaf🔽of the Palasha tree. This is the Brahmana. Some perform the animal sacrifice without Soma,

original: sasomenaike sa haiṣa visomena paśubandhena yajate yo'nyam pālāśādyūpaṃ
analyzed: sa somena eke sa ha eṣa visomena paśubandhena yajate yonyam pālāśāt yūpam
translated: some with Soma. He indeed performs the animal sacrifice without Soma who uses a sacrificial post of any wood other than Palasha.

original: kurute'tha haiṣa sasomena paśubandhena yajate yaḥ pālāśaṃ yūpaṃ kurute
analyzed: kuruta itha ha eṣa sa somena paśubandhena yajate yaḥ pālāśam yūpam kurute
translated: Now, indeed, he who performs the animal sacrifice with Soma makes a sacrificial post of Palasha wood.

original: tasmātpālāśameva yūpaṃ kurvīta / / /
analyzed: tasmāt pālāśam eva yūpam kurvīta
translated: Therefore one should make a sacrificial post of Palasha wood.

original: sa ya eṣa bahusāraḥ sa hāpaśavyastasmāttādṛśam paśukāmo yūpaṃ na kurvītātha ya
analyzed: sa yaḥ eṣa bahu sāraḥ sa ha a paśavyaḥ tasmāt tādṛśam paśu kāmaḥ yūpam na kurvīta atha yaḥ
translated: Now, that which is very pithy is not suitable for cattle. Therefore one who desires cattle should not make a sacrificial post of such a kind. Then that which is light and easily pierced

original: eṣa phalguprāsahaḥ sa ha paśavyastasmāttādṛśam paśukāmo yūpaṃ kurvīta / / /
analyzed: eṣa phalguprāsahaḥ sa ha paśavyaḥ tasmāt tādṛśam paśu kāmaḥ yūpam kurvīta
translated: is suitable for cattle. Therefore one who desires cattle should make a sacrificial post of such a kind.

original: atha yasyaitadvakrasya sataḥ śūlaivāgram bhavati sa ha kapotī nāma sa yo ha
analyzed: atha yasya etat vakrasya sataḥ śūlā eva agram bhavati sa ha kapotī nāma sa yaḥ ha
translated: Now, that which has a bent top like a spear is called the dove. He who makes a sacrificial post of such a kind

original: tādṛśaṃ yūpaṃ kurute purā hāyuṣo'muṃ lokameti tasmāttādṛśamāyuṣkāmo yūpaṃ na🔽kurvīta / / /
analyzed: tādṛśam yūpam kurute purā ha āyuṣā umum lokam eti tasmāt tādṛśam āyuṣkāmaḥ yūpam na  kurvīta
translated: goes to the other world before his life is over. Therefore one who desires long life should not make a sacrificial post of such a kind.

original: atha ya eṣa ānataḥ upariṣṭādapanato madhye so'śanāyai rūpaṃ sa yo ha tādṛśaṃ
analyzed: atha yaḥ eṣaḥ ānataḥ upariṣṭāt apanataḥ madhye sa uśanāyai rūpam sa yaḥ ha tādṛśam
translated: Now, that which is bent downwards above and bent downwards in the middle is a form of hunger. He who makes a sacrificial post of such a kind

original: yūpaṃ kurute'śanāyukā hāsya bhāryā bhavanti tasmāttādṛśamannādyakāmo yūpaṃ na
analyzed: yūpam kuruta īśanāyukāḥ ha asya bhāryāḥ bhavanti tasmāt tādṛśam annādya kāmaḥ yūpam na
translated: his wife becomes hungry. Therefore one who desires food should not make a sacrificial post of such a kind.

original: kurvītātha ya eṣa ānata upariṣṭādupanato madhye so'nnādyasya rūpaṃ
analyzed: kurvīta atha yaḥ eṣaḥ ānataḥ upariṣṭāt upanataḥ madhye sa unnādyasya rūpam
translated: Now, that which is bent downwards above and bent upwards in the middle is a form of food.

original: tasmāttādṛśamannādyakāmo yūpaṃ kurvīta / / /
analyzed: tasmāt tādṛśam annādya kāmaḥ yūpam kurvīta
translated: Therefore one who desires food should make a sacrificial post of such a kind.

original: sa yatpaśunā yakṣyamāṇaḥ ekāratniṃ yūpaṃ kuruta imameva tena lokaṃ jayatyatha🔽yaddvyaratnimantarikṣalokameva tena jayatyatha yattryaratniṃ divameva tena
analyzed: sa yat paśunā yakṣyamāṇaḥ eka aratnim yūpam kurute imam eva tena lokam jayati atha  yat dvi aratnim antarikṣa lokam eva tena jayati atha yat tri aratnim divam eva tena
translated: When, about to sacrifice with an animal, he makes the sacrificial post one cubit (long), thereby he conquers this very world. Then,

original: jayatyatha yaccaturartniṃ diśa eva tena jayati sa vā eṣa tryaratnirvaiva caturaratnirvā
analyzed: jayati atha yat catur artnim diśaḥ eva tena jayati sa vai eṣa tri aratniḥ vā eva catur aratniḥ vā
translated: when it is two cubits (long), he conquers thereby the world of the atmosphere. Then, when it is three cubits (long), he conquers thereby heaven. Then, when it is four cubits (long), he conquers thereby the quarters. It is either three or four cubits long,

original: paśubandhayūpo bhavatyatha yo'ta ūrdhvaḥ saumyasyaiva so'dhvarasya / / /
analyzed: paśubandha yūpaḥ bhavati atha yaḥ ūtaḥ ūrdhvaḥ saumyasya eva sa udhvarasya
translated: the sacrificial post for the animal sacrifice. Then, what is above that, that is of the Soma sacrifice.

original: tadāhuḥ yajedājyabhāgau iti yajedityāhuścakṣuṣī vā ete yajñasya yadājyabhāgau
analyzed: tat āhuḥ yajet ājyabhāgau nau iti yajet iti āhuḥ cakṣuṣī vai ete yajñasya yat ājyabhāgau
translated: Regarding that, they say: 'One should offer the portions of ghee.' 'One should offer,' they say. 'For the portions of ghee are the eyes of the sacrifice.

original: kimṛte puruṣaścakṣurbhyāṃ syāditi yāvadvai bhāginaṃ svena bhāgadheyena na🔽nirbhajantyanirbhakto vai sa tāvanmanyate'tha yadaiva taṃ svena bhāgadheyena🔽nirbhajantyathaiva sa nirbhakto manyate sa yatraitaddhotānvāhāsnā rakṣaḥ
analyzed: kim ṛte puruṣaḥ cakṣurbhyām syāt iti yāvat vai bhāginam svena bhāgadheyena na  nirbhajanti a nirbhaktaḥ vai sa tāvat manyatetha yadā eva tam svena bhāgadheyena  nirbhajanti atha eva sa nirbhaktaḥ manyate sa yatra etat hotā anvāha asnā rakṣaḥ
translated: Why should a man be without eyes?' As long as they do not offer to the partaker his own portion,🔽he thinks, 'I am not offered to.' But when they do offer to him his own portion,

original: saṃsṛjatāditi tadenaṃ svena bhāgadheyena nirbhajati / / /
analyzed: saṃsṛjatāt iti tat enam svena bhāgadheyena nirbhajati
translated: then he thinks, 'I am offered to.' When the Hotri recites there, 'O Rakshas, be united!' then he offers him his own portion.

original: etadvai paśoḥ saṃjñapyamānasya hṛdayaṃ śukṣamavaiti hṛdayācūlaṃ tadye saha
analyzed: etat vai paśoḥ saṃjñapyamānasya hṛdayam śukṣam avaiti hṛdayācūlam tat ye saha
translated: Now, when the animal is being slaughtered, the vital sap goes out of its heart, and the heart-spit; therefore they should not eat of the heart and the heart-spit.

original: hṛdayena paśuṃ śrapayanti punaḥ paśuṃ śuganuviṣpandeta pārśvata evainatkāṣṭhe🔽pratṛdya śrapayet / / /🔽upastṛṇīta ājyam tatpṛthivyai rūpaṃ karoti hiraṇyaśakalamavadadhāti tadagne rūpaṃ🔽karoti vapāmavadadhāti tadantarikṣasya rūpaṃ karoti hiraṇyaśakalamavadadhāti
analyzed: hṛdayena paśum śrapayanti punar paśum śuc anuviṣpandeta pārśvatas eva enat kāṣṭhe  pratṛdya śrapayet  upastṛṇīte ājyam tat pṛthivyai rūpam karoti hiraṇya śakalam avadadhāti tat agneḥ rūpam  karoti vapām avadadhāti tat antarikṣasya rūpam karoti hiraṇya śakalam avadadhāti
translated: For the vital sap of the animal, when being killed, goes out from the heart, and the heart is the topmost (part of the animal). Therefore, those who cook the animal together with the heart, would cause the animal to be affected by pain again. He should cook it, having cut it off from the side, on a piece of wood.🔽He should spread clarified butter (on the spit), that is the form of the earth he makes. He puts a piece of gold on (the spit), that is the form of Agni he makes.

original: tadādityasya rūpaṃ karotyatha yadupariṣṭādabhighārayati taddivo rūpaṃ karoti sā vā
analyzed: tat ādityasya rūpam karoti atha yat upariṣṭāt abhighārayati tat divaḥ rūpam karoti sā vā
translated: He puts the omentum on (the spit), that is the form of the atmosphere he makes. He puts a piece of gold on (the spit), that is the form of the sun he makes. Then when he bastes (the omentum) above, that is the form of the sky he makes.

original: eṣā pañcāvattā vapā bhavati pāṅkto yajñaḥ pāṅktaḥ paśuḥ pañcartavaḥ saṃvatsarasya
analyzed: eṣā pañca avattā vapā bhavati pāṅktaḥ yajñaḥ pāṅktaḥ paśuḥ pañcā ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsarasya
translated: Now that omentum is five-sided, the sacrifice is fivefold, the animal is fivefold, there are five seasons in the year,

original: tasmātpañcāvattā vapā bhavati / / /
analyzed: tasmāt pañca avattā vapā bhavati
translated: therefore the omentum is five-sided.

original: tadyathā ha vai idaṃ rathacakraṃ vā kaulālacakraṃ vāpratiṣṭhitaṃ krandedevaṃ
analyzed: tat yathā ha vai idam ratha cakram vā kaulāla cakram vā a pratiṣṭhitam krandet evam
translated: Just as this wheel of a chariot or a potter's wheel, when not fixed, would creak,

original: haiveme lokā adhruvā apratiṣṭhitā āsuḥ / / /
analyzed: ha eva ime lokāḥ adhruvāḥ a pratiṣṭhitāḥ āsuḥ
translated: so indeed these worlds were unstable and unfixed.

original: sa ha prajāpatirīkṣāṃ cakre kathaṃ nvime lokā dhruvāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ syuriti sa
analyzed: sa ha prajāpatiḥ īkṣām cakre katham nu ime lokāḥ dhruvāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ syuḥ iti sa
translated: He, Prajapati, considered how these worlds might be firmly established.

original: ebhiścaiva parvatairnadībhiścemāmadṛṃhadvayobhiśca marīcibhiścāntarikṣaṃ
analyzed: ebhiḥ ca eva parvataiḥ nadībhiḥ ca imām adṛṃhat vayobhiḥ ca marīcibhiḥ ca antarikṣam
translated: He established this (earth) by these mountains and rivers, and the atmosphere by the rays and clouds,

original: jīmūtaiśca nakṣatraiśca divam / / /
analyzed: jīmūtaiḥ ca nakṣatraiḥ ca divam
translated: and the sky by the clouds and stars.

original: sa maha iti vyāharat paśavo vai mahastasmādyasyaite bahavo bhavanti🔽bhūyiṣṭhamasya kule mahīyante bahavo ha vā asyaite bhavanti bhūyiṣṭhaṃ hāsya🔽kule mahīyante tasmādyadyenamāyatanādbādheranvā pra vā yāpayeyuragnihotraṃ
analyzed: sa mahaḥ iti vyāharat paśavaḥ vai mahaḥ tasmāt yasya ete bahavaḥ bhavanti  bhūyiṣṭham asya kule mahīyante bahavaḥ ha vai asya ete bhavanti bhūyiṣṭham ha asya  kule mahīyante tasmāt yadi enam āyatanāt bādheran vā pra vā yāpayeyuḥ agnihotram
translated: He uttered the word 'maha' (great). 'Maha' means cattle. Therefore, in the family of him who has many of these,🔽many are honoured most in his family. Therefore, if they were to drive him away from his abode or banish him,

original: hutvā maha ityupatiṣṭheta prati prajayā paśubhistiṣṭhati nāyatanāccyavate / / /
analyzed: hutvā mahaḥ iti upatiṣṭheta prati prajayā paśubhiḥ tiṣṭhati na āyatanāt cyavate
translated: after offering the Agnihotra, he should worship with the word 'maha'. He is established with offspring and cattle. He does not fall away from his abode.

original: catvāro ha vā agnayaḥ āhita uddhṛtaḥ prahṛto vihṛto'yameva loka āhito'ntarikṣaloka🔽uddhṛto dyauṣprahṛto diśo vihṛto'gnirevāhito vāyuruddhṛta ādityaḥ
analyzed: catvāraḥ ha vai agnayaḥ āhitaḥ uddhṛtaḥ prahṛtaḥ vihṛtaḥ ayam eva lokaḥ āhitaḥ untarikṣa loka  uddhṛtaḥ dyauḥ prahṛtaḥ diśaḥ vihṛtaḥ agniḥ eva āhitaḥ vāyuḥ uddhṛtaḥ ādityaḥ
translated: There are four kinds of Agni: the deposited, the raised, the thrown forward, and the scattered. This very world is the deposited,🔽the atmosphere is the raised, the sky is the thrown forward, and the quarters are the scattered. Agni itself is the deposited, Vayu is the raised,

original: prahṛtaścandramā vihṛto gārhapatya evāhita āhavanīya uddhṛto'tha
analyzed: prahṛtaḥ candramāḥ vihṛtaḥ gārhapatyaḥ eva āhitaḥ āhavanīyaḥ uddhṛtā utha
translated: the sun is the thrown forward, and the moon is the scattered. The Garhapatya itself is the deposited, the Ahavaniya is the raised,🔽and the Dakshina fire is the thrown forward.

original: yametamāhavanīyātprāñcam praṇayanti sa prahṛto'tha yametamudañcam
analyzed: yam etam āhavanīyāt prāñcam praṇayanti sa prahṛtā utha yam etam udañcam
translated: That which they lead forward from the Āhavanīya to the east, that is the one that is struck. And that which they bring from the north

original: paśuśrapaṇāyāharanti yaṃ copayaṅbhyaḥ sa vihṛtastasmātprahārye'gnau paśubandhena🔽yajeta / / /
analyzed: paśuśrapaṇāya āharanti yam ca upayaṅbhyaḥ sa vihṛtaḥ tasmāt prahārya ignau paśubandhena  yajeta
translated: to the animal's cooking place and from the Upayamanas, that is the one that is carried around. Therefore one should sacrifice with the animal sacrifice in the fire that is to be struck.

original: tadāhuḥ kiṃdevatya eṣa paśuḥ syāditi prājāpatyaḥ syādityāhuḥ prajāpatirvā
analyzed: tat āhuḥ kiṃdevatyaḥ eṣa paśuḥ syāt iti prājāpatyaḥ syāt iti āhuḥ prajāpatiḥ vā
translated: Regarding that, they say: To which deity should this animal belong? It should belong to Prajāpati, they say. For Prajāpati

original: etamagre'bhyapaśyattasmātprājāpatya evaiṣa paśuḥ syāditi / / /🔽atho apyāhuḥ saurya evaiṣa paśuḥ syāditi tasmādetasminnastamite paśavo badhyante
analyzed: etam agrebhyaḥ apaśyat tasmāt prājāpatyaḥ eva eṣa paśuḥ syāt iti  atha u api āhuḥ sauryaḥ eva eṣa paśuḥ syāt iti tasmāt etasmin astamite paśavaḥ badhyante
translated: saw it first. Therefore this animal should belong to Prajāpati.🔽Then they also say: This animal should belong to Surya. Therefore, after it has set, animals are bound.

original: badhnantyekānyathāgoṣṭhameka upasamāyanti tasmātsaurya evaiṣa paśuḥ syāditi / / /
analyzed: badhnanti ekān yathāgoṣṭham eke upasamāyanti tasmāt sauryaḥ eva eṣa paśuḥ syāt iti
translated: They bind some, others go to the cow pen. Therefore this animal should belong to Surya.

original: vindedapi svayamevānuparikrāmamanuprāṇyātsa sarvamāyuretyā haiva jarāyai jīvati / / /🔽sa prāṇamevāgnerādatta tasmādeṣa nānupadhmāto nānupajvalito jvalatyātto hyasya
analyzed: vindet api svayam eva anuparikrāmam anuprāṇyāt sa sarvam āyuḥ etya ā ha eva jarāyai jīvati 🔽sa prāṇam eva agneḥ ādatta tasmāt eṣa na an upadhmātaḥ na an upajvalitaḥ jvalati āttaḥ hi asya
translated: one should breathe upon him oneself while moving around. He lives his full life. He lives until old age.

original: prāṇa ā ha vai dviṣato bhrātṛvyasya prāṇaṃ datte ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ ā ha vai dviṣataḥ bhrātṛvyasya prāṇam datte yaḥ evam veda
translated: He gives the breath of his hateful enemy into his own mouth, who knows this.

original: rūpameva vāyorādatta tasmādetasya lelayata ivaivopaśṛṇvanti na tvenam
analyzed: rūpam eva vāyoḥ ādatta tasmāt etasya lelayataḥ iva eva upaśṛṇvanti na tu enam
translated: He took away the form of the wind; therefore they hear it as if it were moving, but they do not see it.

original: paśyantyāttaṃ hyasya rūpamā ha vai dviṣato bhrātṛvyasya rūpaṃ datte ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: paśyanti āttam hi asya rūpam ā ha vai dviṣataḥ bhrātṛvyasya rūpam datte yaḥ evam veda
translated: He gives the form of his hateful enemy into his own mouth, who knows this.

original: cittameva puruṣasyādatta tasmādāhurdevacittaṃ tvāvatu mā manuṣyacittamityāttaṃ
analyzed: cittam eva puruṣasya ādatta tasmāt āhuḥ deva cittam tvā avatu mā manuṣya cittam iti āttam
translated: He took away the mind of man; therefore they say, 'May the mind of the gods protect thee, not the mind of men,' for his mind is taken away.

original: hyasya cittamā ha vai dviṣato bhrātṛvyasya cittaṃ datte ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: hi asya cittam ā ha vai dviṣataḥ bhrātṛvyasya cittam datte yaḥ evam veda
translated: He gives the mind of his hateful enemy into his own mouth, who knows this.

translated: He took away the eye of cattle; therefore they, as it were, do not see when they are looked at,

analyzed: cakṣuḥ tat te yaḥ evam veda
translated: but when they smell at each other, then they know, for their eye is taken away. He gives the eye of his hateful enemy into his own mouth, who knows this.

analyzed: bhāti āttā hi asya bhās ā ha vai dviṣataḥ bhrātṛvyasya bhām datte yaḥ evam veda

original: tadyadādatta tasmādādityaḥ / / /
analyzed: tat yat ādatta tasmāt ādityaḥ
translated: In that he took it, therefore it is the Āditya.

analyzed: cakre kā iha prāyaścittiḥ iti te ha ūcuḥ na iha prāyaścittiḥ asti khaṇḍikaḥ eva audbhāriḥ asya

analyzed: bhavanti atha eṣām pṛṣṭīḥ apiśīrya pacāmahe kṛṣṇājinam me grīvāsu ābaddham iti eva

original: medamadhṛṣo' miti / / /
analyzed: mā idam adhṛṣaḥ abhyavasyantu m iti
translated: It is not so.

analyzed: na iti ha uvāca samrāḍdughām vai me bhagavaḥ śārdūlaḥ uvadhīt sa yadi aha me vakṣyasi
translated: He said: Venerable sir, a tiger killed my milking cow. If you will tell me,

analyzed: samāpsyāmi yadi u mā mārayiṣyasi yajñam vikṛṣṭam anu vikrakṣye iti
translated: If you will not kill me, I will complete the sacrifice, and you will share in the sacrifice that has been performed.'

translated: He said, 'Should I invite those who are to be invited?' Having invited them, he said, 'If I tell him🔽this, his offspring will be here, not mine. I will not be in the world. If

analyzed: vai asmai na vakṣyāmi mama eva idam prajā bhaviṣyati na amuṣya lokī tu asau
translated: I do not tell him, my offspring will be here, not his. He will not be in

analyzed: tasmai u ha etat uvāca spṛtīḥ hutvā anyām ājata iti brūtāt sā te samrāḍdughā syāt iti
translated: Therefore he said to him, 'Having offered the oblations, say Bring another. That will be your milking as emperor.'

original: candrātte mana spṛṇomi svāhā sūryātte cakṣu spṛṇomi svāhā vātātte prāṇāntspṛṇomi
analyzed: candrāt te manaḥ spṛṇomi svāhā sūryāt te cakṣuḥ spṛṇomi svāhā vātāt te prāṇān spṛṇomi
translated: From the moon I restore your mind, Svâhâ! From the sun I restore your eye, Svâhâ! From the wind I restore your breath,

original: svāhā digbhyaste śrotraṃ spṛṇomi svāhādbhyaste lohitaṃ spṛṇomi svāhā pṛthivyai te
analyzed: svāhā digbhyaḥ te śrotram spṛṇomi svāhā adbhyaḥ te lohitam spṛṇomi svāhā pṛthivyai te
translated: Svâhâ! From the quarters I restore your ear, Svâhâ! From the waters I restore your blood, Svâhâ! From the earth I restore your body,🔽Svâhâ!

original: śarīraṃ spṛṇomi svāhetyathānyāmājateti brūtātsā te samrāḍdughā syāditi tato haiva sa
analyzed: śarīram spṛṇomi svāhā iti atha anyām ājata iti brūtāt sā te samrāḍdughā syāt iti tatas ha eva sa
translated: 'I grasp the body with Svâhâ!' Then let him say, 'Bring another!'--'Let that be thy universal milking-bowl!' Thereupon he indeed became quiet.

original: utsasāda kaiśinīrevemā apyetarhi prajā jāyante
analyzed: utsasāda kaiśinīḥ eva imāḥ api etarhi prajāḥ jāyante
translated: And even now these creatures are born from the Kâshikîs.
